loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, D. 50 años, es una madre soltera muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en la casa D. su madre Doña Cirila D. 76 años, tiene 5 hijos pero actualmente solo vive con 3, sus otros dos hijos ya tiene familia y se mantienen por si solos. Todos los días Nelly sale junto a su inseparable carretilla a vender sus deliciosas golosinas, ella se ubica en las puertas del colegio “Santa Tereza” D. la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. tiene muchos clientes, es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes D. comprar más D. lo que tenían que comprar. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol todos los días. Para el futuro, espera juntar más dinero para poner una tienda D. abarrotes donD. pueda atender a sus clientes con más tranquilidad. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos D. todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en: Nelly, age 50, is a very loving and hard-working single mother.  She lives in the house of her mother, Doña Cirila, age 76.  She has 5 children, but at present only 3 live with her.  Her other two children already have their own family and live on their own.  Every day Nelly leaves along with her inseparable cart to sell her delicious snacks.  She sells by the doors of the “Santa Tereza” school of the city of Tarma, where she has many clients.  She is a very persuasive saleswoman and always convinces her clients to buy more than they have to buy.  What she likes most about her work is to converse with her neighboring salespeople. She has been doing this activity for 9 years and considers the most difficult aspect of the work is to have to remain under the hot sun every day.  For the future, she hopes to save more money to open a convenience store where she can attend to her clients with more tranquility.  This it is her ninth loan with MFP.  She understands that she has to make all her payments on time.  She is a supportive and very happy associate of her communal bank.  With the six hundred new soles she requests, she will buy more snacks in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more snacks to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Fullah Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the Fullah group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan in order to invest in their businesses. 

Zainab B. is the leader of this group. Zainab is 36 years old and married with four children, one in primary school and three in secondary school. Zainab sells soap, milk, sugar and butter and has been doing this for six years now. With the help of this loan, Zainab will buy more of these goods at wholesale prices to add to her inventory.

loans.use: To buy soap, milk, sugar and butter to sell.

loans.name: Lucrecia Carcueva Group's

texts.en: To make a living, Mrs. Lucrecia C. is presently engaged in housekeeping and buying and selling RTW [Ready to Wear clothes]. She is 43 years old, married and blessed with eight children: two married, two grown-up and four school-aged children. They are from the Barangay of Banadero, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She’s been engaged in her work for three years already. She’s earning an average of not less than 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Lucrecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lucrecia is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities, and has successfully repaid a loan of 3,000 PHP. She is now requesting a second loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to buy livestock feed and other supplies. She joined the program because she is very much interested in the savings, insurance and other benefits offered by Paglaum MPC. Lucrecia is the leader of a two member group accessing a loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Lucrecia C.’s Group". About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 51 years old and married with three children. Gleceria works very hard to provide for them.

Gleceria runs a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Gleceria has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of fish such us dried squid, tabagak, palad etc. Gleceria also earns income from sewing/tailoring.

In the future, Gleceria would like to put up a dried fish stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 39 años, es una mujer trabajadora que brindó apoyo, educación y alimentos a sus dos hijos: Franklin e Elisabeth, sola. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Paucarmarca. La principal actividad económica a la que se dedica desde los 16 años, es la agricultura, sus cultivos constan de arveja, papa y habas; los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos ubicados a las afueras de su localidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte del tiempo en el campo, más le desagrada los problemas que tiene que afrontar cuando las plaga de insectos azotan sus cultivos. Por ese motivo también se dedica a la ganadería con el cuidado de animales menores como carneros, cuyes y vacas. Con los cuales obtiene una ganancia extra que le sirve para poder solventar cualquier inconveniente en la agricultura. “El dinero que se invierte en la siembra, no siempre es seguro; ganas o pierdes”, afirma. Por ese motivo está ahorrando su dinero para poder comenzar un negocio propio, donde se pueda sentirse más tranquila. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe de su asociación. María, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, asimismo varios sacos de abono orgánico que le servirán para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who is solely responsible for providing support, education and food for her two children: Franklin and Elisabeth.  The family live together in their own home which is in the small village of Paucarmarca.

María's main business, in which she has been working for 16 years, is farming.  She grows peas, potatoes and beans which she sows on her own land which is located on the outskirts of her village.  What she most enjoys about her work is being able to spend most of her time out in the fields.  What she most dislikes about her work are the problems that she faces when pests attack her crops.  For this reason, she also raises livestock, taking care of animals such as rams, guinea pigs and cows.  This makes her extra profits that she uses to cover any problems with her farming.  "Money invested in growing crops is not always safe.  Sometimes you win and sometimes you lose" she tells us.  For this reason, she is saving money so that she can start her own business where she can feel more relaxed. 

María is a member of the Santa Rosa community bank and this is her seventh loan from MFP.  She feels grateful for the support that she receives from the association.  María will invest the money she has requested in buying two bags of pea seeds as well as several sacks of organic manure that she will use for her next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol sells fish for a living. She is married to a fisherman. Her husband catches the fish and she sells them. Mirasol is happy to have this business because it provides food, clothes and education for her children. Mirasol works hard to improve her business and to earn better. She wants to save for her family’s future.

Mirasol plans to use her loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. In the future, Mirasol hopes to have an additional business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials.

loans.name: Simon Gathogo

texts.en: Simon has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 15 years.  He is 52 years old, married, and has five children.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his previous loan of 30,000 KES in a timely manner.  He plans to use the loan  to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Simon hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alibek

texts.en:
Alibek is 53 years old, married and has three children. He is a hardworking man. 

He is a carpenter and in order to make an additional income, he also provides house-building services. Besides this, he is engaged in farming and cultivates potatoes and wheat. He rents land from the neighboring village and cultivates melons and watermelons. 

IMON International’s service is very convenient for Alibek and that’s why he wants to get a loan. Alibek would like to get a loan of 8,000 TJS for purchasing fertilizer and melon seeds. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and melon seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear-clothes in a large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more drugs to resell.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo is separated and a father of one school-age child. He is 36 years old and lives in Colambotan Bajo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Domingo owns and operates a business venture in construction. He purchases timber trees and manages his work using a chainsaw .He has been engaged in this business for over four years. He earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month from this activity. He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 from GDMPC to purchase coconut trees to sell as timber. Domingo has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Domingo hopes to expand his business and have a construction supply store in the city.

loans.use: To purchase coconut trees to sell as timber

loans.name: Claudia Esmerita

texts.es:
La Sra. Claudia es madre soltera,  tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, el cual aún no asiste al colegio. 
Ella se dedica  a  la venta de ropa desde hace 03 años,  inició su trabajo por amigas  suyas  quienes  la impulsaron a introducirse en el negocio, gana semanalmente S/. 300 nuevos soles. El principal desafío que enfrenta Claudia es trabajar todos los días y al mismo tiempo cuidar a su menor hijo en el negocio. Sus sueños y aspiraciones son que su negocio crezca y así pueda darle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería para ampliar más su negocio. La Sra. Claudia está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Claudia is a single mother who has a two-year-old child who is not yet in school. For three years she has earned a living selling clothes. She began her work through some friends of hers who urged her to get into the business. She makes 300 Peruvian soles a week. 

The primary challenge Claudia faces is working every day and at the same time caring for her minor child at the business. Her dreams and aspirations are that her business would grow so that she may give her son a good quality of life. She will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise to further expand her business. Claudia is very grateful for the loan she has been granted.

loans.use: to purchase clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has two children.

Ammar has been the owner of a workshop since 2008, making and selling concrete blocks. He has a good experience in this field and he has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1200 loan in order to purchase a large generator. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a large generator.

loans.name: Sunnah

texts.en:
Sunnah is 36 years old, married, and has three children aged 15, 11 and 8 years. In 2000, Sunnah established a business selling fabric and slippers.  She chose to sell fabric because she thinks it's something that is always marketable, and she had already gained similar experience working with her elder sister.

Sunnah works six days a week, nine hours a day, and earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leonian leones (Le) every month. Sunnah  has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and is now asking for a loan of 5,000,000 Le in order to buy more fabric and slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 Le.

In future, Sunnah plans to add more goods to her shop. She has already opened another outlet for her younger brother, and she has bought a piece of land with the proceeds of her previous loan. She has been able to take care of her family's needs, and she thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy fabric and slippers

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven, 58, resides with his wife and children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Ven grows yams, earning an income of 5.56 USD per day. The family is also assisted by his three children who are all employed at the rubber plantation. Each month, the family has to spend 70 USD on food and 40 USD on other necessary expenses. Ven is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to hire workers to cut grasses at his yam plantation. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To hire workers to cut grasses at his yam plantation

loans.name: Aiah Lebbie's Group

texts.en:
Here we see the teachers in one of the schools in Koidu city, which is located in eastern Sierra Leone. They are among the first in their profession to receive a loan from SMT/Kiva. Like their counterparts in other parts of the country, they have requested this loan for many reasons – to pay school fees for their children, buy building materials for a house, invest in a business, etc. At the end of each month, they repay SMT/Kiva lenders out of the money they earn. Their school’s bursar deducts the payment and sends it to SMT/Kiva. 

Aiah leads this group of teachers. He is 42 years old and was born in Kono/Koidu. He is married and has two children, one of whom is in primary school. Aiah has been a teacher for 19 years and is applying for this loan to build a house for his family. He will use the money to buy cement and other building materials.

loans.use: to build a home for his family.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a married Kenyan lady with five children. She lives in the Dandora estate in Nairobi where her business of selling new inner wear (underwear) is located. Her customers are mostly ladies within the Dandora estate. She has been in business for fifteen years.

Her future hopes are to grow her business to wholesale and give a good life to her children. Her challenges are when the customers buy on credit they disappear and also the lack of capital. Hannah is honest and religious.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo que lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio y comprar más ropa: vestidos,pantalones, camisas, blusas y D. esa forma incrementara sus ganancias porque tendrá más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
Ella esta contenta con el aporte D. estos prestamos, los cuales le han ayudado para mejorara la diversidad D. sus productos para ofrecer a los clientes.
texts.en:
Marta is requesting a new loan, which she needs to buy more merchandise to stock her business.  She needs to buy more clothing; dresses, pants, shirts, and blouses.  By offering her customers a greater variety, her income will increase.

She is happy with the help from these loans.  They have helped her to improve the diversity of the products she offers her customers.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pants, shirts, and blouses.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta D. carne D. res, cerdo y medicina natural, ella vive con dos hijos D. 23 y 19 años, ambos son independientes, el negocio surgió D. la necesidad D. proveer para sus hijos todo lo necesario, lo aprendió hace 20 años y atienD. D. 7:00am a 12:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar dos novillas y cerdo, la compra le ayudara para tener disponibilidad D. producto, ofrecer a los clientes.
Su objetivo es trabajar D. manera ordenada, administrar bien los fondos del préstamo, y continuar con las ventas para proveer ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
María sells beef, pork, and natural medicines. She lives with her two children, ages 23 and 19. Both of them are independent. Her business was started out of necessity so that she could proviD. everything her children needed. María learned this traD. 20 years ago and operates her business from 7am to 12pm.

She is requesting a loan to buy two heifers and a pig. This purchase will ensure that she has available products to offer to her customers. Her goals are to work in an orderly manner, properly manage the funds from this loan, and to continue her sales so that she can proviD. household income.

loans.use: to buy two heifers and a pig for butchering.

loans.name: Blanca Nidia

texts.es:
Después de trabajar para algunos familiares en diferentes negocios, decidió crear su propia tienda de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, una de las ventajas de su tienda es que ésta se encuentra ubicada en su casa, lo que le ha permitido estar al frente de sus tres hijos para brindarles mayor atención. 

teniendo en cuenta que se aproxima la temporada de fin de año, Blanca necesita de un préstamo para comprar diferentes productos que le permitan mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
After having worked for some of her family members in different businesses, Blanca decided to set up her own store selling basic household products.  One of the advantages of her store is that it is located in her home.  This allows her to look after her children and provide them with more attention.

Bearing in mind the fact that the end of the year is approaching, Blanca needs a loan to buy different products which will allow her to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Adjowa est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée à un employé de la LONATO et a 03enfants. 
Adjowa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1994.  Elle vend des bois de chauffage et du teck à toutes personnes dans un quartier à Lomé.  Elle achète les bois dans quelques localités nord du pays telles que Anié.  Elle travaille avec une personne. 
Adjowa a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bois de chauffage et du teck destiné à la vente. Elle veut agrandir son activité avec les profits supplémentaires. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adjowa voudrait avoir d’autres points de vente. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer à l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Adjowa is a 43-year-old woman. She is married to an employee of the LONATO  and has three children. Adjowa has been working as a retailer since 1994. She sells firewood and teak to anyone in her district in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She purchases the wood in a few towns, such as Anié, in the country's north. She works with one person. 

Adjowa has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy firewood and some teak to sell. She wants to expand her business by using the extra profit. In the next few years, she would like to have other sales outlets. 

With the profits, Adjovi says she plans to help with her children's eduction.

loans.use: to buy firewood and teak

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Madame Hélène  est femme mariée de 47 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce plus particulièrement dans le domaine de  la vente de friperie  depuis plus de 10 ans . Elle est sociétaire d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2003. Son objectif  est de diversifier son activité de commerce selon les besoins de la population. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de moutons à revendre. Elle souhaite renforcer les bénéfices que lui génère  son activité d’autant plus que   ses bénéfices antérieurs lui ont permis de réfectionner son domicile.
texts.en: Mrs. Hélène is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in Senegal. She is a merchant who has been selling second-hand clothing for over 10 years. She became a member of the U-IMCEC branch in May 2003. Her goal is to diversify her trade activity to match the needs of the population. She is seeking a loan of 300,000 francs to purchase sheep for resale. She wants to strengthen the revenue earned from her activity, especially since past revenue allowed her to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Teresa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Teresa Margarita de dedica a la venta de ropa usada y zapatos quiere invertir en compra de material para empezar a realizar accesorios ya que es una buena oportunidad para un ingreso extra, ya que además estará al pendiente de sus hijos en los estudios y en la casa. 
Para así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ya que el se dedica a la reparación de carros en el mismo domicilio, están los dos al pendiente de sus hijos y del negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa Margarita sells used clothing and shoes. She wants to invest in materials to start to make accessories, since it is a good opportunity to make extra income. She can also attend to her children's studies and her home. 
 
In this way, she will help her husband with the family expenses. He repairs cars at their home, so both of them attend to the children and the business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as winter clothing and materials to make accessories.

loans.name: Reina Esther

texts.es: Reina Esther de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive con su sobrina. Ella posee una venta de ropa y zapatos; camisetas, pantalones, blusas, entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado la clientela, pues en su negocio siempre tienen lo que las personas necesitan con productos de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable Reina al ser una mujer muy carismática y amable siempre recibe a sus clientes con el mejor de los gustos; ella es una mujer muy trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante,  Reina piensa que para alcanzar el éxito se requiere de voluntad, razón y decisión. Esta muy decidida a salir adelante con el negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar camisetas, pantalones, blusas, faldas, zapatos etc. Reina Esther tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Reina Esther, who is 55 years old, lives with her niece. She sells clothing and shoes: shirts, pants, blouses, among other things. Lately, she has expanded her clientele since, in her business, she always has what people need with excellent quality products and accessible prices. Additionally, the service is unequaled since Reina hs a very charismatic and amiable woman who receives her customers with the best taste. She is a very hard-working woman with desires to get ahead. Reina thinks that to achieve success she needs will, reason and decision. She is focused on getting ahead with the business. It is for this that she is requesting from Integral a loan that allows her to buy shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, shoes, etc. Reina Esther has the faith that in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, and shoes.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Alita has a rice field that sells rice grains during harvest time. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm.

Alita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the rice field

loans.name: Leataosina

texts.en:
Leataosina is forty-four years of age and is married with two children.

Leataosina owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has four years of experience in this business.  Leataosina needs a loan of WST 2500 to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to further improve/expand the business.

Leataosina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Leataosina's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items in order to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Melecia has a pigpen and she sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Melecia became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Melecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 33-year-old married woman from A Karak Jordan who supports three family members .She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements and she would like to buy new furniture.

Rima prefers not to display her photo on the internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a small scale egg seller at Yabiw (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. 

Beatrice has worked in the egg business for close to nine years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of eggs, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of owning an egg stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of eggs, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Abissola Victoire

texts.fr: Abissola Victoire âgée de 30 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Abissola Victoire est mariée à un couturier nommé Jean. Le couple a trois enfants, tous  scolarisés et à leur charge. Abissola Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont assumées par Abissola Victoire et son mari. Pour cette raison, Abissola Victoire vend des torchons de façon ambulante depuis seize ans. de façon secondaire, Abissola Victoire vend aussi des serviettes, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de sa famille. Abissola Victoire s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Afin de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle, Abissola Victoire sollicite pour une septième fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des torchons et des serviettes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John  is 46 years old. He is married to Elizabeth who is also a farmer, and they are blessed with 3 children of ages between 14 and 3 years respectively.

He has had a farming business for 25 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000. He has borrowed KES. 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya as his seventh loan, after paying the previous loans successfully. 

He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs. Therefore he hopes that the anticipated profit, will help him to buy food for his family, pay school fees for his kids, cater for medical care,  expanding his current business and repay his loan too. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to enjoy an improved life with his wife and kids.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.en:
Juan Pablo is a young man of 21 years, a native resident of Monclova, Coahuila. He is very engaging and has a strong will to succeed in his life, reaching his goals one at a time. His primary objective is to finish his studies. He needed a job that would afford him the time to study but also earn him money at the same time. A friend of his suggested to him that he might sell used clothing. One year later, his business has been a great success.

Juan Pablo needs a loan of $200 to keep up with his business and reach his goals. Become part of Juan Pablo\'s success and help him finish his schooling. He will be able to secure a better future for himself and for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Pablo es un joven de 21 años de edad, originario de la localidad de Monclova Coahuila, muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida, logrando cada una de las metas que se ha propuesto hasta el momento. Su principal objetivo es concluir con éxito sus estudios, por lo que necesitaba de una actividad que le permitiera estudiar y generar ingresos a la vez, uno de sus amigos le comentó que la venta de ropa usada era un buena oportunidad para lograr lo que el buscaba. Así que hace un año empezó con dicho negocio, dejándole buenos resultados.

Ahora Juan Pablo requiere de un préstamo de $ 200 DLLS para poder seguir con su proyecto y lograr las metas que el mismo se ha propuesto, se parte de la realización de las metas de Juan Pablo y ayúdale a concluir con sus estudios y asegurar un mejor porvenir para él y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Faaea

texts.en:
Faaea is married with 7 children. Her family needs, including the education of her children, are barely met by the farm, which was her first business since she joined to the SPBD program.

She started with a small loan and she used it to buy the fertilizer, weed killer and the most needed equipment to improve the farm just to start off. In addition, she also has the talent for designing and doing elei printing (a traditional Samoan way of printing fabrics using carved designs) and decided to engage in another business. She has already started with some savings she got for her farm but she needs additional capital to expand her Elei Printing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics, carved wooden design board, stencils, paints

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is 62 years old, married, and has 2 children. He is a commercial salesman. He sells all kind of daily consumables. He started with a small amount of money that he used to stock his business, 15 years ago.

He has been in business for more than 15 years. Thanks to his work he has been able to send his children to school and pay for his basic needs. He also gets help from his wife, who mans the store and sells office supplies and photocopies.

He wants to open a boutique at his house, to sell ladies and mens clothing, which will allow him to augment his sales. Later, he plans to expand the space of his store to create a showroom.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Pablo tiene 62 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos. Su actividad, es comerciante (despensa). El vende todo tipo de productos de consumo diario. Empezo con un pequeño capital con el que surtio su negocio hace ya 15 años atras. Está dedicado al oficio hace más de 15 años, gracias a su trabajo pudo educar a sus hijos y cubrir sus necesidades básicas. Tambien recibe la ayuda de su esposa, quien atiende el negocio y realiza venta de productos de libreria y fotocopias. Tiene proyectado abrir en su domicilio una boutique, venta de ropas para damas y caballeros, lo cual le permitirá aumentar sus ventas Mas adelante planea ampliar su espacio físico para exponer sus productos.

loans.use: To acquire oil, flour, pasta, rice, sugar, and other things to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes C. A. started her despensa, a small grocery store, almost 10 years ago. She runs two despensas; one located at the Mercado Ita, and the other at her house. She works at the despensa at Mercado Ita, an outdoor market, in the mornings; and in the afternoon, she returns to her house to work at the depensa located in front of her house. While she is not at home to watch over the despensa, one of her children looks after it for her. Mercedes is 43 years old, married, and mother to four children, ages 23, 20, 15, and 13. All of her children still live with her. Two are students, one works as a teacher, and the other at a bar.

She is a hard worker and works everyday. Mercedes is seeking a loan to invest in her despensa. She currently sales a variety of items, including bread, vine, eggs, pasta, fruits, candy, and domestic products. With her loan, Mercedes plans to use it as capital to restock her inventory. In particular, she will be buying products such as pasta and drinks in large quantities.

loans.use: Purchase pasta and drinks.

loans.name: Nghik

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghik K. C., 56, lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To help support her family, Mrs. Nghik K. C. is employed as a worker at a rubber plantation collecting rubber sap, while her husband works as a tire repairman. Together they can earn only the meager amount of $2 each day. Two of their children work at a garment factory and the other works with his mother at the plantation.

Mrs.Nghik K. C. hopes to use this loan to invest in buying rubber from someone’s plantation and she then will resell it at a good profit. She believes your trust and support can help her entire family generate additional profits from this investment.

loans.use: To invest in buying rubber from someone’s plantation to resell at a good profit

loans.name: John

texts.en: John M. (the first one seated on the bench in the photo) is a 44-year-old father of five and a resident of the Buguruni area in Dar es Salaam city. For the past three years, he has been running a business selling charcoal. The government is now putting strict rules on cutting down trees, which affects his business. Because of this, he wants to expand his store so as to accommodate more stock, which will help him to stock enough charcoal to keep the business alive in the "no tree cutting season." He is in need of U.S. $375 to help expand his store.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Mimi

texts.en: Mimi is a 36-year-old woman who sells snacks, drinks, candies and household goods at her small shop and usually earns US$10 per day. Her husband, K., has no regular income. Mimi requests a loan to expand her business, so she could earn extra income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali H. is a 57-year-old farmer who breeds livestock for meat production in a small village of Saatli region. He has been selling calves for meat production to the local bazaar traders for seven years. He is requesting a loan of $1000 so he can purchase 3 calves and fodder, which will expand his operation and improve his income.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Inom

texts.en:
Inom Y. is 45 years old and he is married with three children. Inom sells CDs and DVDs, as well as eggs, in the central local market, and he has been in this line of business for 10 years. Over the years, his eldest son (pictured) became more involved in the business and now helps his father at the market. Inon's business generates sufficient income to support his large family. 

Inom already received one loan from IMON and he successfully repaid that loan without any problems whatsoever. Now, he seeks $1,000 to purchase a computer in order to record DVDs and CDs and to purchase additional eggs, and he is confident that he can repay this loan on time. Inom would like to thank everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a computer to record DVDs and CDs.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ms. Ana María came for the first time to the credit institution on February 15th 2008. She sells coffee, as well as grocery store products. She lives at her parents’ house in the Callampaya region, and runs her business there. She is single and supports three children of 8, 5 and 3 years of age on her own. She doesn’t have any active loans from other credit institutions. In spite of the meager income, this activity provides for all her expenses. The loan will be used to buy wholesale products such as sugar, rice and noodles.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana María llegó por primera vez a la institución el 15 de febrero de 2008. Su actividad principal es la venta de café, aunque también se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. La señora vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Callampaya, y su actividad la realiza en el mismo domicilio. Doña Ana María no tiene esposo y sola saca adelante a tres niños de 8,5 y 3 años de edad. Actualmente la señora no tiene créditos con otras instituciones financieras. A pesar de que los ingresos no son muchos, con esta actividad es con lo que solventa todos sus gastos. El crédito le sirve para abastecerse al por mayor de productos como azúcar, arroz, fideos, para luego comercializarlos.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of sugar, rice and other products.

loans.name: Mikali

texts.en: Mikali is a married woman with 3 children, ages 18,13, and 12 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, both of whom are 60 years old. Mikali owns a small stock of animals, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her animals.

loans.use: To buy food for her animals

loans.name: Gargilla

texts.en:
Gargilla is a smart entrepreneur who lives in the Chucho community of Santo Domingo. Gargilla says that she always pays special attention to the needs of people in her community, because their needs create great business opportunities for those who can meet them.

Currently, Gargilla is running an open-air pub. She explains that a lot of people visit her business to enjoy a couple of beers, whisky, and other drinks while they’re chatting with friends. This entrepreneur dreams of owning an establishment so she can run her business in a more comfortable atmosphere.

With her loan, Gargilla will buy more drinks in order to enlarge her sales volume and increase her revenue.

loans.use: To buy beverages to replenish a small pub

loans.name: Appolina

texts.fr:
Appolina O. is 41 years old, married, and the mother of four. She is a retail seller of millet, corn, and beans in Adéta, a small village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Appolina would like to increase the capacity of her commerce by buying 20 sacks of corn, 10 sacks of millet, and 15 sacks of beans. The gains from her business will enable her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Appolina O. est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse du mil, maïs et haricot à Adeta, un petit village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Appolina désire augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant 20 sacs de maïs, 10 sacs de mils et 15 sacs de haricots. Les gains de son activité lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of corn, 10 sacks of millet, and 15 sacks of beans

loans.name: Thai Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thai Thi H., 39, has been a member of TYM Fund since 2001. She has two children, both of whom are still in school. Before joining TYM Fund, Mrs. H. has had her own shop selling sand in her neighborhood. In 2001, she decided to join TYM, so she could ask for loans to invest more into her business. With the help of TYM and family’s capitals, Mrs. H. has been able to expand her business and make more profits. As a result, her family’s income is one of the most secure in the area. In the next round of loan, Mrs. H. wishes for a loan of 15.000.000 VND ($ 900) to continue investing into her business. Her family’s income is 5.000.000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thái Thị Huyền 39 tuổi là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Gia đình chị có hai con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị đã có cửa hành kinh doanh cát tại địa phương.Năm 2001 chị tham gia Quỹ để vay thêm vốn đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng thu mua cát. Đến nay qua nhiều năm buôn bán cùng với nguồn vốn vay của Quỹ và nguồn vốn tự có của gia đình mô hình kinh doanh của gia đình chị đã được mở rộng hơn và hiệu quả kinh doanh cũng cao hơn. Gia đình chị hiện là một trong số gia đình có kinh tế ổn định nhất trong thôn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn kinh doanh

Thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase raw materials to keep produce fried dishes.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum E., 56, is married and lives with four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 1990, she has earned a living as a tailor and is able to make US$3 each day. Her income is aided by her children who work as garment factory workers. Her husband, Un Chet, 59, is a motor-taxi driver and is able to earn US$4 per day. Mrs. E. is requesting a loan from Kiva via CREDIT,  Kiva's local partner, to purchase an additional sewing machine for her children. The rest of the loan will be used to purchase a motorbike for her son to start a moto-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and a motorbike.

loans.name: Faitele

texts.en:
Faitele A., 26 and married with two children, has one year of experience in the ice cake business, selling to the public six days per week. Her husband helps her with the business. She has received two previous loans with SPBD and expects her weekly net cash flow to soon rise to $125.

SPBD loans are Faitele's only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for loans from traditional banks; her current loan request is for the purpose of buying foam cups, Kool Aid, sugar and a second hand refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy foam cups, Kool Aid, sugar and a second hand refrigerator.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Hace 2 años que la señora Olga cuenta con un puesto donde expende salchipapa en la parte exterior de su casa. Con 30 años, la señora Olga tiene 4 menores hijos por los cuales velar junto con su esposo (de12, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad); por lo que su puesto no se da abasto para poder solventar la adecuada crianza y educación de sus hijos. Sin embargo, es más que perseverante la labor que realiza y mantiene sus sueños intactos, suyos y de sus hijos.nPara ello necesita de un préstamo de 600 soles, los cuales le brindarían una oportunidad de relanzar su negocio, proveyéndole de mayores ganancias y, por ende, de una mejor calidad de vida para los suyos.n
texts.en:
For the last two years, Olga has sold hot dogs and French fries from a stand at her home. Thirty years old, Olga has four children (ages 12, 6, 4, and 2) whom she takes care of with her husband. Her stand does not currently provide an adequate income to raise and educate her children. However, she is sure that working persistently she will realize both her dreams and those of her children. To accomplish this, she requests a loan of $200. The loan will give her the opportunity to relaunch her business and increase earnings, therefore providing a greater quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finance the supplies necessary for a hot dog and French fries stand

loans.name: Babayor

texts.en:
Babayor K. is 56 years old. He is married with two children. For more than 12 years, Babayor has been selling vegetables, such as potatoes, onions, and carrots. His elder son helps Babayor with the business. His business begins in the early morning at 5:00 a.m. He buys vegetables wholesale from the local farmers and sells them in the market.  He trades in the market that is known for its attractive prices. All this allows Babayor’s business to generate a considerable and stable income for his family. 

Today, he is planning to purchase new, fresh vegetables to sell in order to increase the range of goods that he sells. For this purpose, he requests 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) for 4 months. Having a positive credit history with IMON, Babayor promises to repay the current loan as promptly as he did the previous time.  

The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Babayor’s business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: To Increase the range of vegetables that he sells

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr: La dame Khadidiatou B. est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son capital d’embouche bovine. Elle va ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khadidiatou B. is married and the mother of 3 children, who are in her care. She is requesting this loan to bolster her working capital for her little business fattening livestock for re-sale. In this way, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and health situation, and keep all her children enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sheep and raising them for re-sale

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sumerti

texts.id: Beternak babi adalah pekerjaan yang sudah ditekuni Ketut Sumerti dari sebelum membina rumah tangga. Karena kebanyakan memang di pedesaan termasuk juga di desa Perancak memelihara babi merupakan kerja sampingan para ibu-ibu rumah tangga disamping mengolah ladang. Karena kebutuhan ekonomi dalam keluarga semakin besar dan suaminya yang sebagai petani juga penghasilannya tidak menentu maka Ketut Sumerti melihat peluang bekerja sama dengan DINARI adalah sesuatu yang sangat bagus dan membantunya dalam meningkatkan penghasilan dari beternak babinya. Ketut memutuskan untuk menambah modal usahanya dengan meminjam ke DINARI sebesar Rp.3.750.000,- dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan dan pembayaran dilakukan sekaligus pada akhir periode pinjaman dimana babi-babi peliharaan sudah dapat dipanen. Ketut merencanakan membeli 2 ekor bibit babi penggemukan untuk dipelihara disamping babi-babi yang sudah ada di kandangnya. Sisa pinjaman akan digunakan untuk biaya pakan selama 6 bulan masa pemeliharaan. Untuk mengawali memang cukup sulit karena diharapkan babi-babi peliharaannya semuanya harus panen bagus tetapi dengan pendampingan dari para staf DINARI tentang cara memelihara babi yang baik maka Ketut berharap keuntungan yang akan didapat mencapai sekitar Rp.500.000,-. Tentunya hasil ini sangat membantu keluarga nantinya. Terutama untuk kebutuhan anak-anaknya.
texts.en:
Raising pigs has been work for Ketut Sumerti before she started her household. In many villages, including Perancak, raising pigs are side jobs for housewifes besides field work. Since family economy needs are greater, and her tenant farmer's husband income is uncertain, so Ketut Sumerti saw an opportunity to work together with DINARI as a good way to help increase her pig farming income. Ketut decided to increase her capital by borrowing from DINARI for Rp.3,750,000,- (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp10,000-12,000.00) for a period of 6 months, and payment at period end after the farmed pigs are harvested. Ketut plans to buy 2 piglets for fattening to be raised together with other pigs already in her stall. Rest of the loan will be used to buy pig feeds for the 6 months raising. To start is difficult since it was expected that the raised pigs have all to harvested well, but with DINARI staff training on how to raise pigs well, Ketut hopes that profit received could be about Rp.500,000,-. This result would help her family, especially childrens needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs and it's feed

loans.name: Dina Fe

texts.en:
Dina Fe is engaged in retailing business.  She owns a sari-sari store (a community based store) in their village.  Their village is located beside the Cagayan River which is considered the longest river in the Philippines. She is married to Garry and they were blessed with a daughter named Divine Grace and she is only ten months old.  
	
Due to lack of business capital, she has decided to borrow a loan of PHP4,000.  She believes that this amount will help her to cope up with her business.  Some of the things that she plans to buy for her store are: sardines, cooking oil, sugar, powdered milk, noodles, salt, laundry soap and toiletries.  In this way, she can meet the demands of her customers and at the same time increase her income.
 
Her business also enables her to assist her husband in search of better livelihood opportunities and save something for the future of their family.  House improvement is also one of her wish in the coming years aside from business development.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Vlas

texts.en:
For more than 11 years Vlas Atanasie has been in the business of growing red fibber, cabbage and melons. Using advanced technology and buying seeds from specialized enterprises, he grows both in his greenhouse and in an arable field located in the delta, thereby ensuring steady access to water. 

Assisted by his family, Vlas sells his produce to the wholesale market in Cahul district. Oleg performs all the work that is necessary, control, execution, production, etc. The business could be a very profitable one if vegetables will be cultivated in a larger area. Oleg's future plans are to increase the number of greenhouses.

loans.use: To increase the number of greenhouses.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is 36 years old. She is a married woman with four children, one male and three females. Two of her children are in senior high school while the others are in junior high and primary schools.

She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Joyce is a trader in yams. She procures yams from the north where she claims cost is economical. She sells in the local market. Joyce says most of her customers are food vendors. She has been in this business for nine years.

She wants a loan to procure more yams to supply to more customers. Joyce hopes to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To procure more yams.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en: Melita F. is a 48-year-old mother of two children. Her husband, Elvenio, is a laborer and makes furniture. To help support the family Melita buys and resells various vegetables. She applied for this loan in order to buy assorted raw materials for furniture making, such as good lumber, nails, varnish, etc. In the future Melita hopes to establish a shop from which they can fulfill orders. She also wants to be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for furniture making

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria M. tiene 26 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y joyeria de fantasia enchapes de oro, ella tambien vende lociones, cremas, polvos, shampoos, desodorantes, etc. ella tiene un año de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella vive en el barrio San Jose. en estos momentos ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor ya que es mas barato y se obtienen mas ganancias, pero ella tiene que viajar para comprar su produto, por eso es que le sale mejor comprarlo al por mayor para tenerlo para varios meses. 
por tal razon es que ella esta solicitando el credito. tiene muchos deseos de superarse y quiere llegar a tener una tienda grande para poder mantener a su hijo y darle lo mejor en esta vida. ella quiere que su hijo sea una persona de bien y que sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria M. is 26 years old and has a 4-year old son. She sells cosmetics and gold-plated costume jewellery. She also sells lotions, creams, powders, shampoos, deodorants, etc. She has been doing this for one year. She lives in the San Jose district. At the moment she needs money to buy more wholesale merchandise because it is cheaper and increases her earnings. However, she must travel to buy her products which is why it is better to buy in bulk so that she has enough to last several months. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan. She is eager to succeed and would like to have a large shop so that she is able to look after her son and give him the best start in life. She would like her son to be a good person and a good professional.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and costume jewellery

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra tiene 45  años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia de su tierra natal. Cada día es una oportunidad para seguir trabajando en sus tareas agrícolas, en especial al cuidado de sus animales, los cuales vende en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Alejandra tiene principalmente ovejas y vaquillonas, además de sembrar papa y otros productos nativos de su zona. Aunque su labor suele ser dura, para más adelante, su deseo es continuar trabajando para aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene, para obtener mayores ganancias cuando los venda. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, y tiene muchos deseos de permanecer en su banco comunal para seguir trabajando con su grupo con miras al progreso de todos. El dinero que Alejandra está solicitando es para la compra de sacos de abono y para el pago del personal que contratará para la próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and children in their own house in the land of their birth. She spends every day doing farm work, in particular, caring for her animals, which she sells at her community’s livestock market. Alejandra mainly raises sheep and heifers, but also grows potatoes and other products that are native to the region. Even though her work tends to be difficult, she wants to continue working in the future so she can increase the number of animals she has and thus obtain greater profits when she sells the animals. This is Alejandra’s fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she wishes to stay in her communal bank and continue working with her group so she can see everyone make progress. The money that Alejandra is asking for will be used to purchase bags of fertilizer and to pay the workers she is going to hire to plant the next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer, and paying her workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Ben

texts.fr: Ben A. est un homme de 47 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. il tient un magasin de matériaux de construction à Womé. Ben exerce cette activité depuis 10 ans. Il souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son entreprise afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Ben A. is 47-years-old, married and the father of 4 children. He owns a building supply store in Womé. Ben has been in this business for 10 years. He hopes to expand his business with this loan so that he can better satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is a 23-year-old young man living with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as an accountant since 2007 after his graduation. To develop his work and be able to satisfy the demands of his work, Elie is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase a laptop that will facilitate his job.

loans.use: To purchase a laptop

loans.name: Beatrice Nankya' S Group

texts.en:
B. is the leader of a 5-member group. She is a 40 years old, widowed, with six children aged between 10 and 26 years. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a four-roomed house where she is living with three people. B. takes care of her sister. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

B. resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. B. is located in Mulago, running a bar selling crude alcohol in one of Kampala's suburbs. She incurs extra transport costs to and from Kalerwe where she buys her crude alcohol. B. sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people, excluding children. She works six days a week.

B. sells retail only. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises and home. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. B. has been with MCDT for over three years and is servicing her sixth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of crude alcohol. B. is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises. .

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of crude alcohol

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a member of the Mgodi North in Kinyanambo,Iringa borrower group,she is 30 yeas old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 13,9 and 4 years.

 Rose started her own business selling clothes 10 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Rose first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Rose hopes to save ,more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Soeun Chev Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of fifteen people. It is located in AnD. Village in Kandal Province. All of the members will use their parts of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Kim SoeU. C. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she grows rice to to earn a living. She faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil that damages her crops. In order to deal with this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field and to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. MoeU. Thy, is a fisherman. Mrs. Kim SoeU. C. is 32 years old and the mother of two young children. 

Four members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Emelda

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Emelda C. A. tiene 45 años de edad, es viuda y tiene a cargo dos hijos los cuales estan en el colegio, Maria se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia, tiene unos 12 años de tener su negocio. 
Maria necesita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener surtida su pulperia, nos comento que se le ha hecho dificil salir sola adelante con sus hijos ya que ella no tiene ningun apoyo ya que su esposo se murio. 
esta situacion a sido dificil para ella, pero con fuerza de voluntad y con muchas ganas de superacion a podido salir adelante con su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Emelda is 45 years old, is a widow and has two children that are in high school. Maria sells popular consumer products. She has a grocery store that she has had for twelve years. Maria needs a loan to buy merchandise in order to have a greater variety of items in her store. She told us that it is difficult to get ahead with her children now that she doesn’t have the support of her husband that died. This is a difficult situation for her but with will and the desire to succeed she will be able to move forward with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks, juice, milk, cheese, butter, eggs, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, cookies, donuts, salsas, chillies, toilet paper and aspirin

loans.name: Doku

texts.en: Doku S. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase baking flour .  Doku is 22 years old and is Married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase baking flour

loans.name: Phourng

texts.en:
Phourng H., 43, is married with two children. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured).

To make a living, she sells various kinds of beverages at a local market in her village, earning an income of approximately US $4 per day, which is the primary source of income for her family. The family is also assisted by her husband, who operates his motorbike as a motor taxi driver. He travels from place to place in his province in search of customers, earning an income of US $1 per day in revenue. This couple tries to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for their family. The two children are also currently employed in a local garment factory, earning a reasonable income to assist the family and to make a living.

H. is seeking to improve her business, so she is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more beverages to stock her store. By doing so, she hopes her current business will be able to generate more income for her household's use.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages

loans.name: Mamadou Moustapha

texts.fr: Mamadou Moustapha D. est célibataire, tailleur membre de l’U-IMCEC a la caisse de Baye Laye depuis plusieurs annees.Il a déjà rembourse six prets.Depuis 1989 il exerce cet activité mais ce n’est qu’en 2003 qu’il a acquit son propre atelier et travaille pour son propre compte. Il est ne dans une famille de tailleur et fréquentait  régulièrement l’atelier de son grand frère d’où il a choisi le métier par amour .Il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs dans le but de compléter  son épargne pour acquérir une nouvelle machine a coudre et ainsi pouvoir faire face a la demande croissante  de veille de fête de Tabaski et de fin d’année. Avec son emprunt il espère pouvoir augmenter ses revenus de 250 000 frs mensuellement. Son objectif est d’améliorer  considérablement  son  épargne et d’étendre son atelier.
texts.en:
Mamadou Moustapha D. is unmarried and a tailor. He has been a member of U-IMCEC at the branch office of Baye Laye for several years. He has already repaid six loans. He has been in this business of tailoring since 1989. But it was only since 2003 that he acquired his own workshop and has worked for himself. He was born into a family of tailors and used to go to his older brother’s shop regularly. Thus, he chose this trade for the love of it. He’s requesting a loan of 250,000 francs with the goal of rounding out his savings to acquire a new sewing machine and thus to be able to cope with the growing demand ahead of the Tabaski Festival and New Year’s Day. With this loan, he hopes to increase his monthly revenues by 250,000 francs. His goal is to improve his savings considerably and to expand his workshop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Fuamata

texts.en: Fuamata A. is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Sataoa Uta A. She is married and has six infant children. Fuamata owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. In 2006, Fuamata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Fuamata is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D.'s main source of income comes from tending a canteen near the school. She is 55 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She is from the town of Alimanao Peñablanaca, Cagayan. Yolanda has been in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a day as her net income.

Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be Yolanda's third loan from ASKI. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business in reserve for future emergencies.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Tanislaa

texts.es: Tanislaa L. A. tiene 57 años, por lo que su actividad económica es venta de mercadería en general actualmente ella tiene muchos pedidos de ropa nueva, a pesar de la edad que tiene ella es una mujer admirable porque hay muchas personas a su edad que no tienen trabajo, pero ella misma dice que tiene que trabajar por sus 2 hijos de diferentes edades de 14 y 17 años, esta es su razón por salir adelante para brindarles a ellos la oportunidad de estudiar. Ella inicio este negocio con capital propio hace 13 años, y por medio de los financiamientos que han  sido su gran apoyo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, trajes, vestidos, faldas y algunas tallas extra grande que algunos clientes solicitan. Ella desea enseñarles a sus hijos el negocio pues ellos tienen que aprender a valerse por si mismos.
texts.en:
Tanislaa L. A. is 57. She sells general merchandise. She has a lot of orders for new clothes. In spite of her age, she is an admirable woman because there are a lot of people her age who do not have work. She says that she has to work for her two children, 14 and 17. This is her reason to get ahead, to give them the opportunity of an education. She started her business 13 years ago with her own money and with the loans, which have been a great help. The loan she is asking for is to buy pants, shirts, outfits, skirts, and some extra large sizes that some of her customers ask for. She wants to teach her children the business. They have to learn to fend for themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Petronila Segunda

texts.es:
La señora Petronila Segunda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Gran Pajaten”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Caceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 51 años y 06 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Su fuerza y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 
Las ganancias que genera a diario, la ayuda al ingreso económico  en su familia. 

Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Petronila Segunda, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y prepararse para hacer frente a las adversidades de la vida  y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Petronila Segunda, 51, is a member of the "El Gran Pajaten" communal bank, which is in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Caceres province, San Martín department. She is married and has 6 children, two of whom still are dependent on her. Her strength and desire to see her children get ahead motivated her to set up her own grocery store in her home; she has a well-equipped area to tend to her customers. Her daily profits help support her family. From the beginning and to date she has won over regular customers who come by daily now to buy from her for it is she, herself, who tends to their requests with her characteristic charisma. With this 1500 sol loan, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of pasta, cases of milk and preserved fish of various brands, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene items to continue to provide better customer service. Petronila Segunda feels strong to continue to work and to prepare herself to face any adversity life might present. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop in their chosen lines of work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S., age 31, is married to Mek Reth, age 50. They are parents who are blessed with two children who go to school and are dependent on them. Chea S. and her husband depend on income from their annual business catching fish in and around the river. They sell the fish they have caught to market buyers. The couple has many years of fishing experience and usually earns at least $10 each day that they use to pay for their family’s daily expenses. Recently some of their fishing equipment was ruined and their income has been affected. Therefore, Chea S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to repair broken equipment and to buy extra accessories for fishing.

loans.use: To repair broken fishing equipment and to buy extra accessories for fishing.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria, 37, is a borrower who lives in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Renacer (Rebirth), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Maria is a single mother who lives with her two children in Samana, a small city in the northeastern region of the Dominican Republic. Life there can be rough with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Maria runs a successful business selling home products to her friends and neighbors. With this loan, Maria will purchase sheet sets to sell for a small profit.

This is Maria’s eighth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve life for her family. With her profits, she hopes to purchase a small van in order to make her business more mobile. This will add to her profits, which will allow her to improve her home by finishing her bathroom and to purchase a computer for her children. Computers are difficult to afford, but are one of the best investments a low-income household can make. It gives access to the world of information that those of us in the developed world take for granted while teaching children to use the invaluable tools of modern technology. Maria hopes to have her own house one day — something of value she can pass on to her children.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Maria and the Nuevo Renacer group!

loans.use: To buy sheet sets for resale

loans.name: Bus

texts.en:
Mrs. Bus C. is a villager who lives in Chuos village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In order to increase her income to improve her family, she wants to start a new business in pig breeding. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy twenty gigs and pig food to support this purpose.

Her husband, Mr. Sokhom Kan, buys recycling goods and earns a small income to support his family. Mrs. Bus C. is 30 years old and the mother of three children; two are students in the public school and the youngest is 4 years old. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy twenty gigs and pig food

loans.name: Petronila De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, la señora Petronila de los ángeles G. es una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica a la actividad de venta de pan viajando a diario al mercado desde el departamento de Carazo específicamente desde Jinotepe.

Es importante destacar que ella vende el pan ambulantemente por todo el mercado exponiéndose al sol y la fatiga de caminar todo el día con el fin de vender el pan y así llevar el sustento a su hogar.

El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de pan dulce y simple para continuar ofertándolo y así generar ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar y así apoyar a su hijo en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Petronila de los Ángeles G. is a hard-working lady at the Mangua Wholesale Market, where she dedicates herself to selling bread. Every day, she travels to the market from the Carazo region or, more specifically, from the city of Jinotepe. It’s important to highlight that she sells her bread on foot throughout the market, exposing herself to the sun and to fatigue from walking all day long. Her goal is to sell her bread so she can generate income to support her family. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of sweet and plain breads to sell. This way, she can support her household and her school-aged child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sweet and plain breads.

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Three years ago Wassim, a 22-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings, established a computer business to help provide various types of reports for members of his community. With his current loan request of US $1,200, Wassim will be able to purchase a photocopier and better market his services and increase the liquidity of his business.
