Wassim told the Ameen loan officer that the loan amount will be sufficient to fulfill his business objectives for the coming months. He also says that he hopes his business productivity and income will increase as a result of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopy machine

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
C. C. Enrique  tiene 58 años, es casado, y  tiene dos hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El  socio es miembro de la ventanilla rural La Palmera es un recinto que se encuentra a una hora y media  del Cantón San Miguel.  Son 16 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola  y pocos se dedican a la Ganadera. 

Enrique trabaja en la agricultura,  y solicita el crédito para compra de insumos.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz,  además se dedica a la cría de animales porcino.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Miguel en la Feria de los Jueves.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a caminar con la familia, también disfruta mucho cuando los vecinos se reúnen para alguna fiesta o para hacer deporte.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia y para la compra de un carro para el trabajo.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos, las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Enrique C. C. is 58 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in the San Miguel canton in the Bolívar province. He is a member of La Palmera (The Palm Tree) communal bank which is an hour and a half from San Miguel canton. There are 16 members in total. It is a farming community with a few who raise livestock. Enrique works in farming to increase the family income. His main crop is corn, and he also raises pigs. He sells his produce at the San Miguel market on Thursdays. In his free time he likes to go walking with his family, he also really enjoys it when the neighbors get together for a party or to play sport. The member is asking for a loan to buy farm supplies, for fertilizers and manure above all. His goal is to have a good economic business for the family and to purchase a car for work. The challenges that he faces are climate problems and diseases that affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farm supplies

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is married to a market vendor and they have four children together. All of her children go to school. Jessica looks after her old parents. She sells second hand clothes in a retail shop in Kawempe and sells to all categories of people. She has been in this business for a long time. Jessica wants to use this loan of 600,000/= to buy more bales of second hand clothes. Jessica, at times, goes to mobile markets and works six days a week. Her business challenges include transportation of clothes from Owino market (one of the biggest markets in Uganda where she goes for shopping) to her place of work. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she can earn enough profits to build a house for the business.  Jessica decided to work with MCDT because it had good services for the active poor women. She owns a house where the family stays and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, school fees, medication and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 41 years old, married and has five school-aged children.

Evelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She hopes to be successful someday.

In 2007, Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be her fourth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Marjorie Gisella

texts.es:
Marjorie de 25 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (la originalidad de este lugar fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil.  Ella tiene una tienda de víveres ya hace algún tiempo porque le gusto la atención al cliente. 

Comenzó vendiendo arroz en quintal,  poco a poco con esfuerzo tuvo su pequeña tienda readecuando su casa y la ubico afuera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm. Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo legumbres y bebidas. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa para darle una mejor vida a su única hija.
texts.en:
Marjorie, 25, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil called Orquideas (a name that comes from the fields of orquids that were once abundant here). She has operated a general business for some years and likes that she can provide a service to her customers. She began selling bulk quantities of rice and slowly built her store, first at a space in her house and later in a separate space. She works for 8:00am to 10:00pm. She will use the loan to stock her business with vegetables and drinks. In the future, she would like to finish building her house so that she can give her daughter a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Sam Oeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam Oeurn N. was selected group leader by a group of five people who live in In Svay Ta Ok-I village in Kandal province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that will improve their businesses.

Mrs. Sam Oeurn N. is widow with one child. She is a second-hand clothes seller at her local market where she earns a little money to support her family. Now that her business is going well, she wants to expand. To improve her business Mrs. Sam Oeurn N. is asking for a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea Y., age 48, and is a villager who lives in Krang Touch village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chantha Out, are farmers who own 2.50-hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. . The farm's soil is now infertile and there is not enough water to irrigate the crops. Thus, Mrs. Kea Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine and to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to cultivate rice. Aside from farmers, she is also pig breeder at home and her husband is a house constructor. With their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has four children, one is a farmer and the other three are students and also help their parents with the farming.

loans.use: to buy a water machine and to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to cultivate rice

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es:
El señor Remberto es casado y vive con la esposa y sus hijos de 16, 15, 9 y 7 años en casa propia en la zona Gran Poder de esta ciudad de La Paz. El señor Remberto trabaja como asistente administrativo en una entidad publica de donde obtiene sus ingresos para el hogar.

El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de dos habitaciones, revoque (significa planchar la pared con estuco) y pintura,  mejorando así su calidad de vida. Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. C. is married and lives in his own house with his wife and children (ages 16, 15, 9, and 7) in the Gran Poder District of the city of La Paz. He works for a public entity as an administrative assistant in order to earn household income. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair two rooms, as well as plaster (apply stucco) and paint the walls, which will improve his quality of life. This is his first loan and the socioeconomic analysis indicates he has a favorable rating, which qualifies him to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair two rooms in his house; apply stucco and paint to the walls

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
La presidenta de este comite es la señora Jorgelina quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Ella viaja hasta los lugares donde puede adquirir los pollos a menos precio que en el mercado y los vende en su comunidad.
Comenta que esta actividad le deja buena ganancia y que seguira trabajando ya que para ella es muy satisfactorio ayudar a su familia.
Solicita nuevamente el prestamo para invertir en su negocio, compra de pollos en gran cantidad.
Se encuentra muy contenta con sus comprañeras del comité ya que todas las integrantes son trabajadoras y  trabajan para salir  adelante con su esfuerzo y  en nombre del grupo  agradece a la Fundacion por ayudarlas y tener cada una su puesto de trabajo  que ayuda a sus familias.
texts.en:
The president of this group is Jorgelina, who sells chicken. She travels to places where she can buy the chickens at lower prices than in the market, and then sells them in her community. She comments that this activity gives her good earnings and that she will continue working since she is very pleased to be able to help her family. She requests a new loan to invest in her business, to buy chickens in bulk. She is very content with her fellow group members since all of the members are hardworking people who are making an effort to get ahead. On behalf of the group she thanks the Fundacion for helping them so that each can have their own job to help their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chicken

loans.name: Maria Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario María se encuentra conformado por María de Jesús R. T. de 40 años, María Auxiliadora A. M.  de 33 y Sonia del Carmen Hernández de 27 años, tres féminas luchadoras del departamento de Masaya.

María de Jesús es la coordinadora y se dedica a la venta de ropa bordada para niñas de manera ambulante en Nindirí y Masaya, ella misma realiza los bordados y fabrica la ropa, dado que ya hace tiempo atrás que aprendió este oficio y decidió sacarle provecho.

María Auxiliadora es fotógrafa, tiene un estudio en su casa de habitación donde cualquiera puede llegar y solicitar sus servicios ya sea en el mismo local o a domicilio; finalmente Sonia, quien es la más joven está incursionando en el comercio de la venta de ropa, pero recibe buenos consejos de sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
The María solidarity group is made up of María de Jesús R. T., age 40; María Auxiliadora A. M., age 33; and Sonia del Carmen Hernández, age 27. They are three hard-working women from the Masaya department. María de Jesús is the group coordinator, and she sells embroidered children's clothing in the street markets of Nindiri and Masaya. She does the embroidery herself and makes the clothing, since she learned the trade long ago and decided to take advantage of it. María Auxiliadora is a photographer. She has a studio in her home, where anyone can go and request her services, either in her location or in their homes. Finally, Sonia, who is the youngest member, is just entering into clothing sales, but she gets good advice from her group members.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of material

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of ladies' underclothes, dresses and head-ties

loans.name: Janet Awuor

texts.en:
Janet Awuor O. is 37 years old and married to Francis Mweu, a businessman who contributes to the family’s income. They have two children ages sixteen and thirteen years. They live in the rift-west area of Kitale, Kenya. Janet has been operating a general store for twelve years and earns a monthly profit of 30,000 KES.

Janet learned about KADET through a credit officer. She is applying for a second loan of 20,000 KES from KADET, which she intends to use to buy 100 liters of cooking oil, two bags of sugar and five bundles of baking flour. With the anticipated profits from her loan, she plans to build a rental house and secure a steady income flow.

In the future Janet wishes to live a better and more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy 100 liters of cooking oil, two bags of sugar and five bundles of baking flour

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian L. is 33 years old, widowed and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Tinabalan, a part of Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Vivian runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells biscuits, breads and snacks to the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Vivian joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Vivian successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Vinnie

texts.en: Vinnie is a 37-year-old single mother of three children living in a rented permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. Her family dream is to have all the children complete tertiary institutions and improve her household income. She owns a clothing shop and for six years, she has seen it grow tremendously from her initial capital of 1,500,000 shillings to 3,000,000 shillings. Although there is the challenge of limited capita, she still hopes to see it grow. Just like most parents, Vinnie is faced with the challenge of paying school fees for her children on time and thus needs credit. Vinnie needs the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mong

texts.en: Mong R., 53, is married and resides with his wife and five children in the province of Batambong, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. R. is a construction worker, earning an income of about 5 USD per day. His wife is a tailor, earning an income of about 3 USD per day. R. has to spend 30 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 5 USD on other necessary expenses every month. R. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. R.'s wife appears in the photograph because R. is not available.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
Twenty members form this village loan. They are located in Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province. This loan group selected 66-year-old Mr. Sum M. as the village bank president. The members of this village will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mr. Sum M. and his wife, Mrs. Sokhon, are farmers who own a piece of land that they use to cultivate citronella grass. They do not have enough money to cultivate it. So, Mr. Sum M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. Besides farming, Mr. Sum M. is also a horse cart driver. 
This couple has two children who are the farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to grow citronella grass.

loans.name: Zosa

texts.en:
Zosa L., from the village of Lower Dicayas, is 33 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. Zosa operates a family member's business in the services sector, sewing and making dresses in the local community. Engaged in this business for over a year, she earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Zosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase materials and accessories for dressmaking activities, she is requesting her second loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase accessories for motorcycle repair. Zosa plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for motorcycle repair

loans.name: Joseph Muchai

texts.en:
Joseph, 33 years old, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  He wants to diversify his sources of income by entering the motorcycle transport business.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a motorbike.

In future, Joseph hopes to grow in the transport business and have his own taxi.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen V., 57, resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She sells traditional cakes, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 15 on other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a tuk tuk for her nephew to start a business as a tuk tuk driver. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a tuk tuk for her nephew to start a business.

loans.name: Paen's Group

texts.en:
In Preaek Hour Kaeut, this village bank loan has seven members. It is located in the Kandal province. Each member of this village bank will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Paen S. R. was born in 1967. She is the village bank president selected by the other members. She earns her living by selling groceries in the  village. In order to increase her income to improve her famiL.’s situation, she would like to ask for a loan to buy mobile phone top up cards to sell. Her husband, Mr. Kong Sopheap, is 49 years old and works as a police officer and is able to receive a little income to support his famiL.. 

This couple has two children who are students in the local school and also support their mother's business.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone top up cards to sell.

loans.name: Liana Del Carmen

texts.es: Liana Del Carmen se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Ella ha puesto mucho empeño por mejorar su negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio. Ella se levanta temprano para alistar su bolso en donde prepara todos los productos que le mostrara a sus diferentes clientes, por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que ellos le solicitan. Es por este motivo que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Liana Del Carmen sells general merchandise; she’s had this business for over four years.  She has put a lot of effort into improving her business so this isn’t her first loan for it.

She rises very early to organize her bundle where she puts all the products she will show to various customers; she is always on the lookout for what they request.

Because of this she’s asking for this loan to buy merchandise like: purses, shoes and cosmetics, among other items.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rosas De Ojo Zarco Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Cristina A. L. una integrante del grupo "ROSA DE OJO ZARCO" que esta ubicado en la cuidad de nogales en el estado de VeraC. en México. La señora Cristina se dedica a la venta de producto de belleza que inicio hace mas de 4 años. Solicita este prestamo para invertir más mercancía, cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen y mejorara sus ingresos. Al momento de solictar este prestamo se siente feliz porque asi podra tener una estabilidad en su economia. tiene 34 años estudió hasta la universidad, es madre tiene dos hijos; un varon y una mujer. Desea este crédito para ofrecerles una mejor vida a su familia. También espera poner un local donde tenga más productos de belleza. Mayra O. es la tesorera del grupo tiene 29 años, estudió hasta la preparatoria y es madre, ella se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo que inició hace 3 años, solicoita este prestamo para incrementar en sus ventas y poder satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes, obteniendo así una estabilidad economica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the house of Señora Cristina A. L., a member of the "ROSA DE OJO ZARCO" group, which is located in the city of Nogales in the state of VeraC. in Mexico. 

Señora Cristina sells beauty products, a business that she started over four years ago.  She is requesting this loan in order purchase more stock and fulfill her orders, so that she can increase her income. She feels happy asking for this loan because it will provide her with economic stability. Señora Cristina is 34 years old and she is educated to university level. She is a mother of two children, a boy and a girl. She wants this loan in order to provide a better life for her family. She also hopes to set up a store where she can have more beauty products. 

Mayra O. is the group treasurer. She is a 29-year-old mother who studied through high school. She sells footwear through a catalog, a business that she started three years ago. She is requesting this loan in order to boost her sales and fulfill customer orders, thus gaining economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: C6227 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Verene is 40 years old.  She is a widow with four children between the ages of 6 and 20. She is the representative of a group called "Dufatanye" in the local language. Verene and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses and earn more profits. Verene is the first person on the left in the picture. 

Verene owns a small shop that sells beans, sorghum, and other goods. She has three years of experience in her business. She employs one person in her business as a helper so that her business runs well. 

With the profits, Verene will build a comfortable house; she also needs a refrigerator, which will allow her to create a new business of selling cold soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy beans and sorghum

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support four children. Roselyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Roselyn requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy materials to repair a fishing boat.

Roselyn has been in this business for 20 years. Roselyn earns more income with a business buying and selling boneless danguet (fish).

In the future, Roselyn would like to buy an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: Buy materials for the repair of fishing boat

loans.name: Ma Santos

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Santos le está haciendo falta cambiar toda la instalación de la electricidad en la casa, ya que esta actualmente esta en muy malas condiciones y tiene miedo que pueda pasar un accidente y le pueda pasar algo a su familia. 
Solicita el préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de relazar la mejora.
Pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleada de una fabrica, ya que su esposo el señor Juan se encargara de los gastos familiares de la casa, con el sueldo que obtiene de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Santos's house is in need of a new electricity installation since the current one is in very bad shape and she is worried there could be an accident and someting could happen to her family.

She is requesting a loan because she doesn't have the money right now to buy the material she needs and to pay the person who will carry out this improvement.

She plans to pay back the loan with the income she earns from her job in a factory.  Her husband, Juan, covers the family's household expenses with his salary.

loans.use: To install electricity in her house

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with one boy who attends school. They live at a rental house; it has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, rent bills, food and clothing. 

For the past two years, she has operated a boda boda (motorbike transport) business. She also sells charcoal, which contributes to her other source of income. Josephine faces a major challenge of competition from other motorbike operators in her area of operation. She dreams of purchasing two more motorbikes in the future. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings she is requesting, she wants to purchase 60 sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 60 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married with four children at the age of 42 years. To earn more income, Norma ventures in different businesses such as direct selling of beauty products, retailing of cell phone load and charcoal vending in their village. Through these businesses, she generates an income of approximately PHP 9,000 a month. She has been in these activities for five years.

With her desire to make her businesses more progressive, especially her direct selling, Norma opted to take a PHP 50,000 loan from ASKI and KIVA lenders. She will use the amount to purchase beauty products such as lotion, lipstick, make-up and powder.

Norma hopes that her business endeavors will become successful.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as lotion, lipstick, make-up and powder

loans.name: Elorde

texts.en:
Rice farming is Elorde's way of supporting his family's needs. At the age of 45, he is really working hard just to give the best for his four school-aged children. With his diligence, he is earning PHP 25,000 during harvest season. He saves most of his income for the educational expenses of his children.

Since farming is his main livelihood, Elorde wants to keep on doing this activity and eventually have more hectares of farmland to till. With that, he is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and other farm inputs that he needs. He believes that with the loan and his perseverance, his dreams will come into reality.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is into multiple businesses, including cooking banku and kenkey and selling corn and bags of gari in Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of gari for resale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to buy land. In this photograph, Grace is sitting by a bag of gari.

loans.use: to buy bags of gari for resale.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is aged 35 and married with two children. He has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya, where he produces milk and grows maize and beans. He has been farming for twelve years now and sells his produce locally. He is also a mason.

With a loan of 62,400 KES, he intends to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that he will be able to purchase a quality dairy cow which will produce enough milk for domestic sale and family consumption. He faces the challenge of the fluctuation in market prices for farm produce and the lack of enough animal feed.

The extra income from this loan will enable him to afford a better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is married and a mother of three school-age children. She is 47 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
Arlyn has a retail shop at home selling different food products like canned goods, food in pouches, noodles, candies and milk in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for three years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 3,000 from this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase grocery stocks to sell.

Arlyn has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Arlyn hopes to expand her business and purchase a motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock to sell.

loans.name: Juan Pastor

texts.es:
Juan, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y tienen tres hijos de 36, 30 y 25 años de edad, cada uno tiene su propio hogar independiente, Juan siembra maíz y frijol desde hace 30 años, aprendió junto a su padre, trabaja todos los días sin un horario definido.
Por el momento se encuentra sembrando la milpa y solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, pesticidas, para aplicar en la milpa, todo pues para garantizar una buena siembra y cosecha de maíz y frijol.
Su objetivo es apoyar a su esposa con la alimentación del hogar, trabajando para cubrir los gastos y estar al pendiente de su familia.
texts.en: Juan is a farmer and lives with his wife.  They have three children who are 36, 30, and 25 years old and each live on their own.  Juan has farmed corn and beans for 30 years.  He learned this trade alongside his father and works every day without a fixed schedule.  He is currently planting corn and asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his fields in order to guarantee a good corn and bean harvest.  His goal is to support his wife with the food they eat, working to cover their expenses and care for his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticides for his corn crop

loans.name: George

texts.en: George, 35, is an honest, hardworking, and responsible businessman. He is married and blessed with two children who go to school. For the last three years, he has been making a living from engaging in the transport business. He wants in the next five years to have accumulated enough capital to open up other businesses. His dream is to expand his business and provide employment to others. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to repair his motorbike. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering him economically and financially.

loans.use: to repair his motor bike

loans.name: Ñustas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ÑUSTAS.” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Flora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Flora, indica que hace once años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando cuando inicio la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de comercialización de materiales escolares (librería y bazar), que viene trabajando hace diez años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de materiales educativos), que comprara de las tiendas que venden por mayor y lo comercializará en su librería. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud
texts.en:
The ÑUSTAS community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo II regional office.  The bank has seven members and is managed by a board of directors which is led by Flora.  The businesses that the members of this community bank are engaged in are varied and include commerce, production and services.

Flora says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for eleven years and joined when the institution started out.  She currently runs a business selling school supplies (stationery and miscellaneous goods).  She has been in this business for ten years.

Flora will use the loan that she is requesting to increase her capital (buying school supplies).  She will buy her supplies from wholesale stores and she will sell them in her stationery store.  This work enables her to make income with which to support her family.  Flora is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Flora replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Every individual has the strong desire to become successful to enjoy happiness in life. Likewise, Carmelita wants to become successful to lift her living status and give her children a bright future. She is 31 years old, married and has one infant child. Due to lack of job opportunities, she engages in hog raising to supplement her husband's income. She has been in this business for almost 5 years and usually earns a profit of 8,000 PHP for every 2 live pigs sold on a weight basis.

She wants to ask for additional capital of 7,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that the loan will help a lot to make her business grow. She mentioned that she needs to work hard and strive harder to make her dream into a reality.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is married and has five children. For the last five years she has sold raw beans, ground nuts, and rice in Jukwa, which is in Ghana’s central region. Adwoa is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase cereals to sell. With the profits, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to sell.

loans.name: Solviana

texts.en:
Solviana is a 32-year-old lady; people usually call her "Solvy".  She is married to Ricky, 34 years old. They have been blessed with two children namely: Rista, 10, and studying in the fourth grade of Elementary School and Elki, 8, studying in the third grade of Elementary School.

Solvy originated from Sumatra Island. She is a housewife who has been running an internet stall business for about two years. Her business place is located about 1 km from her house. It is open for business from 09.00 am to 01.00 am. She manages the business together with her husband. 

Solvy is planning to purchase a new computer for her business but she doesn’t have enough capital to do so. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She hopes that the loan will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica de 30 años de edad, convive con Alberto de 35 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Cuando Mónica tenía 25 años, contaba con un pequeño restaurante, donde expendía diversos platos a gusto del cliente, con este negocio estuvieron casi dos años, donde lograron recaudar un capital como para poder emprender un nuevo negocio. Actualmente se dedica en la venta de pollos a la brasa, negocio que le esta yendo bien, debido a la buena sazón con esta preparado, eso le da más ventaja para ganar más gente. En un inicio su local no estaba muy amoblado, pero poco a poco fue comprando lo que faltaba e iba decorando el ambiente, hoy está súper feliz con este negocio gracias a las recomendaciones de sus clientes, quienes le dieron la idea de emprender éste trabajo. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 soles, comprará utensilios de cocina que tanto le hace falta.
texts.en:
Mónica, 30, lives with Alberto, 35, with whom she has two children.  They all live together in their own house located in Sivia District.  

When Mónica was 25 years old she opened a small restaurant where she’d sell various dishes according to her customers’ wishes.  They had this business for about two years and were able to gather capital together to start a new business.  At present, she sells grilled chicken, a business she’s doing well in thanks to her tasty preparation which is an advantage for her to attract more customers.  

At the beginning, it wasn’t furnished very well but she gradually bought what she needed and decorated the environment.  Today, she is super happy with this business thanks to the recommendations of her customers who gave her the idea to start this business.

This will be her first MFP loan so she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She will use the 1500 soles to buy the kitchen utensils she so very much needs.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Karina Lizzette

texts.es:
Karina, está nuevamente solicitando el préstamo para aumentar el negocio, comprando joyas de oro, pantalones, camisas y lencería, esta nueva inversión espera que le ayude para mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio.
Karina ha realizado las inversiones con el prestamo anterior y piensa que su condición ha mejorado por la ayuda de los préstamos, tanto sus ventas como los ingresos para el hogar ha sido mejor.
texts.en:
Karina is requesting a new loan so that she can increase her business. She will buy gold jewelry, trousers, shirts, and lingerie. This new investment is expected to improve the availability of products in her business.

Karina has made investments with her previous loan and believes her condition has improved as a result. Both her sales and her income have gotten better.

loans.use: to buy gold jewelry, trousers, shirts, and lingerie.

loans.name: Zebojon

texts.ru: Более 8 лет Зебоджон занимается купля продажей скота. Она замужем и у них двое детей. Зебоджон трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Она любит свою работу и с удовольствием продолжает свое дело. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Зебоджон запрашивает займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Она заранее благодарна всем за помощь и понимание. Мы нуждаемся в вашу поддержку! Спасибо вам!
texts.en: For more than eight years, Zebojon has bought and sold cattle. She is married and has two children. Zebojon is a hard-working, responsible woman. She loves her work, and is eager to continue with her business. She wants to expand her business and maximise profits. Zebojon is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy more cattle, with the goal of growing her business. She is thankful for everyone's help and understanding. We need your support! Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase animals

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, de 36 años, es una mujer trabajadora, dinámica y deseosa de progresar. Esta separada, pero vive en compañía de su madre y sus dos hijos de 17 y 10 años en su casa que es propia. La actividad que realiza Judith es la costura, elabora todo tipo de prendas de vestir a pedido de sus clientes, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Aprendió este oficio gracias a que se inscribió en un centro de educación ocupacional, viendo las necesidades económicas que tenía en su hogar; y tuvo como herramienta una maquina de coser que logró adquirir gracias a un préstamo que solcito hace ocho años. Lo que le gusta de actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico con el cual pueda solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que ahora estando sola, es el sostén de su familia. Comenta que le gusta coser, desde muy pequeña le llamo la atención, y gracias a esta oportunidad tiene un trabajo. Tiene planes de poder ampliar su negocio, y renovarlo. Comprando otra maquina de coser y así renovar la que tiene. Este sería el crédito número trece con la institución MFP, se siente bien con el trabajo de su banco comunal, el poder compartir con otras personas, y considera a todos sus miembros ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, elásticos y demás accesorios de costura, ya que cuenta con pedidos que tiene por entregar.
texts.en: Judith is 36 years old. She is a hard-working and dynamic woman with a great desire to make progress. She is separated, but she lives with her mother and her two children, aged 17 and 10, in a house that she owns. Judith's work is tailoring. She makes all kinds of garments in response to orders from her clients, for men, women and children. She learned this profession when she signed up at an occupational education center. She had the economic needs of her household in mind, and she had a sewing machine as a tool, which she was able to acquire thanks to a loan she applied for eight years ago. What she likes about her work is being able to have an income to cover her household expenses, since she is now the only breadwinner in her family. She comments that she likes to sew -- she was already interested in it as a young girl -- and thanks to this opportunity she has a job. She has plans to expand her business and update it by purchasing another sewing machine so she can renovate the one she has. This will be her thirteenth loan with the MFP institution. She feels good about the work of her communal bank, since she can share with other people, and she thinks all of the members are good people. With the amount she is requesting, she will invest in buying fabrics, threads, elastic and other tailoring supplies, since she has orders she needs to fill.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread and elastic.

loans.name: Esperanza En Ti Group

texts.en:
Saturnina is the coordinator of her group "Esperanza en ti" (Hope in You). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and only one child. She says that her most difficult challenges have been to finish building her house, to buy a computer for her children, and to finish studying. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying reading and visiting friends. She started very young, and she likes it a lot.

Saturnina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for nine years. She started selling underwear with some money she saved from her first business selling wallets and handbags. She began to focus on selling underwear because it was a more popular item. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying underclothes for women, kids, and men. She will use the profits to buy building materials for her house. 

Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy underclothes.

loans.name: Daisy Paola

texts.es:
Daisy de 30 años, vende productos de uso personal, empezó con este negocio por recomendaciones de los vecinos, se dedico a aprender esta actividad y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Trabaja sola por las mañana vende en la escuela de los hijos y por las tarde pos su barrio. Sus dificultades son la falta de capital para invertir en mercadería, y la delincuencia del sector en el que vive. Está casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer de un taxi, tiene 3 hijos de 9, 8, y 7 que estudian en escuela particular.

Quiere comprar con el prestamo perfumes y cosmeticos para un mayor ingreso. Su meta es poder seguir adelante con su negocio para así poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
30-year-old Daisy sells personal care products, and first started her business via referrals from her neighbors. She has been learning the business and thanks God that it has been a success.

Daisy sells her products at the children's school in the mornings and in her neighborhood in the afternoons. Her main challenges are the lack of capital available to invest in merchandise, and the crime level in the sector in which they live. She is married and her husband works as a taxi driver. They have three children aged seven, eight and nine who attend private school. 

With the loan, Daisy wants to buy more perfumes and cosmetics to achieve a higher income. Her goal is for her business to progress successfully so that she can help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and cosmetics for subsequent sale

loans.name: Jacklin

texts.en: Jacklin is 30 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. She has had a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for two years.  She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhon, age 44, has spent most of her life time cultivating rice for her livelihood. She always works alongside her husband on the existing farmland. She in now blessed with six children, one of who lives independently and has started a new family. 

At this time, for her second loan, she is asking for 3,000,000 Riel (KHR). She'll use the loan to pay for a rented plantation, on which she plans to grow her potato crops this year. With the increase in income, she'll save to buy a medium size plantation for growing potatoes and other types of crops.

loans.use: to pay for a rented plantation.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, age 21, is single. He lives with his parents in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phally is a farmer who grows cucumbers, beans and cauliflower. He is a asking for his first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

Photo: Phally is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Paciencia

texts.en:
Paciencia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Paciencia has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Paciencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Paciencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Gs Salgamos Adelante Group

texts.es:
El Señor Elvin, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y cuenta con l apoyo de su pareja en el manejo de su negocio, Su actividad principal es la venta de carne de cerdo y venta de nacatamales, tiene  13 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, Elvin esta solicitando el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de cerdos y para la elaboración de nacatamales, para la buena atención de sus clientes, Elvin es una persona muy trabajadora y su negocio esta ubicado en su casas de habitación, contando con toda la clientela de la zona donde el habita siendo su principal fuente de ingresos, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Elvin, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Elvin sueña con tener una caseta en la calle principal de la comunidad.
Indalecia, se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos de segunda mano, venta de cerdos para cría y venta  de maíz.
Melbi, se dedica a la venta de abarroteria (pulpería).
Kathy, se dedica a la venta nacatamales, y  cuenta con  2  años de experiencia en el manejo del mismo.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Mayo 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de cerdos y para la elaboración de nacatamales para su negocio

loans.name: Dovya Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 40's, is married and living with her husband and two adult children.  She has been running a genge business, selling coconuts and Irish potatoes, for one year and a half.  She works from 9am to 6pm daily, and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

Mariam is requesting her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy more genge stock and to save for any unforeseen event.  Her dream is to be able to open a fish business one day.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Dovya," which has 18 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more genge stock, such as coconuts and potatoes, and to save for any unforeseen event.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mr Mamadou est âgée de 33 ans, marié, mais pas d’enfant, vit chez son père dans le quartier Koko de la préfecture de Koutiala, région de Sikasso. Il exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat et vente d’essence depuis plus de 15ans, il détient aussi un lieu de lavage autos et motos. Ces activités lui procurent assez de revenu, sa notoriété est bonne car il reçoit beaucoup de clients. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de ses activités, Mamadou a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso. il est à son 1ère Prêt individuel. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour l’achat d’essence et les nécessaires pour les activités de lavage des auto et motos (factures eau, savons en poudre, brosses, raccord, serviettes etc). Il s’approvisionne à Koutiala. Mamadou effectue sa vente et son service  à Koutiala à une clientèle mixte au comptant. 
Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Mamadou  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, satisfaire ces  besoins personnels et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Il compte sur le financement de Soro  pour élargir son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou is 33 years old, married without children, and lives with his father in the Koko neighborhood of the Koutiala prefecture, in the Sikasso region. He has been running a business based on trading gasoline for over 15 years, and also runs a car and motorbike self-wash business.

These activities provide him with sufficient income, and he enjoys a good reputation since he gets a lot of customers. To ensure customer satisfaction and expand his activities, Mamadou has called upon the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. This is his first individual loan.

This loan will be used to buy gasoline and the products needed for his car and motorbike self-wash business (water bills, powdered soap, brushes, fittings, towels, etc). He resupplies in Koutiala, conducts his sales and provides his services in Koutiala to a mixed clientele, for cash.

With the expansion of his business, Mamadou hopes to attain monthly profits of 75,000 CFA francs, he will use to reimburse Soro interests and meet his personal needs. The remainder will be reinvested in his business.

He is counting on Soro financing for future expansion of his business.

loans.use: buy gasoline and items needed to wash cars and motorbikes

loans.name: Ketevani

texts.en:
Ketevani, 50 year-old woman, lives in village Norio with her brother and pensioner parents. The only source of income for them is from a small agribusiness. Ketevani takes care with milked-cow and produces cheese for local selling. However she gets really small income as only one cow isn't enough to get the significant income form this business. Ketevani needs financial support to expand her trading activity and make it more profitable. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions. After several unsuccessful attempts, Ketevani applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Ketevani will invest the money for developing her present business and start purchasing stock of cheese from local people and sell at the market in increased prices. She will also start trading with eggs and make the significant source of income, that will help the family to bail out from financial instability. 
Ketevani and her family members rely on a good will of the lenders and will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To trade with cheese and eggs

loans.name: Apostol

texts.en: Apostol H. was born in Asenovgrad but many years he and his wife lived in the near big city Plovdiv. He was a fireman and she worked as a constructor in a factory producing typing machines. After his retirement Apostol and his wife moved to Asenovgrad where he started own farming business. Apostol breeds 40 cows and 15 calves. A great help in this business give his two sons. Apostol H. wants to equip a milking hall and needs $ 1 800.

loans.use: To equip a milking hall

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana has a beauty salon in her home. She opened her business with the help of her sister who taught her the trade and gave her some start up capital. At the beginning she only did men’s haircuts. Now she still offers this service as well as skin cleaning, manicures and pedicures. She would like to make improvements to her salon and is certain that with the new service her clients will be happier and her business will grow.

Mariana is 32 years old, married and has four children who go to school. She is convinced that the loan will improve her family’s economic condition and allow her to continue to grow her business to save money and give her children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariana tiene un gabinete de belleza en su domicilio. Mariana empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su hermana quien le enseño la profesión y le facilito el capital para que emprendiera su negocio. Al principio solo se dedicaba a los cortes de cabello para caballeros. Ahora ofrece este mismo servicio junto con limpieza de cutis y manicure y pedicure. Ella aspira adecuar su gabinete. Ella tiene la plena seguridad que con este nuevo servicio sus clientes se sentirán contentos y va ha tener crecimiento. Mariana esta unida. Tiene 32 años tiene cuatro hijos que estudian. Ella esta convencida que con este préstamo mejorara el nivel económico de su familia y seguirá creciendo en el negocio para ahorrar y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Make improvements to her place of business

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa is a young, married mother of two children.  She was once employed in the capital city as a cashier at the pharmacy, but she was forced to resign because she didn’t have any affordable childcare options available for her children while she was at work.  However, her family relied on the income that Lisa brought in, so in order to remain the income earner, she developed a small taro plantation near her house.  By hauling her crop to market twice a week, she can actually earn more than she was able to receive in her weekly wages in town.  So Lisa is anxious to use loan funds to purchase some fertilizers and tools to enhance her crop yield and increase her income further.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and tools

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old and has a small shop in the south of Kirkuk to repair electronic equipment. He has a big family; four children and his mother live with him. He is responsible for supporting them. He wants this loan to purchase new equipment for the shop so that he can increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personal attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (e.g., masking portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new equipment

loans.name: Ni Putu Kalih

texts.id:
Ni Putu Kalih has a pig farming business that she already have for a while to help her husband's tenant farmer income. Ni Putu Kalih only raise 1 mother pig which is highly pregnant. Pregnancy time is only 3 months, and usually it gave birth to up to 8 piglets. These piglets were raised for 3 months, and feed cost for the 3 months could reach Rp 300,000 (about US$33). Raising and feedding was done 2 times a day, at 7:00 AM, and 3:00PM. So far income from raising could reach up to Rp2,400,000 (US$264). Nett profit after 6 months could reach up to Rp1,100,000 (about $121). That profit was used for family expense with a husband and a child, and to repair her home.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Kalih mempunyai usaha beternak babi yang sudah ditekuni sejak lama untuk membantu mendapatkan tambahan pendapatan suaminya yang bekerja sebagi seorang petani. Ni Putu Kalih hanya memelihara 1 ekor babi Induk yang sedang hamil besar, masa hamil hanya 3 bulan dan biasanya melahirkan sampai 8 ekor anak.Anak babi hanya dipelihara selama 3 bulan biaya perawatan dan pakan selama 3 bulan dapat mencapai Rp.300.000,-Pemeliharaan dan pemberian makan dilakukan 2 kali sehari yaitu jam 07.00 pagi dan jam 3.00 sore.Hasil penjualan selama pemeliharaan dapat mencapai Rp.2.400.000,- jadi keuntungan bersih selama 6 bulan mecapai Rp.1.100.000,- dari hasil keuntungan pelihara ternak babi dipakai untuk kehidupan keluarganya dengan suami dan 1 orang anaknya, dan dipakai untuk memperbaiki rumahnya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Rose I. is into wholesale sales of flour and oil. She is 32 years old, married with 4 children.  Rose has had her business for 6 years and started her own in 2003. She is also the secretary of her union. Rose needs the loan of $800 to buy more flour and oil for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more flour and oil for sale

loans.name: Tapuni

texts.en: Tapuni is from the village of Satapuala. She runs a pancake business - she sells pancakes at a village primary school and to the village people six days a week. Tapuni usually makes about $300 WST (US$120) a week. She is doing well with the payment of her first loan, and is working hard to be able to borrow from SPBD again in the future. Tapuni is one of the oldest members of the loan program, and is currently asking for her second loan which will be used to buy bags of flour, sugar, and a fryer for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of flour, sugar and a fryer for a pancake business

loans.name: Thi Tam

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tâm, 38 years of age, has 2 children: one boy and one girl. They are both at school age. She sells chè, variety of Vietnamese sweet deserts made from different kinds of bean and sugar. She’s been doing this for many years now. Because her house is situated right at the central part of Chờ township, her chè stand is very popular. Its customers are in all walks of life, from level 3 students to government workers. Her husband is not well so she has to take care the household by herself. Everyday she gets up early to cook chè, then prepares feed for pigs. She gets few pigs for extra income. She would like to apply for a loan at Binh Minh to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Tâm, 39 tuổi, có 2 con, 1 trai, 1 gái vẫn còn đang đi học. Chị bán hàng chè (được nấu bằng các loại đỗ và đường...) từ nhiều năm nay. Nhà chị ở trung tâm ở thị trấn Chờ nên chị bán hàng khá đông khách. Khách hàng của chị rất phong phú từ các em học sinh cấp III đến công chức, người dân..., đều có. Chồng chị không được khỏe lắm nên mọi việc đều do chị thu vén và sắp xếp. Hàng ngày, chị phải dậy sớm để nấu chè và nấu cám cho lợn ăn. Nhà chị có chăn nuôi thêm đàn lợn để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị mong muốn vay vốn ở Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Bình minh cdc vì theo chị, nó chia nhỏ khỏan nợ và chị có thể dễ dàng trả được nợ.

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam A. is 40-years-old, married with two children and lives in Itire in Lagos State, Nigeria. Since 1993. she has been in the business of selling plywood. Her loan request of $450 is to purchase additional inventory  for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional plywood for resale

loans.name: Keyla

texts.es:
Mrs. Keyla Isabel is 30 years old and mother to an 11 year old son named Jonathan. With much effort she has purchased a mototaxi which provides daily sustenance to her family. It is driven by her husband and managed by Keyla. Her wish is to soon build a school services with these vehicles which means she must ask for a loan to acquire another mototaxi to increase her income and make her goal reality.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Keyla Isabel, de 30 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 11 años, de nombre Jonathan, con mucho esfuerzo a comprado un mototaxi, herramienta de sustento diario para su familia que es conducida por su esposo y administrada por ella.Su deseo de construir pronto una empresa de servicios escolares con estos vehículos la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir un mototaxi más a fin de elevar sus ingresos y hacer más factible su anhelo.

loans.use: Purchase a mototaxi.

loans.name: Cheka's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en: Cheka is 28 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 12 and 8 years old. She and her husband also take care of another child, who is 16 years old. Cheka is charcoal and firewood seller through a business she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $650 to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Anjelina, Mwanamkasi, Halima and Marina, who have businesses dealing in cloth sales and fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Guljihon

texts.en:
K. Guljihon is 40 years old, married and has five children. She works as a farmer, growing crops such as wheat, potatoes, maize and onions. She also raises cattle. Her husband and older son help her in this business. The son helps with cattle-breeding and her husband with farming. Guljihon and her husband have worked their land for the last five years, and farming is their main means of support.

Guljihon has applied for a loan of $900, which she will pay back in nine months. She will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and fodder for her cattle. Guljihon promises to pay back the loan faithfully, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and fodder for cattle

loans.name: Obidjon

texts.en:
Obidjon O. was born in 1970 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Mr. O. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008. He has been in the livestock business for 20 years and has excellent practical skills in that field. Mr. O. dreams of having a big livestock farm so he is ready to work hard. He also works on a collective farm.

Mr. O. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of $925 US for 6 months to purchase some rams.

loans.use: To purchase some rams

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila S., who is married with one son, sells household items in the central market of Kherson. Ludmila is a hard worker and has invested $2400 in her business over the six years it has been in operation. She is disciplined and responsible, promptly repaying three previous Nadiya Ukraine loans.

Ludmila dreams of having a stable source of income so that she can become economically independent and live in an apartment. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $675 to help increase her turnover capital. Ludmila has persevered through many challenges with optimism and enthusiasm. She is friendly and organized, both characteristics of an excellent business woman.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Isi

texts.en: Isi O. is 44 years old, married and has five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she makes a living selling provisions and foodstuffs. Isi has been in business since 1998 and has decided to apply for a loan of $875 to buy a refrigerator because this will help her provide better service to her customers. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy more items to sell. She thanks you for your consideration and support.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Revina

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza Tanzania!! Revina K. is a married woman with three children aged between 13 and 18 years old. Revina is 40 years old. She opened her beauty saloon in 2003, and she has two employees who assist in running the business. She works 9 hours a day and 6 days a week. She earns a monthly profit of about $50 from this business.

Revina is requesting a loan of $450 so that she can buy other hair products, such as shampoo and weavings. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the products she offers. Revina thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buy other hair product such as shampoo and weavings for the salon

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long S., 35, is married and lives with her husband and four of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2002, she has been selling many kinds of vegetables in the village to earn a living, and is able to make about US$1.50 each day, while her husband is employed in construction, making US$5 per day. Two of their children are students and one is a garment factory worker with a daily income US$2.50 per day. Long said she spends around US$75 each month on expenses and US$15 on her children's education. To double the family's income, Mrs. Long would like to take out a loan to breed cows. In the future, she plans to set up another business of selling groceries.

loans.use: To breed cows.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov N., 49, and her husband, Mr. Choeun Pol, 67, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. The children are all married and live outside the family house.

Mrs. Pov and her husband have been in the business of selling bananas since 2003. They buy them from farmers in their village for reselling at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a soldier as well.

Mrs. Pov is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase bananas for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase bananas for resale.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Mrs. Maxima A. A. is a member of ASHI in San Francisco North, group 1, Center 38, Tibiao, Antique, Philippines.  She is a 53-year-old mother married to Mr. Enrico A. and has 10 children.  They live in a mountain site of the district of San Francisco North Tibiao, Antique.  She was encouraged to join ASHI because of the principles of the institution: helping women to show their skills through lending them working capital for a business 
as a micro-entrepreneur.  

She used a starting capital of Php 5,000 for charcoal vending, but it's quite dangerous in the community so she had to have a permit from the Municipal Office.  The access to the product in the market is quite difficult, that’s why her daily income cannot cover the needs of her family.  

Her first loan amounting to Php 5,000 got her started in firewood and charcoal vending. She got a one-year term to maintain a good credit rating performance. Because of their dreams, they feet that ASHI will provide a big capital in the near future that they will use in poultry farming so that they can become a supplier of many restaurants in the Municipality of Tibiao.  Maxima needs P10, 000 for a business in native chicken and rice retailing.

She dreams that all her children will finish their studies and they will no longer experience what they experienced before. She marked the day that when she joined ASHI: she begin to dream, hope, and find a way to get out of poverty.

loans.use: Charcoal  Sales

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha O. is a forty-five year old married woman with two children. Both of her children are still in school. It is Martha’s heartfelt desire to help her husband sponsor their two children through to the highest level of academics. They live in Obuasi Township. Martha enjoys trading, and sells bags of rice, crates of eggs, and other food items. She has been in business for over fifteen years. Martha purchases her goods from the villages around Obuasi. She distributes to the local ‘chop bar’ operators in Obuasi. Chop bar is a local term used to refer to restaurant. She wants a loan to be able to procure the goods in large quantities so that she can distribute to a number of clients. Martha is in a group called “Osenkafo”, (Evangelist). The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs, bags of rice, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay S. is 38 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband. She operates a grocery business and is able to make US$ 20 every day in revenue. Her husband, Ros Samart, 45, is a policeman, earning around US$ 3 a day. This couple has four children, one of whom is a policeman while three are students. Mrs. Chhay S. is asking for a loan to rent a yam farm to collect yams for sale.

loans.use: To rent a yam farm to collect yams for sale

loans.name: Nelson Fernando

texts.pt:
Nelson Fernando F. é natural de Maputo cidade e vive neste momento no distrito de Boane, tendo se mudado quando o seu pai foi transferido da cidade para Boane, tem 23 anos de idade, solteiro. É estudante do 3ºano da psicologia escolar.

Nelson é professor permanente a 4 anos, obedecendo um horário de trabalho que vai das 7h as 12h. Com um salário mensal de 5125,00mt faz poupanças n final do mês, vive numa casa própria.

Para Nelson este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro foi de 13000,00mt e este de 18000,00mt para continuidade do projecto de construção, Nelson pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de mobilar a casa.
texts.en:
Nelson Fernando F. is from Maputo and currently lives in the district of Boane, having moved here when he was transferred from the city. He is 23 years old, single and a 3rd year psychology student.

Nelson has been a permanent teacher for 4 years, following a work timetable from 7:00 am to 12:00 noon. With his monthly salary of 5125,00 MZN he manages to save money at the end of the month and lives in his own house.

This is Nelson’s second loan from Hluvuku and his first from Kiva. His first loan was for 13000,00 MZN and this one is for 18000,00 MZN in order to continue the construction of his house. Nelson intends to pay off his loan early so he can request another one to furnish his house.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Mujeres En Gloria 1 Group

texts.en:
Mujeres en Gloria 1 is a group consisting of 5 strong women who want to take out a loan. This is not a gift they are asking for, but a loan from which they can start their own small business. In the area they come from, credit is not readily available unless they borrow from a loan shark who charges unreasonable interest. In the immense poverty they live in, it is hard to find jobs and hard to support a family. For that reason Mujeres en Gloria are hoping to receive a loan and start their own business. This group is ready to work to try and break the chains of poverty.

Isaura N. is the group leader and their representative, and she is very excited about being given the honor. She lives with her husband and her one child. She has not had an easy life. She has had to live in extreme poverty her entire life. Isaura received a high school education, which is more than most in her area. She knows that education is something that is very important if you want to break out of poverty, and for that reason she dreams of sending her child to a university someday. Isaura has a small food stand where she sells items she cooks, but with a loan she will be able to increase the variety of food she sells, and hopefully increase her profit. She is an intelligent, hard working woman who wants nothing more than to improve the life of her child. She is ready to expand her business and is excited about the opportunity. She knows this is the first step in achieving her dream of putting her child through college, and she is ready to take the first step. On behalf of Isaura, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Buy products for food stand

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, actividad que inicio cuando una amiga  la invitó hace aproximadamente 8 años al principio  le ayudaba a ella a vender y le daba una comisión
pero como  le  empezo a ir  muy bien y le gusto tanto, adquirio su membresía y ahora ella es la que vende los zapatos sin necesidad de algún intermediario.

Ella necsita un prestamo por MXN $4500 que pagara en 5 meses para  comprar los nuevos catálogos de la temporada primavera verano y le hicieron pedidos que superaron sus expectativas entonces este crédito le va a ayudar también en poder entregar la mercancia  a tiempo a  sus clientes
texts.en:
Francisca dedicates herself to the sale of shoes through catalogs, an activity that she began after a friend invited her to approximately 8 years ago. When she began her friend helped her and gave her a commission, but because it began to go so well for her and she liked it so much, she acquired a membership and now she is the one who sells the shoes without any need for an intermediary. She needs a loan of 4,500 MXN that she will pay in 5 months to purchase new catalogs for the spring/summer season. Her clients have made orders that surpassed her expectations and this loan will help her to be able to deliver her merchandise on time to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new catalogs and merchandise.

loans.name: Karla Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Karla A. es una persona digna de imitar porque ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio de pulpería que ha logrado suplir en el departamento de Masaya. Ella es una dama muy trabajadora que a pesar de las circunstancias difíciles que ha atravesado siempre ha salido adelante.

Hoy en día ella espera en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería y por este motivo confía en que su crédito será otorgado y así adquirirá los productos a lo inmediato para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla Aragon is a decent and good person because she has managed to succeed in her grocery store business in the department of Masaya (Nicaragua). She is a hard-working lady who, despite the difficult circumstances she has experienced, has always succeeded in pushing ahead. These days she hopes to get credit from Ceprodel for the purchase of goods. Mrs. Aragon is confident that your credit will be awarded to her, so that she can immediately acquire the products and bring them to market.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye S. est un boulanger marié de 30 ans qui sollicite son premier crédit auprès de l’IMCEC et Kiva pour acheter une plaque solaire.  Il dit qu’il n’y a pas de l’électricité dans son village de naissance.  Il a trouvé une plaque solaire bon marche, et il veut l’acheter avant qu’elle est vendue à un autre.  Monsieur S. est boulangère depuis 2003 à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Avant de devenir boulangère, il était pâtissier à Diourbel, un village à l’intérieur du pays.  Il a 5 bœufs comme garantie et il va rembourser le crédit avec son salaire.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye S., age 30, is a married baker who is requesting his first loan from IMCEC and Kiva to buy a solar panel. He says there is no electricity in the village of his birth. He found an inexpensive solar panel, and he want to buy it before it is sold to someone else. Mr. S. has been a baker since 2003 in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. Before becoming a baker, he was a pastry chef in Diourbel, an inland village. He has five steers as collateral, and he’s going to repay the loan with his salary.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a solar panel

loans.name: Los Diamantes Group

texts.en:
Los Diamantes (The Diamonds) Village Bank is made up of thirteen members, almost all of them women. The group members are from the town of Quillabamba, about five hours from the city of Cusco in the province of La Convencion. Quillabamba is referred to as the “eyebrow of the jungle.” The climate is hot and humid, and the area produces many of the bananas, oranges and papayas that are consumed in Cusco. 

The group members are involved in a variety of different activities. For example, Hilda is 32 years old and is the single mother of one child. She and her mother sell prepared lunches at the local market in Quillabamba. For example, today’s meal was noodle soup and fish or pork chops with beans. Hilda starts preparing each day’s meal at 8:30 am. The food is ready by 10 am; then she leaves for the market so that she is ready for each day’s early customers. Hilda also sells perfume by catalog as an extra source of income. She is requesting a loan of 500 soles to buy the perfume that her customers request. She collects payments on a monthly basis. Hilda’s goal for the future is to open her own store and buy a hamburger cart to sell snacks at night. 

Hilda’s aunt, Celia, is also a group member. Celia is 45 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. She also has a lunch stand in Quillabamba’s Mercado Satélite, and has been serving meals for the past eight years. Celia is requesting a loan of 1000 soles so that she can put in a cement floor in her home. Her current floor is dirt. 

Another group member, Maritza, is 31 years old and lives with her partner. She recently started her own business bringing alcohol from Quillabamba to Cusco to sell to stores in the city. She travels every two weeks or so and brings between 110 and 140 kilos of alcohol on each trip. She earns about 50 centimos (17 cents US ) for each kilo she sells, so she earns a total of 50 to 70 soles ($17 to $23) per trip. Maritza is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more alcohol. Each kilo costs 2.35 soles, so her loan will buy her about 425 kilos, enough for 3-4 trips to Cusco.

Los Diamantes have pledged to repay their loan in full and on time. They are the first group from Quillabamba to be listed on Kiva! Their loan officer, Ramiro, is pictured in the red shirt on the far right.

loans.use: To buy perfume and alcohol, and to install a cement floor

loans.name: Nosiriddin

texts.en:
