M. Nosiriddin lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is 41 years old, married and has a child. Nosiriddin is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling cows and sheep at the local market. Every 2-3 months he purchases young animals from local villagers and raises them over an 8-9 month period and later sells the adult cows and sheep to local butchers. Today Nosiriddin is thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase young cattle. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni. Extend your solidarity to Nosiriddin so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all of his goals.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle to raise.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris A. is widowed and has three children, two sons and one daughter, all of whom are all currently in school. She is 48 years old and lives with her children in a house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. For the last 20 years, she has made a living as a baker, supplying bread to retailers and beverage sellers.  She supplements her income from baking by selling various other items needed by people in her community. Doris buys flour and other ingredients from Kumasi, and wants a loan to buy these supplies in bulk. Her main goals are to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour to use to make bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia N. is a single parent with two children. She has had no formal education. Cecilia sells frozen fish and meat at Atabadze near Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Cecilia uses her income to pay her children's school fees. She will use the loan to expand her business by buying more fish for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia intends to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife R. is from the town of Mabini, Baliangao Mis. Occ.. She is 36 years old. Marife is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn and vegetables for sale. Marife has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marife joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Marife is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marife from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: The people shown in the picture above are Chim N. and her husband. Chim N. raises a few pigs in a stall next to her house to earn a living. Additionally, she goes to the forest to collect burnable oil from trees and turns it into glue to sell (it is used in furniture making). Her husband works with her in collecting glue. This older couple married years ago and has six children. Two of their children are employed in different occupations. Chim N. is taking out her loan to buy a piglet to breed, and the rest to buy more tools for scraping glue.

loans.use: To buy a piglet and tools for scraping glue.

loans.name: El Espino Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Espino está formado por tres integrantes de origen muy humilde, de poco hablar y poco letrados, pero asombrosamente muy dados al negocio, disciplinados en sus cuotas, sobresalientes en sus actividades por su buena administración.

Don Miguel Ángel P. coordinador del grupo, posee una vulcanizadora ubicada en el Km 36 1\2 de la carretera que lleva de Masaya a Tipitapa. Negocio que inicio hace aproximadamente 5 años después de retirarse de su trabajo original que era manejar tractores. De ahí la experiencia con reparaciones de vehículos y sobretodo de camiones.

Miguel agradece mucho los créditos que ADIM le ha brindado a pesar de su condición humilde y poca educación, es por esto que nunca ha quedado mal con una cuota. Su crédito lo quiere para realizar un trabajo grande que le han dado que es la  reparación completa de un camión que implicará la compra de pintura, piezas del motor y algunos otros elementos.

Vilma M. trabaja en la elaboración y venta de comidas en su casa de habitación y Silvia compra y vende piezas de oro en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The El Espino group is made up of three members of very humble origins, who are not extremely educated but are incredibly talented at business, disciplined in their loan repayments, and succeed at what they do because of their good administrative skills.

Mr. Miguel Ángel P., the coordinator of the group, has a garage located at Kilometer 36 1/2 on the highway between Masaya and Tipitapa. He began the business approximately 5 years ago after retiring from his original job driving tractors, where he got experience with vehicle repair (especially of trucks). Miguel is very thankful for the loans that ADIM has given him in spite of his economic status and lack of education. For this reason he has never defaulted on a loan. He needs his loan to complete a big job completely repairing a truck, which will involve buying paint, motor parts, and some other parts.

Vilma M. works preparing and selling food from her home and Silvia buys and sells gold items in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts for a vehicle

loans.name: God's Time Is The Best Group

texts.en:
“God's Time Is the Best” is a group of five borrowers led by Maima H., a 43-year-old married woman. Maima has six children aged 5 to 16 years old with educational levels of 2nd through 7th grade. She also cares for two siblings.

Maima is illiterate due to lack of financial support from her parents. She lives and works in Jatu Town, Banjour, north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. This community is a newly-formed residential area; that means it’s not crowded - in fact it’s deserted. Because Banjour is bushy, not many people live there.

Maima's business is food preparation. She buys food like fish, flour, plantain and soft drinks. She fries the food separately and sells it to the residents. She has been running this business for four years and hopes to grow her business into a general goods store.

Maima prepares delicious food to encourage more customers to buy from her. She needs this loan to purchase more food like fish, plantain, flour and soft drinks wholesale to improve her business.

Maima dreams of buying land and building a house for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy more food and ingredients to grow her business

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ella siembra alfalfa, cría ganado ovino y animales menores (gallinas), en un lugar que implementó en su vivienda. Su esposo la ayuda en estas tareas, pero también él trabaja independiente. 
Lucila distribuye su tiempo tanto para el cuidado de sus animales, como para atender su hogar y a sus hijos. Pero durante los fines de semana es cuando vende sus animales y compra otros para hacerlos crecer y engordar. El deseo a futuro de Lucila es tener una granja de animales grandes para poder incrementar sus ganancias.

Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más animales, especialmente ovejas.
texts.en:
Lucila lives in her own home with her husband and their 5 children. She has been farming from a very young age. Lucila grows alfalfa and breeds sheep and chickens in a designated area outside of her home. Her husband helps her with these tasks, but he also works independently.

Lucila divides her time among caring for her animals, tending to the housework, and looking after her children. On the weekends, she sells her animals and buys others for breeding and fattening. In the future, she would like to have a farm with larger animals so that she can increase her earnings.

This is the fifth time Lucila has taken a loan with MFP. She is thrilled to be part of her Communal Bank since it has brought her much satisfaction. The money she is requesting will be used to buy more animals, especially sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 31 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She sells foodstuffs to make her living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes to be a foodstuff distributor in Lagos state in the future. She is determined to lift her business to the next level of progress. She hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia L. is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Faleaseela Tai. She is married and has five school-aged children. Telesia owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 750 WST a month. Telesia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Telesia is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria V. is from Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Gloria owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In July 2009, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Gloria is now requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Elba Rosa Ana

texts.es: La Sra. Elba Vásquez tiene 46 años, es casada vive en casa propia junto a su esposo. Tiene seis hijos sólo el menor está a su cargo el resto de hijos están comprometidos y laboran de forma independiente. Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años. Vendiendo mayormente al crédito a trabajadores de los fundos de la zona. Además su esposo tiene un pequeño taller de venta y reparación de bicicletas. Además poseen una parcela de tres Ha la cual arriendan todos los años. Solicita financiamiento para invertir en negocio por campaña de navidad y aprovechar incremento en venta de ropa y regalos. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y hacer crecer sus negocios para apoyar a su menor hijo. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elba Vásquez is 46 years old, married and living in her own home with her husband. She has six children, with only the youngest dependent on her. Her other children have their own lives and work independently. For four years now she has been selling clothing from her home, mostly to farm laborers in the area. Her husband has a shop where he sells and repairs bicycles. They also have a three-hectare plot of land, which they rent every year. She asks for financing for her business at Christmas time, to take advantage of the increase in the sale of clothing and gifts. Her dream is to have better housing and grow her business and support her youngest child. Elba and her husband are grateful for the support we can offer to improve their living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase capital for her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther E. is from the village of Kinangay Norte in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Esther is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Esther owns & operates a tricycle (motorcycle with a sidecar for passengers) transportation service in the local community. Esther has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Esther joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23000 PHP from GDMPC. Esther is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to repair her business vehicles so she can provide better service. This will be Esther's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her business vehicles

loans.name: Silvia Johana

texts.es:
El banco comunal Alianza Unida se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca ubicada en el centro sur del país, esta ciudad es una fusión de tres culturas ricas en simbolismo tradición y arte como Cañari, Inca y Española los integrantes de éste banco son mujeres  luchadoras cabezas de hogar  en busca del bienestar de sus familias, son un grupo muy alegre y solidario que siempre están dispuestas a colaborar  entre ellas para que todas salgan adelante tanto familiar como económicamente. 

La señora  Silvia N. es una socia muy alegre de éste banco, está en su cuarto ciclo trabajando con la Fundación gracias a su amiga Zoila quien la invito a formar parte este gran grupo de mujeres. Con  apenas 23 años Silvia es casada y madre de dos niños de tres años y otro de cinco meses de nacido, su  esposo trabaja como cajero en un estacionamiento público de la ciudad, la casa en la que viven es arrendada siendo su mayor  sueño comprar un terreno para construir su casa propia y un local para incrementar su negocio.

Los prestamos accedidos anteriormente los invirtió en su antiguo negocio de venta de productos Yanbal, actualmente se dedica a la elaboración y venta de humas y tamales (realizadas de  maíz y queso), lleva ocho meses en ésta actividad y ya cuenta con su clientela fija, sus  actividades inician muy temprano ya que elaborar estos bocaditos es muy laborioso  y tiene todo listo a las 4pm que inicia sus ventas.

Con el dinero que recibirá del crédito solicitado va a comprar maíz, queso, mantequilla, huevos  y otros ingredientes para la preparación de sus humas y tamales.
texts.en:
The Alianza Unida communal bank was organized in the city of Cuenca, which is located in the south-central part of the country. This city combines three cultures rich in symbolism, tradition and art: Cañari, Inca and Spanish. The members of this bank are tenacious woman who are heads of household; they struggle daily for the well-being of their families. They are a cheerful and united group that is always willing to cooperate among themselves so that all will progress both personally and economically. Silvia N. is a very cheerful member of the bank. This is her 4th loan cycle with the Fundación thanks to her friend Zoila, who invited her to be part of this great group fo women. Silvia is only 23 years old, she’s married and has two sons: a three-year-old and a five-month-old. Her husband is a cashier in a public parking lot. They rent their home and her greatest wish is to buy a lot so that they can build their own house and a locale in which to set up her business. She used her previous loans in her previous business, which was the sale of Yanbal brand products. Currently, she makes and sells humas (cheese tamales) and tamales (made of cheese and corn). She has been in this line of work for 8 months and she already has her regular customer base. She starts her work activities very early because making these little bites is very labor intensive; she has everything ready for her sales that start at 4pm. She will use the funds to buy corn, cheese, butter, eggs and other ingredients needed for the preparation of humas and tamales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for humitas (a type of cheese tamal flavored with anise) and tamales.

loans.name: Rolom

texts.en:
Rolom is 48 years old and lives with her husband and their four children in Ovorhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Rolom operates two businesses: clothing manufacturing and meat selling. Rolom's personality and health are good, and her business experience is improving. She plans to expand the business and increase her profits in the future. She has been operating the meat selling business with her husband at the rental counter of the Zanabazar market since 1998. Presently, her working capital is 1,500,000 tugrugs (~ 1055 USD), her average monthly sales revenue is 2,600,000 tugrugs (~ 1829 USD), and her monthly profit is 370,000 tugrugs (~ 260 USD).

Previously, Rolom had been operating a clothing manufacturing business, which she still runs in her spare time. She operates this business with her daughter, and they produce "deel" (Mongolian traditional clothing), coats, bags, and more. Rolom is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1400 USD ) loan to purchase a large amount of silk and material in order to produce and sell Mongolian traditional clothing during the upcoming Mongolian Lunar New Year celebration. Rolom is a decent, very hardworking, precise and optimistic person. She would like to create a secure financial future in order to continue to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of silk and material

loans.name: Santos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Santos Alberto Estrada vive en una casa prE. junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos.
Como desea tener su propia casa vivienda está tramitando una casa por medio de infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental), pero el valor de la vivienda es superior al crédito que el puede recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo.
El trabaja como empleado en una compañía de trasportes. Por tal motivo solicita el préstamo, para completar el crédito gubernamental y así adquirí su casa. Desea tener un patrimonio seguro para su familia.
Las personas que aparecen en la foto son su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, ya que el señor Santos Alberto se encontraba en su trabajo, el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos Alberto Estrada lives in a borrowed house with his wife and two children. Because he desires to have his own home, he is in the process of buying a house through INFONAVIT (a government loan program). However, the value of the house is more than the maximum line of credit he is eligible to receive because his salary is low. He works as an employee for a transportation company. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can complete the government program and acquire his house. He desires to build a secure inheritance for his family. The people in the borrower profile are his wife and his two young children. Sr. Santos Alberto was not available to be photographed the day he was visited.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cover the down payment needed to qualify for a government home loan

loans.name: Ganiatou

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, A. Ganiatou est mariée à ADILEOU Hervé un tailleur. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Ganiatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à PK10 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, il y a une dizaine d'année. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges familiales. N'ayant jamais été à l'école, Ganiatou vend des tissus, et de façon secondaire des chaussures, par le système de distribution. Ganiatou s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Ganiatou exerce cette activité depuis huit ans, et a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de l'institution, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Dans l’optique d’élargir son domaine d’activité et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, Ganiatou désire bénéficier d’un deuxième concours financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Ganiatou A. is married to Hervé ADILEOU, a tailor. The couple has three children to care for, of whom two are their own children. For the past ten years Ganiatou has lived with her children and her husband at PK10 in the Sèmè-Podji commune. The couple jointly shares family expenses. Never having attended school, Ganiatou retails pieces of fabric, and also shoes as a secondary activity, through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Lomé in Togo, a country adjacent to Benin. Ganiatou has been in this line of business for the past eight years, and has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. Wishing to expand the range of her activities and increase her stock supply, she is seeking a second financial loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es:
La Señora Damiana R.  de 60 años de edad vive en la comunidad de Viloma de la provincia de Sipe Sipe de la ciudad de Cochabamba ella se dedica a la producción de leche entregando al modulo del Viloma y al mismo tiempo trabaja como agricultora tiene tres hijos a los  cuales va ayudando para que puedan terminar el colegio ya que su hijo mayor no pudo hacerlo porque tenía q trabajar desde muy joven ya que su padre los abandono y sola la señora Damiana tenía más trabajo a realizar y estaban a punto de perder la casa por un problema de territorio, al mismo tiempo dedicarse de sus hijos ella se enfermo y no podía trabajar entonces su hijo se tuvo que poner a trabajar dejo el colegio para no dejarlos a sus hermanos que eran pequeños.

Ella está muy orgullosa de sus hijos porque ahora la ayudan a ella en el trabajo de la agricultura y también en la producción de la leche la Señora Damiana no pudo estudiar no sabe escribir ni leer sus padres jamás le pusieron a la escuela porque ella tenía que cuidar a sus hermanos por ser la mayor de todos ella a su mía responsabilidades como hermana ella sufrió mucho porque ella tenía muchos sueños que no los pudo realizar por eso ella trabaja muy duro para que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor y de esa manera ella se sentirá feliz porque ellos si serán profesionales.

La Señora Damiana solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado y de esa manera aumentara su producción de leche y tendrá mayores ingresos y poder ayudar a sus hijos para que no dejen el colegio y también mejora su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Damiana R. is 60 years old and lives in the Viloma community in the province of Sipe Sipe in the city of Cochabamba. She produces milk and delivers it to Viloma. As well as working in agriculture, she is helping three of her children finish school. Her oldest son is not able to attend school as he had to work from a young age. His father abandoned them and they were at the point of losing the house due to a territory problem and then Mrs. Damiana became ill and was unable to work. So her son was forced to start to work and left school in order to help his siblings who are still little. She is very proud of her children because now they are helping her with her agriculture work and also with the milk production. Mrs. Damiana is not able to study. She doesn’t know how to read or write. Her parents never placed her in school because she had to take care of her younger siblings as she was the oldest. She suffered a lot because she had many dreams which she was unable to accomplish. This is why she is working so hard; so her children have a better future and in this was she will be happy because they will be professionals. Mrs. Damiana is soliciting the loan in order to buy cattle and in this way augment her milk production and have a greater income. She will be able to help her children so they aren’t forced to leave school and also improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu J. sells locally-dyed clothes. He is hard working and business-minded. He has 10 years experience and his business is located in the central part of Makeni.

He is married to a merchant and has four children. He spends all his time selling and needs a loan to buy raw materials such as bright textiles and the ink used to process the textiles.  He hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to educate his children and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar R. is 40 years old. She is married and has five children. Dilbar sells women's clothes and shoes at the market. She has been in this trade for many years. She has proven herself to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Dilbar is hoping to take a loan of $1500 USD to increase the variety of inventory in her store and keep her business running successfully. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the education expenses of her children.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increase inventory variety and working capital

loans.name: Fatou Kissima

texts.fr: Fatou Kissima a 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DINGUIRAYE, dont elle est la secrétaire depuis l'inauguration de celui-ci le 22 janvier 2003. Elle est très dynamique et défends à chaque fois les intérêts de l'assemblée du groupe pour sa bonne marche. Elle a une boutique au cœur du marché hebdomadaire de son village et son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux l'approvisionner en marchandises tel du riz, du son de mil, de l'aliment de bétail et d'autres denrées alimentaires. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de leur progéniture.
texts.en:
Fatou Kissima is a 35 year-old married mother of 4. She has been secretary of the Dinguiraye credit association since its inauguration on the 22nd of January 2003. She is very dynamic and works in the group's best interests so that it functions well. She has a shop at the heart of her village's weekly market, and this new loan will enable her to more effectively source her goods, such as rice, millet, animal feed and other food items. Her aim is to assist her husband in looking after their children.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing and promoting her shop

loans.name: Asunción Del Socorro

texts.es:
Asunción del Socorro L. Álvarez de 30 años inicio en el 2002 con un pequeño canasto de caramelo el cual poco a poco y con arduo trabajo fue mejorando su negocio hasta poner una pequeña venta. Ella con el préstamo tiene pensado seguir mejorando su negocio logrando con mucho esfuerzo el sueño de convertir su negocio en una miscelánea.
L. es una señora que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo tanto económico, moral y laboral con el cual procreo tres hijos de catorce, ocho y tres años quienes son su razón de ser.
texts.en:
Asuncion del Socorro, who is 30 years old, started in business in 2002 with a small box of caramels, and little by little, and with arduous labor, she improved her business, finally launching a small store. With this loan she plans to continue improving the business, achieving with much effort, her dream of converting her business into a variety store. Asuncion del Socorro is a woman who can count on the help of her husband, economic as well as moral, and with labor. They have 3 children, 14, 8, and 3 years old, who are her reason for being.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING BASIC GRAINS, SWEETS, AND A VARIETY OF OTHER MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: Jerlie

texts.en:
Jerlie A. is from the village of Poblacon 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she sells fish.  She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $63 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Jerlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jerlie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Maren

texts.en: Mrs. Maren M., age 28, married woman and is a villager who lives in Prey Sbat village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Saophorn Thok, is a carpenter. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family.  In order to increase income to improve the family living, Mrs. Maren M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow and piglets for breeding and pig food. This couple has two children, who all are too young and are not yet in school.

loans.use: to buy a cow and piglets for breeding and pig food.

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE NABY est créé le 20 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SALLA DERGUENE.

Madame Ndèye Gagnsiri S. assise à gauche de la photo et levant la main droite, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge.

Elle fait un de l’embouche ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois.

Son prêt lui permettra d’acheter trois moutons et de les emboucher pendant 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés de sa localité.

Son objectif est de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The Sope Naby solidarity group was created on 20th December 2009. It is made up of 13 women who all come from the same neighborhood and are either friends or neighbors. The solidarity group is part of the Banc Villageois in Keur Salla Derguene. Mrs. Ndèye Gagnsiri S., seated on the left of the photo with her right hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is 43 years old, married and mother to six children, who are in her care. She has a sheep fattening activity, which she has been carrying out since joining the Banc Villageois. Her loan will allow her to buy three sheep and fatten them up for five months before reselling them in the markets in her town. Her goal is to contribute to improving her family's living conditions, while at the same time boosting her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase three sheep

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Señora Olga O., quien tiene 37 años, esta casada hace 15 años con Oscar Gamarra, tienen dos hijos de 12 y 3 años , ellos viven en el Barrio San Blas.
Olga, vende flores en el cementerio Municipal de San Antonio, pues vive muy cerca del mencionado lugar.
La mujer tiene un puesto de venta de Flores como botón de oro, petunias, crisantemos, flor de arañas, margaritas, lirios, claves, y rosas, además de paños para cruz, mantelitos para panteones, etc.
Ella agradece el  crédito, pues es una buena oportunidad para las mujeres de escasos recursoss de mejorar las actividades a que se dedican.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, y solidaria con los vecinos, ayuda como voluntaria en la Capilla que esta muy cerca de su casa, todos la conocen por su espíritu de colaboración con los demás.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de flores.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to la Señora Olga O.. She is 37 years old, is married 15 years to Oscar Gamarra, and has two children 12 and 3 years old, respectively. They live in the San Blas neighborhood. Since she lives very close to the municipal cemetary, she sells flowers there. She has a site where she sells flowers such as "botón de oro" (button of gold), petunias, chrysanthemums, spider flowers, daisies, irises, carnations, and roses, in addition to cloths for crosses, altar cloths for memorials, etc. She is grateful for this loan because it is a good opportunity for women with limited resources to invest in their businesses. She is a hard-working woman, united with her neighbors, and volunteering in the chapel that is close to her home. She is known for her spirit of cooperation with everyone. She requests this loan to buy flowers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flowers

loans.name: Eloisa Jazmin

texts.es: Doña Eloísa Jazmín Chávez Sánchez de 47 años de edad tiene en su casa de habitación una pequeña tienda de ropa usada donde también vende bisuterías, ella inició comprando una paca de ropa hace 6 años y vendiéndole a conocidos y vecinos. En la tienda ella recibe ayuda de su hija menor de 28 años; su objetivo es poseer el capital suficiente para alquilar otro local que tenga buena ubicación y poner otra tienda ahí, siendo atendida una de las tiendas por ella y otra por su hija. El único problema económico que tiene es que hay temporadas bajas pero en ellas se auxilia con la clientela fija.
texts.en:
Eloísa Jazmín Chávez Sánchez, age 47, has a small used clothing store in her home where she also sells costume jewelery. She started her business 6 years ago, buying a package of clothing and selling it to acquaintances and neighbours. Her youngest daughter, age 28, helps her in the store. Her goal is to have enough capital to rent another venue in a good location and open another store in it, with one of the stores attended by her and the other by her daughter. Her only economic problem is the low season, but during this she is sustained by her steady customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of household goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora T. is a 58-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: food vending and farming businesses. She lives in Sitio Kalubihan, Brgy. San Roque, Asturias, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,200.

Dioscora is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can purchase ingredients for her food sales business. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Dioscora aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man and has one child. He is from Lebanon. After quitting his last job at another company, he decided to start a business from his hobby of painting. He has prepared a painting atelier where he can work on his paintings. He really likes his job and he says that it’s a type of art in which he can express himself. He presents his paintings through some galleries.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed painting tools and supplies. In the future, he hopes to organize a painting show and present his paintings to customers.

loans.use: to purchase painting tools and supplies needed

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy M., from the village of Rizal Avenue, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, is 49 years old, married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a direct-selling business. Engaged in her business for over 13 years, she earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 45,000 PHP, she is now requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase an additional stock of goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase addititional stock

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea M., 30, is married and lives with her husband and three young children in the Takeo province. She grows rice and sells grocery items with her husband, typically making $3 of profit a day. Chea M. needs a loan to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan is 31, married, and has one daughter who is 7 years old. His wife works at a construction company as an assistant builder. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Bayarsaikhan has been operating a taxi business since his plastic bag retail business failed in 2006. He has 3 times taken micro loans from us and had paid them back on time. He has gained much experience in last 4 years transporting people. Early in the morning his work day begins by taking his wife and daughter to their work and school. He is planning to finish building his uncompleted wooden house and increase his working capital. 

Bayrasaikhan is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a better car.

loans.use: To purchase a better car

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en:
Chhim S. is a married woman who is 39 years old. She has been a farmer, a skill she learned from her grandmother, for years. She plants rice to make a living. 

Her husband is a local palm climber who taps palm juice and turns it into palm sugar for selling. Besides this business, she and her husband are firewood buyers, which they resell for profit. 

This couple was married many years ago and has three teenage children. Their children attend school and also help them on the farm when they are free from their classes. Chhim S. needs a loan to buy additional firewood for selling, and the rest of money will be used to purchase a ladder for her husband to use for climbing palm trees.

loans.use: To buy additional firewood for selling, and to purchase a ladder for her husband to use for climbing palm trees.

loans.name: Peris Waringa

texts.en:
Peris Waringa N. is a single mother of three children, she lives in Kahoya in Eldoret Town. Peris sells second-hand clothes in Eldoret town and has been in this business for seven years now. She gets a monthly income of six thousand Kenyan Shillings. She was introduced to KADET by her friends who are also KADET customers.

This will be Peris's third loan from KADET Ltd. She has been repaying well all her other loans and wants to buy more used clothes for resale.  She will also use some of the money for personal use. In the future Peris hopes to grow her business and be able to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: buying second-hand clothes for resale; personal use

loans.name: Aliman's Group

texts.en: Aliman B. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Balykchi, a small town in Isykul region. She is 57, married to a carpenter and has a nine-year-old son who studies at school. In order to earn money, Aliman sells apples. In the spring she is going to sell potatoes (she prepared two tons of potatoes for sale). She has been selling fruits and vegetables for 12 years. In this way she earns 50,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more apples for sale. In the future she wants to purchase a family car. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase apples

loans.name: Carlosa

texts.en:
Carlosa M.'s main source of income comes from selling specially manufactured products to local businesses and community members. She is 46 years old, married and has six children: Four of them are adults and two of them are students. She is from the village of Balabag, Gulayon. Carlosa has been in her manufacturing business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Carlosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living conditions. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. 

Carlosa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase construction materials for house renovation. This will be her 13th loan from PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house renovation

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 54 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Felicitas  se dedica a la venta de metal mecánico, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fierros, soldaduras y muchas cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha va muy bien.         
     
Felicitas pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 54 years old, has four children, and lives in the city of Pisaq in the Province of Calca, Department of Cusco, Peru.

She has a metal shop and is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy iron for welding and other supplies.  Felicitas has been in business for ten years and has done very well.      

Felicitas belongs to the Communal Bank “Mosoq Ñusta”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.  She is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase iron for welding & other supplies

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HACIA EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Dalia, La socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia  es casada y tiene 3 hijos (todos menores de edad), la socia es docente de profesión y ella se dedica a supervisar y a las labores administrativas, la socia desea en esta oportunidad el crédito para comprar útiles escolares, ella aprovechará la temporada de campaña escolar para comprar al por mayor útiles para que más adelante no le salga caro. La socia  solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de útiles escolares en campaña escolar.
.
La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dalia belongs to the “Hacia el Triunfo” (Towards the Triumph) Communal Bank, located in Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Dalia is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children (all minors).  She is a teacher by profession and currently dedicated to supervision as an administrator.  Dalia  desires this loan to buy school supplies during this season while prices are cheaper.

She is happy about the authorization of the loan and promises to comply with her repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: BUYING SCHOOL SUPPLIES WHILE PRICES ARE LOW

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and one sibling. He has been working as a farmer for 10 years. In 2005, he bought a plot of land and executed his own farming work. He cultivates all types of vegetables. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was very satisfied with the results.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy agricultural seeds. He notes that these purchases will allow him to increase his productivity and therefore his income. In the future, he is planning to start fruit gardening in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural seeds.

loans.name: Munhjargal

texts.en:
Munhjargal D., 39, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. 

Her husband drives a motorcycle taxi and both of her children attend a local secondary school. 

Munhjargal began retail trading of clothes in 2007. She has been cooperating with XacBank since she started her business and she is one of our reliable customers. She has begun operating a clothing making and repairing service in addition to her clothes trading business. 

Munhjargal is a hardworking and polite person who says, "I always work hard and try to increase my business revenues in order to save money for my children's future." 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothes for her retail trading business and cloth and textiles for her new business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale as well as cloth and textiles

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 51 años, es casado y vive en un lugar llamado La Matanza, ubicado en la región Piura.  Se encuentra a aproximadamente 4 horas de distancia de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
Eugenio se dedica a la venta de libros en su localidad.  Esta actividad la aprendió de su familia quien también se dedicaba a la misma actividad.  Eugenio cuenta con clientela fidelizada y que acude siempre a su establecimiento.  Los ingresos percibidos los utiliza para cubrir sus gastos personales y los de su familia.
Eugenio necesita darle mantenimiento a su local, por lo que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 51 years old, married, and lives in a place called La Matanza, located in the Piura region, which is about four hours distance from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque department.

Eugenio works selling books in his store.  He learned this work from his family, who also work doing the same thing.  Eugenio has loyal customers who always come to his store.  He uses the income he earns to cover his personal expenses and those of his family.

Eugenio needs to do some maintenance in his store, so he has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to do maintenance at his book store.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan C. (pictured above) is 45 years old and her husband, Mr. Chin C., is 49 years old. They live in a village along National Road number five approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children--three sons and two daughters. One is a garment factory worker, another one is a lathe operator and the other three attend school.  

Lan is a rice farmer. She also runs a business as a food vendor when she is not at the farm. Her husband is a motor remoque driver. (A remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back). Unhappily, the trailer is old and does not work well. It’s upset his business, so he wants to purchase new ones.

That’s why Lan is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to replace the trailer for her husband.

loans.use: to replace the motorcycle trailer for her husband.

loans.name: Philip Gitundu

texts.en:
Philip has been practising farming in Naivasha town for the last five years.  He is 62 years old, married to Irene Ngendo, and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of his friends.  This will be his third loan.  He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Philip hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 54. She is a married woman and she has 5 children. Her oldest child is now 37 years old.

Lerma is a farmer, working in Banga, Agusan del sur. She primarily grows corn crops to sell. She earns 4,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Lerma also runs a small eatery. She cooks the food herself and sells them to passersby and people in her community.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and raw ingredients for the viands she sells in her eatery. In the future, she hopes to improve her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and raw ingredients for viands she sells in her eatery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put a gate in front of her house.

loans.name: Adégboyé

texts.fr:
Adégboyé est un homme âgé de 33 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Ils ont un enfant.
Adégboyé a travaillé comme informaticien depuis 2006. Il a une boutique pour le traitement de texte, des photocopies et scanner. 
Adégboyé a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter dune photocopieuse et une imprimante couleur.
texts.en:
Adégboyé, 33, is married to a petty trader. They have one child. 

Adégboyé has worked with computers since 2006. He has a shop where he prepares, photocopies, and scans texts. 

He has requested his third loan from WAGES so as to buy a photocopier and a color printer.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and a printer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old and a single mother of three.  She runs a wholesale business selling vegetables such as potatoes, cabbages, carrots, and tomatoes.  She was previously engaged in selling rice wholesale.

Jane has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business-management skills.  This training has helped her run her business well.  She has requested 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy potatoes, carrots, and cabbages.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, carrots, and cabbages.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y tiene dos hijos los cuales no viven con ellos, él cultiva maíz y cría ganado, desde hace mucho tiempo realiza estar actividades como un medio de subsistencia. 
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, los cuales implementara al cultivo como lo son los abonos y pesticidas para las plagas, también mano de obra, este financiamiento le ayudara para cubrir el gasto en materiales que le ayuden a fortalecer el cultivo.
Su aspiración es tener una buena cosecha para poder comercializarla a buen precio y que alcance para la alimentación de la familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a farmer living with his wife; he has two children who don’t live with them anymore.  He farms corn and raises livestock.  He’s been supporting himself through these activities for a long time.

He is asking for the loan to buy some farming supplies that he’ll use on his crops such as manure and pesticides for the pests.  He will also pay labor costs.  This loan will help him cover the cost of the materials that will help him strengthen his crops.

His wish is to obtain a good crop yield to sell at a good price and that it will be sufficient to feed his family, too.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides for his corn crops.

loans.name: Ekali

texts.en: Ekali is 32 years old. He is married and blessed with four children who are going to school. For the last two years, he has been engaging in the transport business to make a living. He makes an extra shilling by engaging in farming. He wants in the next five years to be self-reliant and to be able to run his business comfortably. He is requesting a loan of 9,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a solar lamp. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his financial status.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Las Comadres Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Comadres, está conformado por la señora Salustia Dorotea va a comprar pollo y alimento para engordar los pollos, la señora Blanca Estela va a comprar huevo, aceite, azúcar, refrescos etc., la señora Candelaria va a comprar cajas de aguacate, la señorita María del Carmen va a comprar crema, queso, verduras, carnes y refrescos, La señora Blanca Estela tiene 50 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 4º. semestre del CBTA, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo que es campesino, ellos tienen dos hijos mayores de edad ya trabajan y son casados, ella tiene su negocio de venta de tacos dorados y una tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su crédito para comprar gas y manteca para elaborar los tacos dorados y azúcar, aceite, huevo, jabón, papel higiénico, refrescos etc. para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años por falta de recursos económicos, su esposo la motivo, el le enseño este negocio y con sus propios ingresos de lo que ganaban en su trabajo compraron los insumos y los utensilios para elaborar los tacos dorados, ella sale a vender sus productos los sábados  y entre semana atiende los pedidos, ella ofrece a sus clientes tacos dorados de papa, requesón y de carne de res o puerco, su negocio es importante porque tiene una fuente de ingresos para la familia, ella está contenta con su negocio, porque gracias a su negocio comen bien toda la familia sale a vender los tacos y ya tiene para comprar para la comida, ella se siente orgullosa cuando sus clientes le dicen que sus tacos están sabrosos, la competencia que enfrenta su negocio es que muchas señoras le copian pero venden un tiempo y dejan de vender, ella está planeando poner un local en el mercado donde venda los tacos dorados, ella tiene la esperanza de ponerle colado y loseta a su casa y que vivan bien toda la familia. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por sus préstamo que nos sacan de apuros y de los compromisos, gracias a ustedes, podemos progresar siempre y cuando el dinero se utilice para algo productivo”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called "Las Comadres".  Salustia Dorotea is going to buy chicken, and  feed to fatten chickens.  Blanca Estella  is going to buy eggs, cooking oil, sugar, soft drinks etc. Candelaria is going to buy crates of avocados. María del Carmen is going to buy cream, cheese, vegetables, meats and soft drinks. 

Blanca Estela is 50, and went to school as far as 4th semester of vocational high school.  She lives in a common-law relationship with her husband, who is a farmer. They have two adult children who are already working and married.  She has a business selling fried tacos, and a grocery store.  She is applying for a loan to buy gas and lard to make fried tacos, as well as sugar, cooking oil, eggs, soap, toilet paper, soft drinks etc. to stock her grocery store.  

She started her business 5 years ago because she needed financial resources. Her husband encouraged her, and taught her this business.  With the income that they earned from their work, they bought ingredients and utensils for making fried tacos. She goes out to sell her products on Saturdays, and during the week she fills orders. She offers her customers fried tacos made with potatoes, requesón (similar to cottage or ricotta cheese), beef, or pork. 

Her business is important as a source of family income. She's happy with her business, because thanks to it, the whole family eats well. She goes out and sells her tacos, and then has the money to buy food.  She feels proud when her clients tell her that her tacos are delicious.  The competition her business faces is that many ladies copy her, but only sell for a time and then stop. She is is planning to set up a location in the market to sell fried tacos. Her hope is to put a cement and tile floor in her house, and that all her family live well.   

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad: "Thank you very much for your loans that get us out of difficulties and tight spots.   Thanks to you, we can get ahead as long as the money is used for something productive.

loans.use: To buy gas, lard, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, soap, toilet paper, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru:
Махмуд добрый и целеустремленный человек. Более 10 лет он предоставляет услуги ремонта автомашин. В данном бизнесе помогает ему его брат и они вместе работает и предоставляет по месту жительству. В основном ремонтирует мягких автомобилей. Он имеет много клиентов, а также хорошую репутацию среди людей. Прибыль, который он планирует он хочет вложит в бизнес для расширения бизнеса. Махмуд запрашивает займ для покупки автозапчастей для ремонта автомашин своих клиентов. Он заранее благодарит всех вас за вашу помощь и поощрение. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mahmud is a kind and goal-oriented person.  He has been providing an auto repair service for over ten years.  His brother helps him in this business, and they work together and provide this service in their locale.  Mahmud primarily repairs soft cars.  He has many customers and has a good reputation among people.  He intends to invest the planned profit into the business in order to expand it.  Mahmud is requesting this loan for the purchase of auto parts to repair client cars.  He thanks all of you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Tambo Real, en la Provincia D. Anta y Departamento D. Cusco. 

La socia Juliana; La socia tiene 60 años D. edad; la socia es casada y tiene 6 hijos  todos ellos independientes; la socia se dedica  a la agricultura ya  la ganadería, la socia apoya a sus hijos con el cuidado D. sus nietos y también prepara quesos y venD. leche, la socia trae desD. Tambo Real los fines D. semana la leche y quesos para la venta en su stand en un mercado muy famosos en la ciudad del Cusco, ella requiere en esta ocasión el crédito para invertir en la compra D. alimento y sales minerales para sus vacas y D. este modo producir a mejor calidad y cantidad D. leche.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Introducing Juliana, a member of “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” (Cochimayo Solidarity), a communal bank located in Tambo Real, a district of the province of Anta in the Cusco department.

Juliana is 60 years old, she is married and she has 6 children, all economically independent. She engages in agriculture and livestock breeding. She helps her children by taking care of her grandchildren, and she also prepares cheese and sells milk. Every week-end she brings milk and cheese from Tambo Real to sell them in her stand located in a very famous market in the town of Cusco. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of food and mineral salts for her cows, in order to be able to producer more milk of better quality.

She is grateful for the support she will receive and at the same time she commits to complying with fully repaying her dues.

loans.use: To buy food and mineral salts for her cows.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.

Virginia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Dinia Aleida

texts.es:
Dinia, es madre soltera, vive junto con sus dos hijos y su abuelo, ella  tiene una tienda de productos básicos (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz), el negocio surgio por iniciativa propia, todos los días trabaja, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para crecer más su tienda  y comprar más mercadería como: boquitas, galleta, arroz, frijoles, de esa forma obtendrá mejores ingresos.
El sueño de Dinia  es  incrementar  sus ventas y  tener más variedad; seguir teniendo créditos a futuro para trabajar con la institución y de esa forma poder darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Dinia is a single mother living with her two children and her grandfather.  She has a grocery store (rice, beans, sugar, corn) that she opened on her own initiative.  She works every day and does not have a fixed work schedule.  She will use the loan to make her store grows and to buy more merchandise like snacks, cookies, rice and beans to earn better income.  Dinia’s dream is to increase sales and have more variety, to continue to have future loans to work with the institution and thus be able to provide her family with all the best.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Jill

texts.en:
Jill is 38 years of age and married with four children. Jill owns & operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Jill needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase baking powder, sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, yeast and an oven.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Jill joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Jill's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking powder, sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, yeast and an oven

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man with two children who are too young for school. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Mohamed has operated a meat goat selling business for the past five years. In addition, he owns a motorbike transportation business. His potential clients are his neighbors and other villagers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase more goats for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to acquire more funds for investment.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for his business.

loans.name: Katty

texts.es: Katty, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y deseosa de ser una empresaria. Esta casada con Iván, fruto de esta unión tiene dos hermosas hijas de 3 y 1 años. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia. La actividad que ejerce Katty es la venta de ropa, tanto para damas, como para caballeros y niños,  para lo cual realiza viajes periódicos a la ciudad de Lima, donde compra a precios cómodos en el emporio comercial de dicha ciudad. Luego los vende al contado o a crédito ya sea a amistades, familiares y conocidos. Tiene un año dedicándose a esta actividad, y gracias al apoyo de su esposo, la apoya en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el sentirse realizada al poder tener un ingreso propio, depender de su propio negocio, sin embargo le molesta mucho cuando algunos de sus clientes se demoran en cancelar su compra. Su anhelo es tener su boutique en su casa. Este sería el préstamo número tres con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida por el apoyo que recibe, y por ello se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de diferentes modelos.
texts.en:
Katty, age 25, is a happy and hardworking woman and an enthusiastic entrepreneur. Her husband is named Iván, and the couple have two beautiful daughters, ages 3 and 1. The family lives in a house that they own.

Katty sells clothing for women, men and children. She travels to Lima periodically to buy clothing at wholesale prices. Her customers are friends, relatives and acquaintances, so she offers sales on credit as well as cash. She has been running her business for 1 year with the support of her husband, who helps bring in new customers. Katty enjoys her work and being able to earn income, although she faces challenges when her customers delay in paying for their credit purchases.

Her goal is to have a clothing boutique in her home. This loan will be her third with MFP. Katty is happy and grateful for the financial support, and is committed to prompt repayment of her loan. With the loan funds she will purchase new clothing styles.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal, a 38-year-old woman, is a mother of five sons and daughters.

Besides her husband's retirement salary, Manal chose to have another source of income by knitting, using different types and sizes of beads to decorate table covers or even tissue keepers. She also sometimes makes wooden crafts too.

It has been five years now since she started. Now Manal has applied for this loan to buy more material and beads in order to increase her productivity and make new items.

loans.use: to buy more material and beads

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Patamea.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elisapeta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Elisapeta has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Elisapeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elisapeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. The previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Elisapeta is now requesting a second loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and gromozones (herbicide). Elisapeta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and gromozones (herbicide).

loans.name: Tumalu

texts.en:
Tumalu is a 42 year-old a married woman with five children. two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Tumalu is requesting this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase fish. she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Aurora is a farmer who lives in the San Juan province of Isabela. He started the farming business eight years ago by planting rice. He learned from his  parents about the farming business. He is so thankful for the opportunity they gave him by teaching him in farming.

Aurora is applying for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos to purchase seed and fertilizer for his farm. Despite the challenge of seasonal weather, Aurora intends to purchase a water pump for continuous flowing of water in his rice field in the future.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for his farm.

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku is 23 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She has had a business selling food at a stall in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Kaku is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Mary Boke

texts.en:
Mary Boke is a 39-year-old fruits and vegetables seller in Mombasa. She is married. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past four years with great success. 

This is Mary’s first loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more bananas, oranges, pineapples, mangoes, kale and tomatoes. 

She will use the anticipated profits to open another business and to repay her loan. She hopes to purchase a piece of land and build her own permanent house.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, oranges, pineapples, mangoes, kale and tomatoes.

loans.name: Miriam Patricia

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer luchadora y toda su vida ha dedicado sus esfuerzos a sus 9 hijos y su esposo.
