loans.use: Purchase soft drinks such as sodas, water and juice to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel tiene 28 años, esta casado con la Sra. Eva Jara y  tienen dos hijos menores de edad. 
Miguel se dedica a la venta de artículos varios, como prendas deportivas, accesorios y aparatos celulares, electrodomésticos pequeños y todo tipo de mercaderías de acuerdo a los pedidos que recibe, sus ventas las realiza en ciudades del interior del país como Concepción y San Pedro.  Se inició en esta actividad en el año 2008.
Ellos viven en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Este crédito será de mucha utilidad para la compra de mercaderías que respondan a los pedidos de temporada escolar que ya se está iniciando, pues están realizan mas viajes de lo previsto gracias a que están aumentando los pedidos y la clientela.
El anhelo de este matrimonio es poder ampliar la casa que con mucho sacrificio están logrando construir, ademas de poder adquirir un vehículo propio que les permita realizar sus viajes de una forma mas segura .
texts.en:
Miguel is 28 years old. He is married to Eva Jara and they have 2 young children. Miguel sells various goods, such as athletic clothing, cellular parts and accessories, small household appliances, and all kinds of requested merchandise. He works in the interior regions of the country, such as in Concepción and San Pedro. He has been doing this work since 2008. Miguel and his wife live in the city of San Lorenzo. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise being requested for the upcoming school year. He is making more sales trips than he expected, thanks to more orders from his customers. The goal of this couple is to be able to expand their home, which they are currently doing with a lot of sacrifice. They would also like to be able to buy their own vehicle, which would provide them a safer means of travel.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cellular phone accessories, sandwich grills, lunch boxes, insulated thermoses, cotton t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Magezi Bugaga Group, Mukono

texts.en:
At the top left of the group photo is N. Jane. She is 50 years old and the leader of her lending group in Mukono. Jane is a hard-working lady with a retail shop business in Kisega that has been in existence for 20 years, and she is happy that she is able to make weekly profits amounting to 100,000/=. She is married with 7 children as she also takes care of  orphans. In order to continue taking good care of her family in every way, she hopes to expand her business by constructing her own business premises so that she can stop renting.  This will also enable her to provide school fees for all her dependents. 

Jane needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more goods as well as to pay school fees for her children. She says that all in all, her loans help to boost her capital base. (At the back left is the Accountant for the branch, hence not part of the group.)

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods and completing school fees for her children

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: La señora M. tiene un tramo ubicado en el Mercado Ernesto Fernández el cual le permite que tenga ingresos para poder subsistir junto con su familia, ella tiene tres hijos menores los que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella visito las oficinas de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y comprar ropa de bebé, pantaloncitos de niños y niñas, blusitas y camisetas, una paca mixta de niños e insumos de costura, esto para surtir un poco más su negocio y poder brindarle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos con la ganancia que obtenga.
texts.en:
Señora M. has a stall in the Ernesto Fernández Market, which permits her to have income to enable her and her family to have a means of support. She has three young children of school age. She visited the offices of Ceprodel to apply for a loan to buy baby clothes, boys' and girls' pants, blouses and shirts, a bale of mixed children's clothes, and sewing supplies. This will stock her business a little more, and the earnings that she will obtain will offer her and her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baby clothes, boys' and girls' pants, blouses and shirts, a bale of mixed children's clothes, and sewing supplies

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina,  tiene 49 años y tiene cinco hijos D. las cuales todos son independientes,  ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a sus hijos.

Josefina alterna sus actividades del hogar con su negocio D. venta D. chicha D. quinua D. forma ambulatoria. Ya son 20 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella venD. el vaso D. chicha a 50 céntimos y por día venD. tres baldes D. chicha y gana aproximadamente 60 soles. 

Josefina pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” D. la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son 15 años que funciona el banco comunal y ella participa. Su primer crédito D. la socia fue D. 100 dólares D. las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente,  la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo quinua, azúcar y leña. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Josefina is 49 years old and has five adult children, all independent. She is a responsible mother who constantly searches for opportunities to advance and give support to her children. She alternates her household responsibilities with those of her business, selling “chicha” on foot. (Chicha is a fermented drink.) She has been doing this for 20 years and it has been going very well, thanks to the effort she puts into it. She sells each glass of chicha for 50 céntimos and sells a total of three buckets per day, earning approximately 60 PEN. Josefina is a member of the “TERCER MILENIO” (Third Millennium) communal bank of the Arariwa Association. The bank has been operating for 15 years. Her first loan was for $100, which she used to invest into her business. Now she is needs a loan to buy supplies, such as quinine, sugar, and firewood. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been given and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplires

loans.name: Nai

texts.en: Mrs. C., 39, is a married woman living in Phnom Penh. She is a crop grower and a good homemaker who currently stays at home to care for her children and do housework. She has three kids: two are studying and also work; another one is no longer in school and helps her planting crops. She has a life partner in her husband who assists with her on the farm. C. is taking out her loan to purchase different kinds of fruits to sell for Khmer New Years. This will provide C. with additional income.

loans.use: To purchase fruit.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor es un joven emprendedor de 26 años, casado y juntos viven solos en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años que trabaja en su panadería, por lo que agradece el haber encontrado este trabajo, en donde aprendió todos los secretos para elaborar pan. Durante estos años de experiencia le han valido a Víctor ser muy conocido y valorado su trabajo, pues nadie prepara el pan como él, por todo esto, se siente muy contento y motivado para seguir adelante y más por familia. Su mayor anhelo es instalar un negocio en el que Víctor y su esposa puedan trabajar juntos, como una tienda de comestibles o un bazar, pero aún no lo tienen definido. Ellos esperan progresar poco a poco y así preparar el hogar para sus futuros hijos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus panes y además hacer algunos arreglos en la infraestructura de su hogar y acondicionar su futuro negocio.
texts.en:
Victor is a 26-year-old entrepreneur. He and his wife live alone in their own home. For more than 10 years, Victor has been working in a bakery. He’s grateful for his job, which has allowed him to learn all the secrets to bread-making. Victor’s many years of experience have earned him plenty of customer appreciation-- no one bakes it like Victor! This praise is exactly what he needs to keep him working hard and supporting his family. Victor wants to set up a storefront, where he and his wife can work together selling groceries or other products. At this point, though, it’s still just a dream. Little by little, they are hoping to prepare their home for any future children. This is Victor’s third loan with MFP, and he has promised to make all his payments on time. Victor plans to buy ingredients for making bread, make a few repairs to his home, and put a little toward his future business.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for making bread; completing home repairs.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Ms. Augustina R. V., 30 years old, is a single mother with two children in school. Very entrepreneurial, Augustina weaves blankets and handmade tablecloths, taking her products monthly to sell in the markets in Luque, which is 100 Km from her city. Thanks to this enterprise she now has her own house and is able to provide a dignified and comfortable life for her children.

Augustina is now requesting a loan that will go towards purchasing thread and colors to weave hammocks, as this is the season when many of her clients are requesting them.

loans.use: To purchase threads and colors

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy C. is from the village of Bantug. She is 55 years old. Remy is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Remy owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alterations & tailoring services to local community members. Remy has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Remy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Remy is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Remy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads

loans.name: Group 2

texts.en:
Nedilen O., from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental, is the 29-year-old group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Married with three school-aged children, Nedilen owns and operates a business venture that sells fresh fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nedilen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Mr. Tha Aom Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. Tha A. was born in 1972. He is the village bank president who has been selected by 13 people who live in Preaek Louk village in Kandal province. All these members make up a village bank loan and they will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to increase their income to support their families. Mr. Tha A. sells recyclable items and earns a little money to support his family because he has only a little capital to invest his business. So to improve his business, Mr. Tha A. is seeking a loan to buy more recyclables to resell. His wife, Mrs. Sen Beng, is a seamstress in a garment factory. With these activities, they support three children. One child is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is a student in the local public school, and the youngest one is five years old.

loans.use: To buy more recyclables to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia A. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice, baking flour and local Sudanese beans (ful). Lucia is 40 years old and married to a police officer. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant and purchase more tables and chairs for better accommodation.

loans.use: Stock more bags of rice, baking flour and local Sudanese beans

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila, de 46 años, es una mujer laboriosa que está casada con Donato de 49 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero sólo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Sabe que los esfuerzos que ejerce en el buen cuidado de sus cultivos, son fundamentales para obtener una cosecha productiva, por eso cada mañana contenta se dirige a la chacra para cuidar sus plantaciones de café, plátanos y palta, pensando que su sacrificio será recompensado. Lleva 25 años labrando la tierra junto a su esposo y ambos practican diferentes técnicas agrícolas que les dan buenos resultados. Lo que más le gusta de la agricultura, es la cosecha sobre todo recolectar los granos de café, pese que le resulta difícil trasladar sus productos hacía el mercado de su ciudad y hacía los centros de acopio, lo considera muy rentable por los beneficios que le genera. Por eso planea comprar más terrenos, donde pueda incrementar su productividad de café, por el buen precio que obtiene en el mercado. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y manifiesta que desde entonces tiene progreso económico, por eso continuará pagando responsablemente sus cuotas para acceder a más créditos que la hagan crecer, pues además le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcir sobre sus plantaciones y nivelar su producción.
texts.en:
Lucila is a hard-working 46 year old woman. She is married to Donato, 49, and they have 4 children, though only one still lives with them in the home they own. Lucila knows that her work taking care of her crops is crucial to a good harvest, and so every morning she is happy to head for the fields to take care of her coffee, bananas and avocados, thinking that her efforts will be rewarded. She has spent 25 years working the land with her husband, and each of them has their own special methods for getting good results. What Lucila likes most about farming is harvesting the coffee beans. Although it is difficult to get the crop to market in the city and to have it stored, she considers it a very profitable business. It fetches a good price at the market. Lucila is therefore planning to buy additional land where she can increase her coffee production. This is her third loan with [field partner] MFP, and she can see the economic progress she has made already. She will continue to make her repayments responsibly because she wants to continue accessing credit to help her bsiness grow - and because she enjoys being part of this communal bank. With the loan she is seeking, Lucila will buy sacks of organic fertilizer to spread on her crops and increase productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Laskmi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Laskmi;  ella tiene 35 años de edad,  es madre  soltera y tiene 2 hijos, ella trabaja en una encuestadora situada en el barrio de Santa Monica, y también hace chompas artesanales ella tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado artesanal y comparte su tiempo en ambos trabajos. La socia necesita el préstamo para comprar lanas y una maquina de tejer  y prepara su mercadería.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mercadería y una maquina de tejer.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”. this bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the Cuzco province and department. The member is Mrs. Laskmi. She is 35 years old, and a single mother of 2 children. She works for a pollster located in the Santa Monica neighborhood. She also makes artisanal sweaters. She has a small stall in the artisanal market and she divides her time between both jobs. She needs the loan to buy wool and a knitting machine and to prepare her merchandise. This member is asking for the loan to invest in purchasing merchandise and a knitting machine. She is grateful for and values the loan and is committed to being disciplined in making the payments according to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to invest in purchasing merchandise and a knitting machine.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 62 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hija estudiante. Anteriormente se dedicaba en la venta de comida en los paraderos de buses, sin embargo tuvo que renunciar a ello debido a problemas graves de salud, es así que han transcurrido 5 años por lo que ha decidido vender productos comestibles y bebidas gasificadas en general. Es así que tiene una bodega, para ello tuvo que acondicionar en el interior de su casa, donde atiende calidamente a sus clientes. Se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que lo realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, además puede trabajar de manera más tranquila sin descuidar su salud. Lo que más anhela es tener cervezas y ampliar mucho más su negocio. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que con este  dinero le ayuda a fortalecer su capital de trabajo. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa incrementar con mercaderías comestibles, para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Nora, 62, is a very hard working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and her student daughter. She used to work selling food at bus stops but had to stop doing that due to serious health issues. It’s been five years since she decided to sell food items and soft drinks in general. She has a grocery store set up in part of her house that was specially equipped for this where she kindly tends to her customers. She feels very happy about her store because she runs it with her husband’s help. Besides, she can work calmly and not neglect her health. What she most wants is to add beer and expand her inventory much more. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she commits to repay each installment on time because this money helps strengthen her working capital. She will use the requested funds to increase stock of food items for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools to do his work, and bricks

loans.name: Mercedes Maricela

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

La señora Mercedes es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución, está muy agradecida  con la Fundación Espoir por todo lo que ha hecho por ella y por sus amigas. Tiene 60 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene tres hijos mayores  ya casados, vive con su esposo y  con su madre que ya es mayorcita, su marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Tiene una tiende de víveres de consumo, vende de todo aceite, arroz, detergentes, etc además de productos como carne, pescado, queso y otros productos que se venden a diario, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 19h00, sus productos los compra en Portoviejo cada vez que le falta algo, puede ser dos veces por mes y otros productos los recibe en su tienda.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más productos para surtir aun más su tienda.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un mini Marquet.
texts.en:
The members of “Nueva Ilusión” (New Illusion) communal bank meet every two weeks in Cadi, Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place renowned for its hardworking people dedicated to farming and cattle raising.

Mercedes is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes the benefits she gets from the institution.  She is very grateful to Fundación Espoir for everything it has done for her and her friends.

She is 60 years old, in a common law relationship and has three adult, married children.  She lives with her husband and her elderly mother.  Her husband is a farmer.

She has a grocery store.  She sells everything: oil, rice, detergents, etc. and also products like: meat, fish, cheese and other items that sell daily.  She is open for business every day from 6am until 7pm.  She buys her products in Portoviejo every time she needs something.  This could be twice a month.  Some items are delivered to her store.

The loan will be used to buy more stock items for her store.

Her dream is to have a minimarket some day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, meat and groceries in general.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia K. is currently in the business of selling beans, sugar, cartons of salt, soap, etc. in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and sugar to sell.  Cicilia is 38 years old and is married to a farmer. She has one child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her shop.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans and sugar to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda F. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children, two are adult-aged and three are school-aged. To make a living, Merlinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting assorted crops to sell. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the family is from the salary of her husband as a private driver. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Merlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase housing materials. This loan will be the 19th loan taken out by Merlinda from PMPC. 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
This is Felix C., 46, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Agrifina C., and together they mange their household and business. Presently, they are both working hard to provide finances for their everyday expenses.

Felix operates a frozen food business. He buys frozen cuts of meat and spiced hams, native sausages, sweetened and cured meat, and others of the like. He then adds a small amount on the selling price, sells them on credit for one week, and then earns his profits a week later. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php15,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Felix dreams of being able to have his house renovated by the end of the year. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Samuel Njenga

texts.en:
Samuel has been working in a quarry in Naivasha town for the last two years. He also works as a middleman, buying animals from herders and selling them at a profit. He is 24 years old and married to Peris Njehia. They have two children together.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy 15 sheep, which he will rear and sell later at a profit, in time for the coming festive season.

loans.use: To buy sheep, which he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Kamil

texts.ru:
Kamil M. 20 let. On ne jenat i jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Kamil okonchil shkolu i nachal rabotat , on uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya pereprodajey odejdi. Kamil ochen lubit svoyu rabotu i dovolen yeyu.

Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye , postavit polki dlya raskladki odejdi. Kamil v dalneyshem xotel bi pradovat ne toka jenskuyu no i mujskuyu odejdu.
texts.en:
Kamil M. is twenty years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the Absheron region.  Kamil graduated from school and started working. He has been selling clothes for two years already.  He really loves his work and is satisfied doing it.

Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to expand his shop and to install shelves to hold clothes.  In the future, Kamil would like to sell not only women’s clothing, but men’s as well.

loans.use: Expand his shop

loans.name: Adel

texts.ar:
عادل في عمر 56 سنة متزوج وله 5 اولاد يعمل في النقل العام يحب عائلته ويسعى دائما الى دعم عائلته
ماديا ومعنويا فهو جدي في العمل نشيط ومثابر له في عمله اكثر من 10 سنوات له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة
كان يلقى الدعم الكامل من عائلته حيث ساهم في تحسين وضع عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء سيارة جديدة 
لكي يحسن من وضعه المادي حيث انه يجد صعوبة مادية في تطوير عمله
texts.en: Adel is a 56-year-old husband and father of five who always seeks to support his family financially and emotionally, and who in turn is greatly supported by them. For the past decade, Adel has been very actively and assiduously working as a taxi driver. Given his good standing with Al Majmoua, Adel now wanted to seek another loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To purchase new taxi

loans.name: Maricel Nacua's Group

texts.en:
Maricel N. lives in Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old, married and has one school-age child. She leads a two-person loan group affiliated with PMPC. While each member of the group gets an individual loan, both are responsible for paying back the entire loan if the other person is delinquent or defaults.

Maricel makes a living by selling snacks to people who live in her community. She has been engaged in this business for almost one year and earns about 1,000 PHP a month from her work

In 2010, Maricel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and her ability to engage in business. Her loan group is  applying for its first loan, and she plans to use her 4,000 PHP portion to buy piglets to raise and later sell. She plans to use the additional income she earns from this loan to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. 

About Group Loans
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and later sell

loans.name: Patila Usonova's Group

texts.en:
Patila U., 66, is the leader of this group. Unfortunately, Patila is a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. Her first son and her daughter are married; they are employed and live with their families. Her second son went to work in Russia in order to earn money. She is a resident of Uzgen, an ancient town near Osh.

Ten years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS Patila started to prepare and sell food. In this way she earns 5,000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more food in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future Patila wants to improve the family’s living conditions.

About Mol Bulak Finance (MBF):

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase food to prepare to sell

loans.name: Crisol Group

texts.es: El Grupo Crisol esta compuesta por dos integrantes mujeres, la Sra. Benita y Rosa conforman el grupo en garantía cruzada "crisol" desde hace cinco años, la Sra. Benita reparte sombreros al crédito y mucho mas en poca de fiestas para lo cual necesita capital de trabajo ya que con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería por cantidad ya que le hicieron el pedido para estas fechas de carnavales , la Sra. Rosa tiene la venta de golosinas en la puerta del colegio y en época de clase, ella vende toda clase de golosinas y juguetes por lo que también necesita capital para esta actividad, al margen ella prepara sándwich para llevar a las obras en construcción cercanas, en los momentos de clases, ya que su venta es el ingreso y salida de los estudiantes con el dinero del crédito surtirá su puesto de venta con dulces, galletas, son dos personas muy responsables por lo que se solicita la tasa preferencial kiva, las dos socias están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The group “Crisol” (Crucible) consists of two female members. Sras. Benita and Rosa formed the “Crisol” Solidarity Group five years ago. Sra. Benita sells hats on credit, mostly at parties, and needs operating capital. She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise in bulk so that she can fulfill her orders in time for the Carnival dates.

Sra. Rosa sells candy at the door of the high school. During the school year, she sells all types of candy and toys so she needs capital for her business. In addition, she prepares sandwiches to bring to nearby construction sites. The money from the loan will be used to restock her vending post with candy and cookies.

Benita and Rosa are two very responsible individuals who are requesting the preferential Kiva rate. They are grateful to Emprender for the support provided.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula, de 65 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su hija mayor y sus dos nietos; y juntos se esfuerzan cada día por alcanzar el progreso. Cuando su esposo falleció, esta emprendedora dama buscó un negocio que le permitiera obtener ganancias en la tranquilidad de su hogar, pues no podía conseguir un empleo por su avanzada edad. Y desde hace algún tiempo empezó a alquilar cuartos en su casa, aunque solo tiene  dos inquilinos en la actualidad. Ella tiene grandes sueños por cumplir y desea hacerlos realidad. Su vida transcurre apacible, pues logra buenas ganancias del alquiler de dos cuartos que tiene en su casa. Para el futuro tiene muchos planes, y entre ellos se encuentra el de terminar de construir su casa, pues tiene planeado alquilar dos piezas más de su casa; de esta manera  espera generarse regulares ganancias. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Paula tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de material de construcción que necesita para mandar levantar las paredes de lo que será el próximo cuarto que empezara a alquilar, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Paula, age 65, lives in her own house with her grown daughter and two grandchildren. Each day they strive to make progress. When her husband passed away, this enterprising woman decided to start a business that would allow her to earn income to make her home comfortable since she is not able to get a job at her age. For some time, she has rented rooms in her house but she only has two tenants at the moment. She has grand dreams to fulfill and make reality. Paula has a peaceful life, generating good rental income from the two occupied rooms in her home. She has several plans for the future, including the completion of the construction of her house so that she can rent out two more rooms in hopes of having more regular income.

This is her second loan with MFP. Paula promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to look bad in the eyes of those responsible who made this loan possible so that she could continue working and making progress. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of necessary construction materials to erect walls for the next room she will make available for rent. Paula hopes this will improve her earnings.

loans.use: Purchase materials to build walls for a rental room

loans.name: Koudiratou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Koudiratou a 31 ans. Elle est née à Lomé et habite quartier Akodessewa.  Elle vend les produits cosmétiques et les tapettes.  Elle compte  16 ans d’expérience et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Ensuite elle les revend à son domicile. Elle demande un crédit pour se réapprovisionner et accroître sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Miss Koudiratou is 31 years old. She was born in Lomé and lives in the Akodessewa district. She sells cosmetic products and flip-flops. She has 16 years experience and gets her supplies from the large market in Lomé. She then resells them from her home. She is requesting a loan to get fresh supplies and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products and flip-flops

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 44 years old, married and lives with her family in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She makes a living as a farmer, growing mostly rice and corn which she sells in a local market. She has applied for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. Her goal is to expand the size of her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bushra Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Bushra Perveen lives in a small city called Kasur, which is located near Lahore, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She is 48 years old and has spent more than half of her life in Kasur. She lives there in the area of Kot Pakka Qilah in a two-room brick house. She is married to 60-year-old A. H. who sells manual mixers. The mixer is called chattu watta in the local language and is made of marble stone used to blend onions, pepper, ginger & garlic etc.  His business is going very well because it is a unique business.  Therefore, Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her husband wants to improve his business further. Through the loan, he will purchase mixers in a larger quantity. Bushra is sure that her husband’s business will improve further after making the loan investment and her family will be able to enjoy better living facilities as a result. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Bushra Perveen.

loans.use: To buy manual mixers (chattu watta in local language) used to blend onions, pepper, ginger and garlic etc

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr: Jean Claude M. est commerçant des téléphones mobiles, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Il a 37 ans, il est marie, et il a 4 enfants entre 1 an et 12 ans.  Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il est ne au Rwanda, et il a fini 3 ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit et son quatrième cycle avec ACB, et il a une bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paires de téléphones avec 2 cartes SIM ; 5 paires marquent TIGO, 5 paires marquent MTN, et des autres choses pour son business.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de solliciter beaucoup de crédits en vue d’augmenter la capacité du projet, et l’utilisation des meilleurs matériels dans son business.  Il voudrait devenir un grand business-man.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait assurer leur bien-être, et bâtir d’autres maisons d’habitation a louer.
texts.en:
Jean Claude M. sells mobile phones. He became a client of ACB in 2009. He is 37 years old and married with four children aged 1 to 12 years old, three of whom attend school. Jean Claude was born in Rwanda, and he completed three years of high school. 

This is his fourth loan cycle with ACB, and he correctly repaid all previous loans. He will use his loan to buy 10 pairs of phones with two SIM cards, namely 5 pairs of TIGO and 5 pairs of MTN, as well as other items. 

His business growth strategy is to obtain plenty of financing in order to bolster his working capital, and to use the best merchandise in the business. He wishes to become a great businessman, to ensure his family’s well-being, and to build dwelling houses to rent.

loans.use: to buy 10 pairs of mobile phones with SIM cards (5 MTN and 5 TIGO), and other items to sell

loans.name: Tryphine

texts.en:
Tryphine is 39 years old, married, and supports five members of her family. She owns a retail shop and has been in this business for two years with a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

She has borrowed a loan of 8,269 KES, which she plans to use to pay the initial leasing fee for Solio portable solar gadgets. Tryphine will lease these items to other clients and get a weekly payment in return when her clients come to get the reactivation of the Solio gadgets so that they can charge. She plans to use the anticipated profits from the business to expand her retail shop which has been her primary business so that it can become a one-stop shop. She also hopes to give her children the best education from her profits. This is her second loan, after she successfully repaid her previous loan. The solar powered gadgets will also reduce the amount of money she used to use to buy kerosene for lighting her lamps and also help in proving lighting for her children when working on their homework.

Tryphine's future dream is to have a stable business, open a big shop, and educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: to lease solar powered Solio gadgets

loans.name: Jay

texts.en: Jay, 25 years of age, is married and blessed with one child. He is a charcoal vendor in their village. He earns 3,000 monthly in this business. He's asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase materials needed in his charcoal making and selling business, such as firewood. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to support his loan and hopes to expand his business further to generate higher profits and sustain his family's daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to make charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, clay and 'nacazcol' (a dye) for making pots and 'comales' (special dishes for cooking tortillas)

loans.name: La Luna 2 Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "LA LUNA 2", PORQUE ESTA UBICADO EN EL CERRO Y DESDE AHI SE PUEDE APRECIAR PERFECTAMENTE LA LUNA LO CUAL LES ENCANTA. LA SEÑORA VERONICA ES LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO, TIENE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA SEXTO AÑO DE PRIMARIA, SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE ARTESANIAS COMO MANTELES Y SERVILLETAS BORDADAS, NEGOCIO QUE INICIO DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS. TIENE 2 HIJOS, UNO DE 15 Y 13 AÑOS DE EDAD. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA REINVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO YA QUE SE APROXIMA LA FERIA DEL PUEBLO Y ES CUANDO VENDE GRAN PARTE DE SUS CREACIONES. AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE ENTUSIASMADA YA QUE PODRA INVERTIR EN TELAS, HILOS, AHUJAS, GANCHOS Y PLANTILLAS PARA LAS FIGURAS QUE PLASMARA EN SUS MANTELES; CON ESTO PLANEA HACER BASTANTES ARTICULOS PARA VENDER EN LA FERIA; CON LAS GANANCIAS OBTENIDAS QUIERE HACER MAS GRANDE SU NEGOCIO Y UTILIZARA PARTE DE ESTAS GANANCIAS PARA LA EDUCACION DE SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
This group is called "La Luna 2" ("The Moon 2"), because they are located on a hillside and from there you can clearly see the moon which so enchants them.  Señora Veronica is the treasurer of the group.  She is 33 years old and has studied up to the sixth year of primary school.  She works in creating craftwork such as embroidered tablecloths and napkins, a business which she started 5 years ago.  She has 2 children, one aged 15 and one aged 13.

She is requesting the loan to reinvest in her business, because they are approaching the time of the village festival which is when she sells most of her creations.  At the time of applying for this loan she feels enthusiastic, and that she will be able to invest in fabrics, yarns, needles, hooks and patterns for the images she features on her tablecloths.  With this plan she will make plenty of articles to sell at the festival; with the profits obtained she wants to make her business bigger and she will use part of these profits for the education of her children.

loans.use: to invest in fabrics, yarns, needles, hooks and patterns.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe BENKADI  3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  KENA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz, de l’arachide et du pois sucré avec MARIAM, la 1ère accroupie à gauche de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women, on average 40 years old with 4 children, and live mostly in polygamous households in Kena, one of the towns in the district of Nantien in the Sikasso Prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to properly manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their sixth loan with the institution, and all the previous loans were repaid properly.
Mariam, crouching all the way on the left in the photo, grows rice, peanuts, and tiger peas. 
With this loan, she intends to pay for labour costs and buy agricultural inputs and seeds to maintain 1 hectare of land.
The produce is sold throughout the town and at the Sikasso market after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize an average profit of 45,500 FCFA for the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: To pay for labour and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Mujeres Soñadoras (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Soñadoras está formado por 6 mujeres y 3 hombres quienes viven diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una gran belleza natural y cultural, su gente son personas amables y cordiales, esta ciudad también tiene una gran variedad de platos típicos que cautivan el paladar de propios y extraños. Nuestros socios son personas muy trabajadoras que laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y salir adelante junto a sus familias. 

Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. María Cruz, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 60 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y casados. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Nuestra socia desde muy joven se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y conejos, a los que los vende en la ciudad. También se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para su consumo. Hace 4 años se dedica a la recolección de chatarra.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es tener más animales para la crianza.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Soñadoras” (Women Dreamers) communal bank is composed of six women and three men who live in various places in the city of Cuenca, a city with much natural and cultural beauty.  Its residents are kind and courteous people.  This city also has a wide variety of traditional dishes that captivate the taste buds of locals and foreigners alike.  Our members are very hard working people who are engaged in a variety of occupations that allow them to meet household expenses and to get ahead with their families.

One of the group members is María Cruz.  She lives in Cuenca and is 60 years old.  She’s a widow and has five children who are all adults and married.  She does not have a house of her own; she rents.

Our member has raised chickens, guinea pigs and rabbits since she was a young girl that she sells in the city.  She also farms and what she grows is for her own consumption.  She’s also been collecting scrap for four years.

This is the second loan she’s had in the communal bank and she will use it to buy guinea pigs and their feed.  Her goal is to have more animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Jackelin

texts.en:
Jackelin is 39 years old and lives with her partner. She has three children who are 9, 17, and 18 years old. Jackelin is the owner of a Bar Restaurant in the city of Calca. She mostly serves typical Peruvian dishes and also different kinds of pizzas. She has had her restaurant for about 5 years.

Jackelin is asking for a $600 loan in order to purchase ingredients for her restaurant such as meat, beer, vegetables, rice, corn, and soft drinks. She is committed to making the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy meat, beer, vegetables, rice, corn, and soft drinks for her Bar Restaurant

loans.name: Las Dulces Orquideas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Janet  es divorciada, tiene 2 hijas en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Dulces Orquídeas” grupo  conformado por 10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Janet  trabaja desde hace  3 años en la venta de anticuchos, pancita y picarones , este negocio surge a raíz de su divorcio,  ya que ella tenía que trabajar para mantener a sus 2  hijas  y es así que empezó vendiendo en la puerta de su casa anticuchos con el tiempo se hizo más conocida y ahora también vende picarones, a su vez ella recibe una pensión por alimentos de su ex esposo para sus  hijas ,  Janet  nos cuenta que todo lo consiguió con mucho trabajo y perseverancia ya que su motivación eran sus hijas y sus deseos de superación eran más grandes que sus problemas,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos,sus hijas cuentan con educacion personalizada, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería insumos , Sabemos que Janet  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en:
Janet is divorced with 2 daughters of school age and is currently a member of “Las Dulces Orquideas” (The Sweet Orchids) Group, composed of 10 members who are dedicated to diverse commercial activities. Janet has worked for 3 years selling kebabs, tripe, and fritters. The business began in response to her divorce, since she needed to work to support her 2 daughters. That's why she began selling kebabs at her front door. In time she became better known and now she sells fritters too. At the same time, she also receives food payments from her ex-husband for her daughters.

Janet tells us that she is succeeding with much work and perseverance because she is motivated by her daughters and her desire to get ahead is greater than her problems. Thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has  achieved a higher economic income and her daughters can count on a personalized education. With the goal of continuing to grow, she is requesting a new loan to buy supplies and merchandise. We know that Janet will satisfy her objectives with much work and effort and that these loans  through Edaprospo will aid her.

loans.use: buy supplies (Meat, masa for tortillas, etc.) to make and sell kebabs, fritters, etc.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a 50-year-old mother of four dependents. It is in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, that the family settled down and runs a retail store for a living. All family members help each other to accommodate customers. She always reminds her children to be thrifty and to manage resources timely and properly to succeed. By the end of the month, Anabelle's cash on hand reaches a total of PHP 9,000 (Philippine pesos) from store operations.

Earlier this year, Anabelle became a GDMPC member. Her former loan application has been paid in full. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to change the store roof and cover holes in some corners, so it is a conducive place to do business. She hopes for a progressive business venture and to lay aside a sum of money as a revolving fund.

loans.use: To change the store roof and cover holes in some corners.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 28 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Mayli de 07 años y lo que más desea es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, para lo cual esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Ana, a su corta edad es padre y madre para su hija, ante la falta de su pareja ella trata de sobresalir y entregar lo mejor de si para que no le falte nada  a su querida hija- Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana sale a trabajar sus campos verdes, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son: el cacao, café y los frutos de plátano, los cuales  una vez cosechados los lleva a vender a distintos mercados de la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 07 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar en tiempos de aguacero ya que las lluvias por esta parte de la amazonia peruana son continuos. Para el futuro y su mejor bienestar, planea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar sus cultivos. Este será su cuarto crédito de Ana y esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de ustedes para seguir prosperando. En su banco comunal es una socia participe. Con el monto solicitado comprará palos y calaminas para construir una casa provisional sobre su parcela ya que le servirá de refugio en temporadas de lluvia.
texts.en:
Ana, 28, is a cheerful, hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her beloved, 7-year-old daughter, Mayli.  What she most desires is to provide her with a better quality of life and is willing to work very hard to do so.  Ana, at her young age, is both father and mother to her daughter.  In face of her partner’s absence, she tries to get ahead and give the best of herself so that her beloved daughter will want for naught.  

Every day, very early, she goes out to work in the green fields.  For her, there are no days off because she must work continually in her field in order to have a good harvest.  The main things she grows are: cocoa beans, coffee and bananas which, once harvested, she takes to sell in various markets in the city of San Francisco.  What she most likes about her work is the freedom she has working her fields because she can freely enjoy the green countryside.  She’s been in this line of work for 7 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to work during the heavy rainy season because rains in this part of the Peruvian Amazon region are continuous. For the future and for her better wellbeing, she plans to buy new land to increase her production.  

This is Ana’s fourth loan and she’s very happy to know that once again she’ll be able to count on your support to continue making progress.  She is a very participative member of her communal bank.  She will use the requested amount to buy wooden stakes and plywood sheets to build a temporary shelter in her field that will serve as refuge during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy wood stakes and plywood sheets.

loans.name: Daudi

texts.en:
Daudi is a married man who lives at a rental house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors in his business. Daudi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of sugar, maize flour, detergents and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of sugar, maize flour, detergents and cooking oil.

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat is from the village of Kharataklia, Gardabani district, East Georgia. Janat is 55 years old, married and lives with her family: husband – Muradkhan, 28 year-old-son, daughter-in-law and 2 grandsons (2 and 3 years old). 

Janat and Muradkhan are the income providers in the family. They run a family agricultural business. They have 2 milk cows, 8 calves and 25 sheep. Janat produces cheese and sells it locally. Domestic animals (lambs, calves) are also sold locally. Her son is temporarily unemployed; her daughter-in-law is a housewife.

Janat requested credit to purchase feed for domestic animals for the winter months. She will feed them well during the winter months and will get good quality dairy products. Also, in spring she will sell lambs and some of the calves. After selling dairy products and domestic animals for a good price the family will make a profit which will be used for the family well-being. Janat will also reinvest part of the profit in the family farm to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase feed for domestic animals

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is 40 years of age and married with eleven children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Makerita needs a loan of WST $1,750 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment such as knives, spades, axes, sharpeners and a wheel-barrow. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 WST or US $104 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Makerita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Makerita's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en: 52-year-old Nicanora is a married woman with three children. She has poultry and makes a living selling eggs. Nicanora has regular customers in her town to whom she delivers eggs. Nicanora requested a loan to purchase eight boxes of egg trays. This will help Nicanora deliver more eggs at one time. Nicanora hopes her business will grow more.

loans.use: to purchase eight boxes of egg trays.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is 42 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past four years, Sulaiman has been working hard to manage his bar and lodge, which sells beer and soda in addition to offering beds to sleep in. 

To help expand his business, Sulaiman has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bed frames and crates of beer, and iti will help Sulaiman to generate greater profits and complete his family's second house. Sulaiman hopes that in the future he will be able to open a depot for soda. 

Sulaiman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sulaiman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more bed frames and crates of beer.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 22 years old and has been a fisherman for 6 years. He lives in Trinidad, Bohol with his family.

Antonio is asking for a loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. This will help Antonio catch more fish to sell.  Antonio works hard to provide for his family. He hopes to send all his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials

loans.name: Talalelei

texts.en:
Talalelei is a 62-year-old woman living in the town of Lalomalava. She is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Talalelei owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting taamu for sale. Talalelei has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately WST 720 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Talalelei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Talalelei has successfully repaid a previous loan of WST 1,000 from SPBD. This earlier loan was used to buy general farm supplies and equipment. Talalelei is now requesting a new loan of WST 1,500, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and Gromozone. This loan will be her fourth loan from SPBD. Talalelei plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Roeurng

texts.en:
Roeurng is a 58-year-old married woman residing in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is the mother of 5 children and works as a farmer.  She grows rice crops twice a year alongside her husband on their farmland. Some of her children also assist them in farming, in addition to attending classes at school. 

The family has encountered many difficulties related to transportation. Currently, Roeurng doesn’t own a motorcycle, so she has decided to ask for some funds from Kiva to buy a used motorcycle that will provide the family with reliable transportation. If she has enough money, Roeurng hopes to repair some parts of her house because it’s too old and hard to live in.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. 
Rodulfo has a pig pen and sells grown & matured pigs. He has had this business for 4 years. He requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.
Rodulfo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rodulfo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 57 years old, married to Esther and blessed with three children aged 36, 33 and 14 years old.  He operates a business at Bonjoge trading centre, Rift valley, which has been in operation for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 30,000.  He will use this amount to purchase more stock of wheat and maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil for his business.  The profits will be used to repay back the loan and for the family upkeep.

His hopes and dreams are to grow his business and educate his children to greater heights.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his business.

loans.name: Gbenagnon 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENAGNON 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Florentine Baï est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Florentine Baï est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Florentine Baï a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Florentine Baï est mariée à un certain Marc. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Florentine Baï vit ensemble avec son mari et ses deux enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les divers besoins de la famille. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges, Florentine Baï vend depuis cinq ans, des friperies de façon ambulante. Florentine Baï s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Florentine Baï sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENAGNON 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The "Gbenagnon 1" group comprises three people who live in the same area. This is the third time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ, in order to raise the level of its business. The group representative, named Florentine Baï, is the woman whose hand is raised in the photo. Florentine Baï is 36 years old and lives in Benin. She ended her studies in primary school and is married to a man named Marc. The couple have two children, both of whom are in their care and attend school. Florentine Baï lives together with her husband and two children, and provides for the various household needs together with her husband. In order to pay for various expenses, Florentine Baï has sold second-hand clothing door-to-door for five years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her sales volume and income, Florentine Baï is seeking a third loan with ALIDÉ along with the other members of the Gbenagnon group. The two previous loans were repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very please to present to you members of the “Go Bifo” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 
Isatu Conteh is the leader of this group. Isatu is 57 years old, married with three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Isatu sells dishes and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu will invest in he business by buying different kinds of dishes and in large quantity to add to her business. 
(Also included in the right of the photo is Loan Officer Edward, posing with the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy different kinds of dishes and in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Flavienne Akouavi

texts.fr: Âgée de 51 ans, Flavienne Akouavi n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Flavienne Akouavi est mariée à un certain Joseph. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. En dehors de leur enfant, le couple a un autre enfant à sa charge. Flavienne Akouavi vit ensemble avec son mari et les enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Pour cette raison, Flavienne Akouavi vend des vivres à son domicile depuis dix huit ans. De façon secondaire, Flavienne Akouavi vend aussi divers produits (sucre, lait, savon etc) ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Flavienne Akouavi s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Flavienne Akouavi devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Flavienne Akouavi sollicite une quatrième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres et divers produits.

loans.name: Codigo 8 Group

texts.es:
Rosmery es una mujer de 42 años de edad, divorciada, tiene dos hijos varones de 10 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo y responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de Obrajes que se caracteriza por encontrarse 64 construcciones patrimoniales que datan de principios y mediados del siglo pasado y se encuentra a 5 kilómetros del centro de la ciudad de La Paz, a 3.200 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Rosmery es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada la derecha, usa polera azul y chaleco marrón). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos por ampliar su negocio la hicieron formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, confección de tejidos, venta de pescado, servicio de construcción, venta de empanadas y comercio de cosméticos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; Plato paceño (carne de res, habas verdes, choclos y queso), Fricase de cerdo (sopa de cerdo con chuño, mote y papas), Sopa de Quinua (quinua y carne), anticucho (corazón de res y papa a la parrilla, con ají de maní), chairo paceño (sopa de chuño con carne) y otros. Oficio que aprendió desde muy niña cuando le ayudaba a su mamá. “la comida típica destaca la riqueza tradicional que aún está latente en nuestra gente…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande donde pueda vender comida con comodidad. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor, como; carnes, fideos, arroz, papa, chuño y otros, para cocinar durante las fiestas de fin de año. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 13 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para estar abastecida durante las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a 42-year-old woman who is divorced and has two sons, ages 10 and 12. Her business involves selling traditional food. She is a good mother who is cheerful, optimistic, happy, and responsible. Rosmery also has a good attitude and is committed to her work. She conducts her business in the District of Obrajes, an area known for its 64 historical buildings that date back to the early and mid-20th century and are located within 5 kilometers from the central part of the city of La Paz. This area lies 3,200 meters above sea level.

Rosmery has a dark complexion, long black hair that is tied back, and a short stature. Her native language is Aymara, but she speaks Spanish so that she can integrate into the general culture and conduct business. In the photo, she is seated on the right, wearing a blue shirt and a brown vest. She shares her life with her children who are in school. They live in a rented house that has running water, electricity, and sewage services. Rosmery wanted to expand her business, so she formed a Communal Bank with other business people who sell clothes, sell fruit, sell tomatoes, produce woven goods, sell fish, provide construction services, sell empanadas, and sell cosmetics. They are able to request a loan so that they can improve their businesses.

Rosmery sells traditional dishes such as “plato paceño” (beef served with green beans, corn, and cheese), “fricase de cerdo” (pork stew with potatoes and hominy), quinoa soup (which has quinoa and beef), “anticucho” (grilled beef hearts and potatoes, served with a spicy peanut sauce), “chairo paceño” (potato soup with meat), and other foods. She learned to cook as a young girl by helping her mother. “Traditional food is known for expressing the rich heritage of our people,” says Rosmery. Her dream is to have a large restaurant where she can sell food comfortably. She wants to make an investment in her business by purchasing cooking supplies in bulk such as meats, noodles, rice, potatoes, dried potatoes, and other ingredients. She plans to cook during the year-end festivals. This is her second loan cycle with Emprender. Rosmery has been in this line of work for 13 years.

For the reasons mentioned, Rosmery is requesting a loan in order to buy cooking supplies so that she will be stocked during the year-end festivals.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies so that she will be stocked during the year-end festivals.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
SABOUGNOUMA est un groupe de l’association SIBAMONDOUMA de DIALAKOROBA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente du lait à l’image de MAYA qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DIALAKOROBA, Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente du lait. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
MAYA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à DIALAKOROBA, excellente dans la vente du lait. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante  de lait. Elle s’approvisionne à DIALAKOROBA et dans les villages environnant. Elle effectue ses ventes à DIALAKOROBA en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente du lait.

loans.use: Achat de Lait

loans.name: Lyndie

texts.en:
Lyndie is 24 years old, married and has one child to provide for. To earn a living she manages a motor repair shop. As a mother and a wife she wants to increase her income so that she can help her husband in providing for her child. She decided to borrow a loan to buy additional tools for the motor shop so that they can continue to operate her shop and can cater to more customers, which will generate more income.

Lyndie's plan for the future is to save money out from her business income to sustain the needs of her child.

loans.use: To buy additional tools for the motor shop.

loans.name: Luz Nelly

texts.en:
Luz is 55 years old and lives in the municipality of Medellín. She is a widow that has found her way through life, with her 3 daughters, who thanks so much to her mother for providing for them and turning them into great women. Before her husband die, he taught her to sell and left her a place to sell products like snacks, coffee and cigarettes. 

She has been working in that for around 9 years, and she loves working in it. She hopes she can improve her business so it can last for more time because is the only way she has to provide for her family. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more inputs and some thermos to carry more coffee. 

Luz dreams with improving the conditions of her house and with having a good quality of life. You can help Luz with the loan she needs and get her closer to accomplish her goals.

loans.use: buy more inputs and some thermos to carry more coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Isabella would like to buy better seeds for her horticulture farming.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married and has a young daughter. When her husband lost his job at the factory because of job cuts, they didn't have money to support themselves. With his severance pay, they bought a sewing machine which Amalia began to use for business. She makes uniforms and other items of clothing. She has now been doing this for 15 years and demand for her services has grown significantly.

Amalia needs a loan of $250 which she will use to buy the necessary materials to keep doing her work. You can be an integral part of this business by helping Amalia grow with her business. She will be very thankful for your support and care.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Amalia es casada y tiene una hija pequeña, cuando su esposo fue despedido de la fábrica por recorte de personal, ellos no tenían de donde obtener los recursos que necesitaban como familia, y con la liquidación de su trabajo compraron una máquina de cocer con la que Amalia empezó a realizar costuras y poco a poco fue ganando clientes, ahora cose uniformes y vertidos, entre otras prendas. Ya son 15 años lo que Amalia tiene en el negocio y la demanda por sus servicios se ha incrementado significativamente.

En estos momentos Amalia necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que empleara en la comprar de materiales que necesita para seguir haciendo su trabajo. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental de este negocio, ayuda a Amalia a poder crecer con su negocio, ella agradece sinceramente de tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Mrs Hien is 53 and her husband 56 years old. Their two children died of accident. Their third son is mentally retarded but he can work to find money for him. Other children are going to school in grade 10 and 7. They don’t have any land for cultivation. Mr Doan, her husband make soya at home and then Mrs Hien sells them at the local market. Average income is low at $6/person/month. Mrs Hien wants to borrow a loan of $ 50 so that she can raise pigs and she will repay loan monthly.

loans.use: sell soya and raise pigs

loans.name: Ganiyou

texts.en: Ganiyou C. is a 24-year-old single mother. She has a 4-year-old daughter and lives in Koumassi, a township in the southern area of Abidjan. C. sells various plastic utensils in the Koumassi open market. She has been in this business for more than 8 years. She performs very well and has improved her business since October 2005 when she benefited a first loan from AE&I. C. is dynamic and ambitious. She wants to expand her business with new range of plastic products such as packaging sachets.

loans.use: Ganiyou Cherifa wants to purchase plastic utensils

loans.name: Claudelina

texts.es:
Claudelina E. is 65 years old and widowed. She lives in her own house with her 4 children, all of them older. Even at her age, Claudelina really wants to work, as widowhood is double the responsibility to give a better quality of life to her children.

She has an inn where she sells milk and dairy products. She tells us that in 1992, she started selling milk in small quantities to her neighbors. As time passed she grew her customer base, as milk is well accepted, for the need that all creatures have to consume it, and more because it's a natural product. One of her children sells dairy products, this helps considerably with the income for the family.
