She will use the loan to buy food supplements for the dairy cows. Their area, and almost the entire country, is suffering from a prolonged drought, and because of that the cows need supplemental food to be able to produce the milk that Claudelina hopes to sell to her customers.

Claudelina E. tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda, vive en casa propia con sus cuatros hijos, todos mayores de edad, a pesar de su edad se siente con muchas ganas de trabajar ya que al enviudar era doble la responsabilidad para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Tiene un tambo con la venta de leche y sus derivados. La señora Claudelina nos cuenta que en el año 1992 comenzó a vender leche en pequeñas cantidades a sus vecinos y con el correr del tiempo fue agrandando su clientela, ya que el producto que comercializa, es de gran aceptación, por la necesidad que tienen las criaturas de consumirla y más aún si es un producto natural. Con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos que se dedica a la venta de desmamantes de las lecheras, que también genera un ingreso considerable a la familia. El préstamo lo desea utilizar para la compra de forrajes para sus lecheras, ya que en la zona, y casi en todo el país, se está sufriendo de una gran y prolongada sequía y por lo tanto, las lecheras necesitan de suplementos alimenticios para poder producir la leche necesaria para la venta.

loans.use: Purchase food supplements for dairy cows

loans.name: Ni Wayan Rasih

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Rasih and her husband, Nengah Sudia are diligent farmers. Dinari trusts Ni Wayan Rasih and provides her with loan of IDR 6 million (approx. USD 630). Ni Wayan Rasih used this loan to purchase 15 piglets for IDR 250 thousand per piglet (total of IDR 3.75 million). Her daily routine now is taking care of her piglets such as cleaning the pig’s hut and feeding the piglets. The pig’s hut is made of simple bamboo structure while the pig feed is made of combination from several materials that have to be bought from the market. For the feeding she has to spend IDR 2.25 million. After 6 months, the pigs are ready to be sold for IDR 7.5 million. The net profit that she can earned after 6 months work is IDR 1.5 millions. She is hoping her business to grow more and more so she can earned bigger income.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Wayan Rasih dan suaminya, Nengah Sudia, termasuk peternak yang tekun. Dari Dinari Ni Wayan Rasih memperoleh kepercayaan sehingga mendapat modal pinjaman yang cukup besar Rp. 6.000.000,- Ni Wayan Rasih mempergunakan modal ini dengan baik. Wayan Rasih membeli 15 ekor anak babi dengan harga per ekor Rp.250.000,-. Untuk modal bibit saja Ni Wayan Rasih menghabiskan modal Rp.3.750.000,-. Setiap hari Ni Wayan Rasih sibuk mengurusi babinya mulai dari membersihkan kandang sampai memberi makan. Kondisi kandang babinya sederhana memakai kandang bambu. Adapun makanan yang diberikan adalah dedak padi, deadk gandum dan konsentrat yang tidak bisa diproduksi sendiri harus membeli di warung –warung terdekat yang harganya pun tidak murah. Sampai panen, Ni Wayan Rasih menghabiskan biaya pakan sebesar Rp 2.250.000,- Setelah umur 6 bulan babinya siap dipanen yang nantinya akan dijual kepada penggepul dengan pendapatan kotor Rp.7.500.000,-. Jadi pendapatan bersih yang diperoleh Ni Wayan Rasih selama 6 bulan setelah dipotong biaya –biaya yang dikeluarkankan sebesar Rp1.500.000,- Ni Wayan Rasih tetap berharap usaha ini bisa berkembang lebih besar lagi supaya keuntungan yang didapat pun semakin besar.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig's feed

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem L., age 45, works with her husband selling fish, making around $4 per day. They have six children, one who is employed in a garment factory earning $80 per month, three are students, and two who are married and live away from home. Yem would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a motor-bike and a trailer to run a business transporting passengers. This will increase her family’s income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike and a trailer to run a business transporting passengers.

loans.name: Kartini

texts.en: Kartini, 37, is a mother of 4 children. Her husband, M., sells chickens and earns USD60 a month. She raises goat to earn extra income for the family and earns USD30 in 3 months. She requests a loan of USD75 to expand her business and as a member of MBK agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Mosbah

texts.en: Mosbah is a 63-year-old father. He works and lives with his wife and child in the Beirut suburbs. Mosbah sells water from a cistern. He needs a loan to help him repair the tank. This is the first time Mosbah is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. US$ 1200 will help him sustain his business.

loans.use: To repair their water tank

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana, who was born in 1981, is single, and lives in the town of Khachmaz. She and her mother have been selling sweets for 5 years. Now they are requesting a loan of $725 to buy more sweets to sell to increase their business.

loans.use: To buy sweets to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials like cement ,ballast,sand etc

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda is 28 years old and has 1 child. She has been operating a stationery store for 2 years now. She also sells cement and batik materials. The selling of cement is necessary as members of her community are building houses and other structures that need cement. She wants to use the loan to buy more stationery for the schoolchildren in her village and also to avoid price hikes. She is a member of the group called Quality. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan. Matilda is holding her baby girl in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more stationery items like books, pens, pencils, drawing papers, etc

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Mr. Pedro Pablo G. is dedicated to agricultural work, which is his only income to support his family, composed of his wife and three school-aged children. He has been dedicated to this business for several years and over time he has gained experience in cultivating crops.

Today he has come to Ceprodel with the proposition of obtaining a loan to purchase seed for planting corn and sesame. It is necessary to point out that in order to carry out the first planting you need to purchase the supplies and it is for this reason that he is confident that his loan request will be successfully granted and he will achieve his objective of having a good harvest to improve his economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Pedro Pablo G. se dedica a la labor de la agricultura siendo este su único ingreso con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y tres hijos en edades escolares. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace varios años y a través del tiempo ha venido ganando experiencia en los cultivos.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el crédito oportuno para la compra de insumos para siembra de maíz y ajonjolí. Es necesario destacar que para llevar a cabo la siembra primeramente se deben de comprar los insumos y es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente y logrará su objetivo de tener una muy buena cosecha para mejora de su situación económica.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for planting corn and sesame

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is married with 2 children. The children are currently in school. She hawks smoked fish in her village, where her loyal customers buy smoked fish for vegetable soup, popularly known as light soup in Ghana. This is a Ghanaian delicacy either with cooked yams or plantains and cocoyams. Augustina wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of the fish to increase her inventory to avoid price hikes and also to make a good income to pay her children’s fees. She is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral in order to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of smoked fish

loans.name: Sidi Alida

texts.fr:
Ms. Sidi Alida L. was born on November 30, 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Mr. Yacoubou Yaya, a reseller of used vehicles, and she has one child. During the first half of her day, Ms. L. sells fabric to the public and private businesses of Cotonou. During the second half of her day, she sells ready-to-eat meals, such as salads, fried chicken, and spaghetti in front of a popular bar. Her average daily profit is 25,000 Francs (about $56). She is requesting this loan so she can keep up with customer demand.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Dame L. Sidi Alida est née le 30 novembre 1985 à Cotonou dans la capitale économique du BENIN. Elle est mariée à monsieur YAYA Yacoubou, revendeur de véhicules d'occasion et mère d'un enfant. Pendant la première moitié de la journée, dame L. Sidi Alida se livre à la distribution des tissus dans les services publics et privés de Cotonou. Dans la seconde moitié de la journée, elle se livre à la vente de repas prêt à manger tels que la salade, du frit au poulets et du spaghetti à la devanture d'un bar bien fréquentée. En moyenne, elle fait un chiffre d'affaire journalier de 25 000 francs. Elle sollicite ce prêt dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 5 cartons of frozen goods, 3 baskets of condiments, and 5 cartons of spaghetti

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cover wedding expenses

loans.name: Ofa

texts.en: Ofa F., 29, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in a taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers. SPBD loans are Ofa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks

loans.use: To purchase a wheelbarow, spade, crowbar, weedkiller chemicals and fungicide for prevention of taro blight

loans.name: Anwi Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is married with two children and lives in Mbengwi, a rural town about an hour from Bamenda. With this loan, Magdalene will continue her business of frying and selling gateau (a doughnut like treat), rearing pigs, and raising fowl. Her business plan involves the purchase two piglets, 8 kilograms of animal feed, flour, sugar, yeast, oil, 50 chicks, and chicken feed. She also plans to reinforce her fence with part of this loan. She plans to use 104,000 CFA (approximately $210 USD) of her own savings to supplement her loan and ensure she has the most success in her businesses. This loan will be repaid over a period of 18 months; the first payment will be made on the day the loan is dispersed.

This will be Regina's fourth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2004. She plans to sell her fried gateaux to children on their way to school and to farmers in the morning. As there are many celebrations in the near future, including Christmas and New Years, chickens will be in high demand soon. She hopes to raise her chickens to sell before these celebrations, as they only take 6 to 8 weeks to become full grown. Her husband plans to help her raise her pigs and chickens, as he has a great deal of experience in raising animals. She plans to support her community by providing them with chickens, pigs, fried gateaux, and manure for sale at reasonable prices. Moreover, by purchasing her supplies, such as oil and pig feed, from her community, she will help to raise the incomes of others in her community. With the profits from this loan, Magdalene plans to pay her children's school fees. This is extremely important to her as she was unable to continue her education as a child of poverty. She also plans to improve her household. Magdalene hopes that this loan will continue to increase her family's standard of living as those in the past have done. She is grateful for the business training provided by GHAPE, and knows this training will be crucial in the success of her businesses.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and develops a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, animal feed, fencing, oil, chickens, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Doña Petrona  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 5to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Repellar la casa), trabaja en el Hospital Jacinto Hernández como supervisora desde hace 28 años, iene una hija mayor de edad, ella desde muy joven asumio  el rol de madre y padre para su hija, se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable, honesta y muy trabajadora que ha luchado por ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda ubicada  en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea,  este barrio recientemente se poblo y cada día se va aumentando su población,  Petrona es una mujer con alto espiritu de superación personal y laboral, que ama su trabajo,  a pesar que no tiene a su hija a cargo ella cuida a su mamá ya que esta bien viejita,  su sueño es tener estabilidad, salud y una vivienda  bonita ,  doña Petrona se siente muy gradecida con AFODENIC, ya que con los créditos anteriores logro construir poco a poco su vivienda y de esta manera brinda mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petrona A. is applying for her fifth loan to invest in improving her home (whitewashing the house). She has worked at the Hospital Jacinto Hernández as a supervisor for the past 28 years and she has a grown daughter, for whom she took on the role of both mother and father at an early age. She is very responsible, honest and hard-working, and has striven to improve her home bit by bit, located in the urban center of Nueva Guinea, a recently populated neighborhood and growing daily. Petrona is a woman of high spirits both personally and at work, which she loves. Although her daughter does not live with her, she does take care of her very elderly mother. Her dream is to have stability, health and a nice home. Petrona is grateful to AFODENIC for the previous loans which helped her slowly build her home and this way she could bring greater comfort to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvement: To whitewash the house

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo en el Barrio Constitución de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, se juntaron 18 señoras que  poseen  un gran espíritu emprendedor y deseo de trabajar en conjunto a ayudarse de forma solidaria y a ser responsables por un crédito, con el fin de un cambio en sus vidas en forma personal y económico.
Son personas trabajadoras, luchadoras y con mucha esperanza de cambio. Son Señoras de escasos recursos que viven una lucha diaria para mantener a su familia, con ayuda de sus maridos las mismas tienen el entusiasmo y muchas ganas de superarse  económicamente.
Solicitan créditos con montos entre gs. 300.000 y gs. 500.000, cada una. El detalle de actividades que realizan es como sigue:    
María Nidia R. R.	Modista
Saturnina M. 	Mueblería
Lucia Mabel Gómez	Vendedora ambulante
Norma Beatriz R.	Vendedora ambulante
Rosalba S. Peralta	Vendedora ambulante
Costancia L.	Vendedora ambulante
Gricelda González	Vendedora ambulante
Victorina O. Amarilla	Vendedora de remedios 
Marciana B. Irala	Vendedora de Frutas y Verduras
Dionicia Echeverría	Despensa
Sonia Narcisa R. R.	Vendedora ambulante
Claudelina M. Báez	Vendedora de Frutas y Verduras
Maria Hilda M.	Vendedora ambulante
Antonia Martínez	Vendedora de Frutas y Verduras
Ana Gómez Cáceres	Vendedora ambulante
Nilse Ramona A.	Carpintería
Crisilda O. Noguera	Vendedora ambulante
Bernarda R. Nuñez	Vendedora ambulante

Cada Señora integrante de este grupo tiene un trabajo especifico, y el préstamo será utilizado en forma individual por las mismas, las vendedoras ambulantes para la compra de más mercaderías para vender como artículos para el hogar, sábanas, macetas, colchas, ropas, zapatos, manteles, juguetes, entre otros. Las almaceneras para comprar productos que ya le están faltando en su negocio: frutas, verduras, remedios caseros o de venta libre, sidra, pan dulce, carnes, etc.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the Constitución neighborhood in the city of Caaguazú. Eighteen women came together who have a big enterprising spirit and the desire to work together in a supportive manner to be responsible for a credit, with the goal of changing their lives in a personal and economic way. They are hard-working, determined women with a lot of hope for change. They are women of scarce resources who live a daily fight to support their family. With the help of their husbands, they have the enthusiasm and the desire to get ahead economically. Each one of them is requesting a loan between 300,000 and 500,000 guaranís ($62 to $104). The activities that these women carry out are: María Nidia R. R.: Seamstress Saturnina M.: Furniture sales Lucia Mabel Gómez: Street vendor Norma Beatriz R.: Street vendor Rosalba S. Peralta: Street vendor Costancia L.: Street vendor Gricelda González: Street vendor Victorina O. Amarilla: Home remedy sales Marciana B. Irala: Fruit and vegetable sales Dionicia Echeverría: Grocery store Sonia Narcisa R. R.: Street vendor Claudelina M. Báez: Fruit and vegetable sales Maria Hilda M.: Street vendor Antonia Martínez: Fruit and vegetable sales Ana Gómez Cáceres: Street vendor Nilse Ramona A.; Carpentry Crisilda O. Noguera: Street vendor Bernarda R. Nuñez: Street vendor Each woman who is a member of this group has a specific job, and the loan will be used in an individual manner by each of them. The street vendors will buy more merchandise to sell such as: items for the home, sheets, flower pots, bedspreads, clothing, shoes, tablecloths, toys, etc. Those with stores will purchase products that they need for their businesses: fruits, vegetables, home remedies, cider, bread, meat, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit, vegetables, home remedies, bedspreads, sheets, items for the home, clothing, shoes, cider, bread, meat, etc.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with three children. She sells flowers, pictures and toys at a little store close to the city market. She has been in this business for 7 years. She has low competition and no low seasons for the goods she sells. Natalia is honest, open and a hard working person. The clients like her and the business goes well.

Nataliya would like to get a loan of 9,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventories. She hopes to continue this business despite difficult times that most small business owners are experiencing at the moment.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventories

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Lube es socia de Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Lube es casada, tiene 50 años, cuatro hijos, de 18, 15  13Y 10 años que está en la escuela estatal. 
Lube nació en cañete en la cacha de sus padres, desde niña ayudada en la chacra, y aprendió el manejo de la misma, con el tiempo estudio contabilidad y ahora la aplica a su negocio. Su negocio es de venta de frutas, uvas, manzanas, y palta. Que siembra en su chacra. 
Necesita un crédito de 2600 soles, para la compra de insecticida, abono.
El sueño de Lube es que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una casa, por que vive en casa de sus padres, le gustaría tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Lube is a member of San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank. Lube is married, 50 years old and has four children aged 18, 15, 13 and 10 who are at the state school. Lube was born in the city of Cañete in the home of her parents and from the time that she was a child she has helped on the ranch and learned the operation of the business; with time she studied accounting and now she applies it to her business. Her business is selling fruit- grapes, apples, and avocado, which she raises on the farm. She needs a loan of 2600 soles to purchase insecticide and fertilizer. Lube dreams of her children becoming professionals, having a house because she lives in the house of her parents, and she would like to have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Needs a loan of 2600 soles to purchase insecticide, fertilizer.

loans.name: Marlon Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Marlon Mauricio habita en el barrio San Juan de la Concepción Junto a su esposa , la esposa de don Marlon trabaja como comerciante en el mercado de Masaya , ellos tiene a su cargo una hija de tres años , la mamá de don Marlon le apoya con el cuido de la pequeña ya que el trabaja como agricultor en sus tierras y la esposa es comerciante , los planes hacia su familia es poder terminar su vivienda ya que esta le hace falta zinc , puertas y ventanas , actualmente vive en la misma casa de su mamá . El necesita un financiamiento ya que sus cultivos necesitan fertilizantes para poder tener una buena producción y con la ganancia terminar su vivienda ya que es uno de sus anhelo.
texts.en:
Mr. Marlon Mauricio lives in the neighborhood of San Juan de la Concepcion together with his wife, who works in the market in Masaya. They have a 3-year-old daughter and Marlon’s mother helps them care for her since he works as a farmer and his wife as a businesswoman. His plans for his family are to be able to finish his home—he still needs to buy zinc (for the roof), doors and windows. Currently his family lives in his mother’s house. He needs a loan because his crops need fertilizer in order to produce a lot—with the earnings from his crops he will finish his home since that is one of his dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fertilizer

loans.name: Fransisco Javier

texts.es: El Señor Francisco Javier A. Z. tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Francisco tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es el servicio de transporte de materiales de construcción. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Don Francisco inicio este negocio  por cuenta propia por que tenia que buscar la manera de salir adelante con su familia. Los propósitos de Don Francisco son de mantener a sus clientes ya que por la situación económica buscan lo que les resulta más favorable. El financiamiento solicitado por Don Francisco es para capital de trabajo por lo que comprara llantas, batería usada y combustible. Sus sueños son de darle mejoras a su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un buen lugar para el día de mañana. La cantidad que Don Francisco solicita es de C$ 10.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier A. Z. is 40 years old and married. Francisco has 3 children and they all are studying. Francisco works in construction materials transportation services; he has dedicated himself to this business for over 10 years. Francisco began this business on his own account because he had to find a way to get ahead in life with his family. Francisco aspires to keep his clients given that because of the economic situation they are looking for the most favorable conditions. The loan that Francisco has requested will be used as work capital to purchase tires, a used battery, and fuel. His dream is to improve his housing to give his children a better place for the future. Francisco is requesting 10,000 NIO.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital to purchase tires, a used battery, and fuel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair care products

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
The two persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Soun S. and her husband. Mrs. S. owns a machine to provide a service charging batteries, from which she generates an income of US$ 5 per day. Almost all of her customers are neighbors. To help meet the family's daily needs a little better, her husband drives a motor taxi. Besides their daily works, the family also are domestic rice cultivators.

Because the business of battery-charging is a profitable one and gaining more customers, S. needs to take out a loan to use as additional capital in order to purchase one more charging machine.

loans.use: To purchase one more charging machine

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita A. is from the town of Lallo, Cagayan. She is 53 years old. Leonita is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonita owns and operates a manufacturing business. Although it is not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling knives to local businesses and community members.

Leonita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI, which she will use to purchase additional inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Agasef

texts.en:
Agasef F. is a married father with three children. Agasef has been a farmer for the last 18 years. Farming is a passion for him. He practices both dairy farming and mixed-crop farming. He says he has chosen farming as a career because the produce from his farm has a ready market. His challenge at the moment is that he is not fully utilizing his land; this is because he used up all his proceeds from the last harvest to pay his children's school fees and was not able to buy the seeds and fertilizers needed to plant all his land. 

Agasef is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to be able to purchase the resources needed to plough the whole farm for the next planting season. He will purchase assorted fertilizer stock and seeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer stock and seeds

loans.name: Paula Luz

texts.es:
La señora Paula Luz C. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de productos personales atendiendo muy alegremente en el departamento de León donde oferta sus productos a diario.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar a lo inmediato un crédito debido a que  requiere de los productos personales para su venta y así satisfacer a sus clientes. Entre los productos personales que ella ofrece se encuentran pinturas de uña, espejos, hilos, aros, colonias, entre otros.
texts.en:
Paula Luz C. has a business selling personal products. She tends to her business very happily in the department of León. She sells her products there every day. The reason she has come to Ceprodel is to ask for an immediate loan. She needs the personal products to sell and satisfy her customers. Some of the personal products she sells are nail polish, mirrors, needles, earrings, and cologne among others.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal products

loans.name: Bo Bra Pa Group

texts.en:
Bernice is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. Bernice is a trader. She trades in cereals – rice.

Bernice is the leader of a trust bank group called “Bo bra pa”, meaning “Live a moral life”. Bernice is seated first on the left. The group members are hard working. Most of them are traders, food vendors and or farmers. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from Kumasi and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well.

The members have been in business for a number of years and have amassed a great deal of experiences in their businesses. However, their dream of expanding their businesses has not yet been realized. They are therefore requesting the loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses. The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Anis

texts.en: Anis is a 49-year-old single man living with his parents. He has owned a car electricronics/eletrical shop since 1988 to provide, along with his father, for living conditions for the family. After this long experience in the field, Anis is requesting to borrow $800 to renovate his shop in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Holbat

texts.ru: Урозов Холбат проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Холбат более 5 лет работает "трактористом". В данный момент момент более 6 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает бахчевые растения на продажу. Кредит просит для закупа семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить урожай.
texts.en:
Holbat U. lives in the Rumi region. He is 35 years old. He is married and has four children. Holbat has been working as a tractor driver for more than five years. At this time he has been in agriculture for more than six years. He mainly grows cereals for resale. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow a harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an additional cow.

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong T. N. was born in 1971. ( id: 010107070018). She lives in Xuan Trach, Xuan Canh, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She has two children. They are small. Her husband is a builder and she is farmer. She raises pigs and grows rice. In her free time, she looks for work. She can do anything to earn money to raise her children. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She loves amortized loans because it is consistent with the income of her family. This time, she wants to borrow 5.886.000 VND to buy food for pigs.
 About the other borrower in her group:
 Mai T. L. was born in 1954. ( id: 010107070020).  She has a child. She sells vegetabL. in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to small business.

loans.use: buy food for pigs

loans.name: Sophia's Group

texts.en: Sophia K. leads a loan group located in the town of Lugazi. She is 26 years old, married, has one child of her own and also takes care of her siblings. For the last two years, she has made a living selling fish, and is grateful that she has been able to earn enough to enjoy a decent standard of living. Sophia has applied for and received previous loans which have helped her keep her business going and even expand it by buying quality products. She will continue to work hard because she would like to earn enough money to build her own home and send her child and her siblings to school through the university level. Sophia has applied for a new loan to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Sulaimon

texts.ru: Шодиев Сулаймон проживаетв в Яванском районе. Возраст 37 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Сулаймон имеет среднее образование. Он более 5 лет занимается животноводством, откармливанием и продажей скота. Этот вид бизнеса является вторым источником дохода. Помимо этого он занимается перевозками пассажиров, предоставляет услугу такси. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Sulaimon S. lives in the Yavan district. He is 37 years old, married and has 5 children. Sulaimon has secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry, raising and selling livestock, for over 5 years. This type of business is his secondary source of income. Besides this, he is involved in passenger transportation; he provides taxi service. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Maria, ella tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera con tres hijos menores de edad, que ya están uno de ellos cursa el preescolar y el otro tiene 3 años de edad. La señora Maria tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ropa, tanto nueva como usada, los cuales vende de manera ambulante, principalmente por encargo a personas conocidas. Cabe señalar que la señora trabaja en un salón de belleza llamado salón de Belleza Luz Marina, lugar en el que utiliza para ofertar sus productos a sus compañeras de trabajo y a las personas que asisten a ese lugar. Este negocio empezó hace 5 años con muy poco capital  de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos ya que acababa de tener a su primer hijo y necesitaba brindarle una buena manutención. Ella empezó vendiendo cosméticos, después fue que empezó a invertir en ropa y en adornos, además que también vende joyas, pero están son solamente por encargos.  El crédito será invertido en la compra de vestuario, ya que se acerca la época navideña y la señora desea invertir y comprar ahora que están un poco bajos los precios. Su meta es llegar a tener un una tienda de artículos variados que pueda estar ubicada en el mercado, que brinde las facilidades económicas a ella y a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is 28 years old and is a single mother of two minor children; one of them is in preschool, and another is 3 years old. Maria has a business buying and selling clothing, new as well as used, which she sells in the streets, principally on order to people that she knows. It should be noted that she works in a beauty salon called the Belleza Luz Marina salon, where she offers her products to her co-workers and customers of the salon. This business began 5 years ago with very little working capital. She was searching for a source of alternative income, since she had just had her first child and wanted to provide for him well. She started out selling cosmetics, after that she started to invest in clothing and accessories; in addition she also sells jewelry, but only on order. This loan will be invested in the purchase of more clothing, since it is now close to the Christmas season and Maria wants to invest and buy now when the prices are a little lower. Her goal is to eventually have a store located in the market that sells a variety of items; this would make it easier for her to provide economic support for herself and her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Zorigtbaatar

texts.en:
Zorigtbaatar E. is a father of three children and currently lives with his family in Dornogobi province, one of Mongolia's southern provinces. All his children are high school students and his wife has a small business.

Zorigtbaatar owns a small truck that he uses for his transportation business. Since 2004, he has been doing some transportation for local businesses. He usually carries luggage and bags of coal for locals. This year, he is expanding the horizon of his business and has started selling what he used to transport, such as coal. He now purchases a few tons of coal from wholesalers and sells it by the bag to locals who use coal for their stoves to heat their homes.

He requests a loan to purchase more coal for his small business.

loans.use: to purchase more coal to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D. is from the town of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Julieta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 14,800 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: use to purchase fertilizer for corn production

loans.name: Sosima

texts.en:
Sosima is an expert at making rice cakes and other forms of Filipino desserts. She has been making and selling these delicacies for more than two years. Married to Virgelio R. and blessed with four children, she makes it a point to earn a decent living through her business to help them with their daily needs.

Being a member of Center for Community Transformation* for the past two years, Sosima has already received seven loans. She wants to further expand her business this Christmas season by applying for a PHP 8,000 loan so that she can use it as additional capital to buy more ingredients like sweet rice, sugar and other flavoring to make more rice cakes.

She hopes to save all her earnings so that she can have money for her family especially in times of need.

 * All CCT community partners/ lients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients like sweet rice, sugar and other flavoring to make more rice cakes.

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay B. is from the village of Talic in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old. Jay is married and he and his wife are expecting in two months. To make a living, Jay owns & operates a barber shop & sari-sari store. Jay has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jay joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jay is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for his barber shop. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jay from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his barber shop

loans.name: Hum

texts.en:
Mrs. Hum S. is 54 years old and she lives in Somphan Loeu village in Kandal province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer while the other is a farmer. She and her husband, Mr. Nget Lyv, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family.

In order to reach for a better living, Mrs. Hum S. decided to ask for a loan to add her savings and buy a piece of land to cultivate more rice. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To add her saving to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Sindy

texts.es:
Sindy, es una mujer muy honrada, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 20 años, es soltera.  Se dedica a la venta productos de belleza Avon, paralelamente se dedica a la venta de comida al paso, ambas actividades las realiza en su casa. Sindy forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Américas”, desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que fue invertido en la compra de productos Avon.
Este crédito de 300 soles, también lo piensa invertir en la compra de productos Avon para su posterior venta. La meta de Sindy es llegar a tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Sindy is a very honorable woman who lives in the district of Callería, in the Ucayali region. She is 20 years old and single. She works selling Avon beauty products, and she also sells fast food. She carries out both activities in her home. Sindy has been a member of the “Las Américas” communal bank for the past two years. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian soles, and she invested it in purchasing Avon products. She also plans to invest the current loan for 300 soles in purchasing Avon products to sell. Sindy's goal is to eventually open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing Avon products to sell

loans.name: Mpangango Alg Group A, Kihihi

texts.en:
K. Joseph is the gentleman at the top right and he also appears in the group photo. He is a 68-year-old, very strong, hardworking man and is married with eight children. He also takes care of orphans.

Joseph has an animal drug shop in Kateete trading centre and, since Kihihi is mostly known for agriculture and animal keeping, Joseph is in business. He ensures that his products are of good quality hence not adversely affecting his clients’ farms.

Joseph needs a loan to be able to increase the stock of drugs in his shop so that he is able to make more profits compared to what he now earns. He is so grateful that at least he has somewhere to get some money from, even as a loan, since capital had been an issue in his business.

loans.use: To restock his animal clinic with more drugs

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 45 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos independientes y con profesión.

Las ganas de salir adelante, gracias a su esfuerzo y anhelo por iniciativa propia, emprendió su negocio de venta de Salchipapas, ubicada en las afueras de su casa un espacio amplio y limpio, exclusivamente para sus clientes, vende a partir de las 6.30 Pm, ella les atiende con el carisma y sonrisa que le caracteriza  . Con su primer préstamo de 300 Nuevos Soles compró su carrito salchipapero, platos descartables y otros.  

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes para sus preparados cómo: Sacos de papa, hot dog (Salchicha),  verduras cómo, repollo y tomate,   plátanos en racimos y frutas regionales para sus refrescos, así mismo utensilios de cocina para brindar  un servicio de calidad a sus clientes. 

Juanita como le dicen  de cariño, Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con su negocio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Juana, 45, is a member of the “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids) communal bank, which is in Tarapoto, San Martín province, San Martín department. She’s married and has three children, all of whom are independent and with their own professions. Her wish to get ahead in life through her own efforts and initiative led her to into Salchipapa (a dish made of fried potatoes with hotdog sausage) sales. Her food stand is located outside her home in a spacious, clean area that is for the exclusive use of her customers. She opens for business at 6:30pm; she tends to her customers with her characteristic charisma and a smile for everyone. She used her first, 300 new sol, loan to buy a salchipapa cart, disposable dishes and other items. With this, 3,000.00 new sol, loan she will buy necessary ingredients for their preparation, like: sacks of potatoes, hotdogs (sausages), vegetables like cabbage and tomato, bunches of bananas, regional fruits for her beverages, as well as kitchen utensils in order to provide good customer service. Juanita, as she is affectionately called, feels strong to continue working. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her reach her goals and making her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: José Noel

texts.es:
El Señor José Noel Z. Q., tiene un taller de reparación de vehículo ubicado a tres cuadras del Mercado Santa Ana ahí el repara todo tipo de vehículo el señor Z. Q. es casado tiene dos hijos  que mantener y su esposa.
Anteriormente el señor Z. era trabajador de un taller y dependía de un salario luego decidio poner el su propio negocio ahorrando y llegar a obtener un capital de C$ 8,000.00 desde hace 25 años que puso su negocio y con este capital compro materiales para su taller, ahora tengo bastante mercadería para mi negocio repuestos para carros, tiene cuatro años de trabajar con ceprodel y de estos financiamientos ha podido hacer cada vez mas grande mi taller tener mas inventario y acondicionar mi hogar.
texts.en:
Noel Z. Q. has a workshop where he repairs vehicles located 3 blocks from the Santa Ana Market. There he repairs all types of vehicles. Señor Z. Q. is married; he has a wife and two children to support. Previously he was an employee in a repair shop and he used to depend on a salary. Later he decided to save in order to have his own business, gradually accumulating capital of $8,000 Nicaraguan cordobas. He started this business 25 years ago, and with this capital he bought materials for his shop. Now he has a substantial amount of merchandise for his business including spare parts for cars. He has worked with CEPRODEL for 4 years, and with these financings he has been able to grow his business, increase his inventory, and fix up his house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for vehicles to have in his business

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth E. is from the village of Camp Phillips, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old, is widowed, and has six school-aged children. Beth owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling processed food like longganisa (pork sausage flavored with indigenous spices), hotdogs and more in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Beth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Beth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 73  años y tiene seis hijos. Su principal actividad económica  es vender locería y plastiqueria en el mercado modelo de calca. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar ollas, sartenes y muchas cosas más.  Ella nos cuenta que su negocio bajo porque  no hay clientes debido a que el puente de la ciudad de Pisaq se cayó por causa del aumento el caudal del rio Vilcanota y por lo tanto no hay pasada para la ciudad de Calca.
   
Bernardina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.   La ciudad de Calca se encuentra ubicado a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Bernardina is a member of the Communal Bank “Valle Sagrado” (Sacred Valley), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 73 years old and has six children. Bernandina sells earthenware and plastic containers at the standard market in Calca. She has worked in this business for several years and has done very well. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase pots, pans, and other items. She says business is slow because there are no customers since the bridge in the city of Pisaq collapsed due to overflow from the Vilcanota River. Therefore, no one is able to reach the city of Calca.

Bernardina is grateful for this opportunity that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments on time. The city of Calca is located an hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pots, pans, and other items

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena  B. es socia del banco comunal  El Cisne, vive en la comunidad  San Isidro en  la parroquia El Valle ubicada al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, colindando con el área urbana de la cuidad. Limita al norte con la parroquia Paccha, al este con la parroquia Santa Ana, al sur con la parroquia Tarqui, y al oeste con la parroquia Turi y la ciudad de Cuenca. LA  agricultura y  ganadería son las actividades tradicionales de los pobladores de éste sector, además  tiene como atractivo turístico  la laguna de Cochapamba  llena de totoras y su hermoso paisaje, Rayoloma un sitio ideal para poder admirar en su gran extensión a la ciudad de Cuenca entre otros.

Nuestra socia tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos que se encuentran de 17, 14, 12, 10, y 2 años, su primer hijo no estudia y ayuda en las labores de la casa, su segundo hijo estudia en la secundaria  y el de 10 años estudia en una escuela de la comunidad, su esposo es de profesión albañil, gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

María Elena se dedica a la venta de ollas y sartenes pero solo los días domingos recorriendo con sus artículos en su sector desde hace cuatro años, también cría animales como gallinas, vacas y la leche que obtiene de ellas es para el consumo de su hogar. 
Se encuentra nueve años trabajando con los prestamos del bankito y los créditos le  han beneficiado tanto en su hogar como en su negocio, con el dinero que recibirá del credito solicitado comprará ollas, sartenes, etc. para abastecer su negocio.

Su meta es llegar a tener un capital propio para  incrementar su negocio con menaje de cocina y otros articulos para el hogar.
texts.en:
María Elena B. is a member of the comunal bank El Cisne. She lives in the communityho f San Isidro in the parish of El Valle, located to the southeast of the city of Cuenca, adjoining the urban area of the city. It is bordered to the north by the parish of Paccha, to the east by Santa Ana, to the south by Tarqui, and to the west by Turi and the city of Cuenca. Agriculture and cattle are the traditional activities of the people of this area, and it also has the tourist attraction of Lake Cochapamba, full of reeds and its beautiful landscape, and Rayoloma, an ideal place to admire its reach to the city of Cuenca (among other attractions). Our member is 37-years-old, married, and has 5 children ages 17, 14, 12, 10, and 2 years. Her first child isn’t in school, and helps with household chores. Her second is in high school, and the 10-year-old attends a community school. Her husband is a bricklayer, and thanks to their combined work, they have managed to build their own home. María Elena sells pots and pans, but only on Sundays. She has been doing this for four years all around the area where she lives. She also raises livestock such as chickens, cows (whose milk is for her family’s personal consumption). She has been working with Ibankito for nine years, and the loans she has received have helped her in her home, as well as her business. With the money she receives from the current loan she’s requesting, she will buy pots, pans, etc. to grow her business. Her goal is to have her own capital to be able to grow her business by adding other household items to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pots and pans

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald R. is from the village of Gosi, Tuguegarao City. He is 39 years old. Ronald is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ronald operates a family member's business providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport services. Ronald has been engaged in this business for more than six years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ronald joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ronald has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. Ronald is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ronald from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Yonasani

texts.en: Yonasani is a young man, age 25, who is hardworking with a zeal to succeed in his endeavors. He operates a retail shop in the small town of Bundibugyo, Uganda. He says he started off selling paraffin (kerosene) after which he was able to establish his retail shop which has now been in existence for five years. He says rent for the premises is still a challenge as it is high and ever increasing (as is the case in many parts of the country). Yonasani, like many retailers, would like to move into a wholesale business one day. This is his third loan cycle from HOFOKAM and Yonasani intends to use the loan funds to purchase sacks of sugar and liquor for reselling in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar and liquor for reselling in his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, cooking oil, potatoes, cocoa, sugar, soy meat, barley in grains, soft drinks, gatorade, bags, etc.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 40 years old and is married with four children aged 1, 6, 8 and 10 years old.

Oliva struggles in selling soft drinks, pastries (cakes) and boiled eggs. She has an experience of five years in this business and the hours of her business are from the morning hours until late in the evening.

Oliva, after realizing that her clientele was increasing day by day to the extent that she is not able to meet their demand, needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. She really hopes that it will allow her to to expand her business a lot through adding more drinks and pastries.

With these additional goods, Oliva will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to continue taking care of her family and start saving for a better business future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of drinks and some pastries as well as boiled eggs

loans.name: Islam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité ISLAM a vu le jour la veille de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA COKI 1 en decembre 2009. Il regroupe 12 femmes entrepreneurs, généreuses dans l’effort et qui ont en commun le culte du travail. Des femmes qui gagnent honnêtement leur vie.

Madame Ndèye Mané DIAKHATE, à l’extrême droite de la photo, sac à la main portant des lunettes de vue est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge.
 
Elle fait une activité de restauration : le matin elle vend le petit déjeuner (café, pain, lait, mayonnaise, niébé etc.) et le soir elle vend du « café Touba »

Avec son crédit elle va augmenter son achat en provisions pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire. 

Son objectif est de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins personnels et aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille (santé, nourriture et scolarité des enfants)
texts.en:
The ISLAM solidarity group was created in December 2009 on the eve of the inauguration of the SANTHIABA COK1 Banc Villageois. It consists of 12 businesswomen who give of themselves generously and share the cult of work. They are women who earn an honest living. Mrs. Ndèye Mané DIAKHATE is the head of the group. She is at the far right of the photo, holding a bag and wearing eyeglasses. She is 32 years old, married and the mother of five children in her care. She runs a restaurant where she serves breakfast in the morning (coffee, bread, milk, mayonnaise, black-eyed peas, etc.) and “café Touba” (a traditional coffee beverage) in the evening. With her loan, she plans to increase her stocks of groceries to better satisfy her customers and boost her profits. Her goal is to be able to support herself and help her husband with the family’s needs (health care, food and tuition for the children).

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Elias;  El tiene 32 años de edad,  es soltero y  se dedica a prestar servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja para ahorrar y compra su casa, el socio necesita ahora el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.  El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Patron de Santiago". This bank is located in Santiago district which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. The member is Sr. Elias. He is 32 years old, single, and has a taxi service. He works in order to save and buy his house. He needs a loan now so that he can invest in maintaining his vehicle. The member is grateful for and values the loan and promises to complete the repayments in the set time period.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.

loans.name: Rojo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Rojo lo integran Sandra del Socorro J. V., Eugenia M. y Veronica Ninoska H. M.. Sandra, quien es la coordinadora, se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos de manera ambulante; Eugenia en su casa de habitación vende comida pero a la vez se dedica a la venta de zapatos y Veronica vende zapatos y cosméticos en los alrededores de su comunidad.
texts.en:
The “Rojo” (Red) communal bank’s members are: Sandra del Socorro J. Velásquez, Eugenia Martínez & Verónica Ninoska Hernández Martínez. Sandra, group Coordinator, sells clothing and cosmetics. Eugenia sells prepared meals at home but also sells shoes and Verónica sells shoes and cosmetics around the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Everth Omar

texts.es: Everth Omar tiene 41 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería y servicios de fotos. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que se levanta temprano todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche pues la mayoría de clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, por lo que se encarga de ofrecer un excelente servicio. El sueña con obtener más ganancias para mantener a su negocio que es muy importante. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de  golosinas, refrescos, galletas, pan, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en:
41-year old Everth Omar earns his living running a grocery and photography store. He’s had the business for more than ten years. Every morning he gets up early and works from 7 am to 9 pm. As the majority of his customers are neighbours, friends, and relatives, he wants to provide them with excellent service. Everth’s dream is to make more money so he can continue in his business which is very important to him. The loan he is seeking will be used to buy candies, soft drinks, cookies, bread, detergent, and beans etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gusman

texts.es:
Gusman es un padre de familia de 62 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa en el sector Santa Clara del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a más de veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la ganadería, el cría vacas en un corral ubicado cerca a su vivienda y comercializa la leche que produce con un acopiador de la zona. El alimenta a su ganado con alimento concentrado y pastos naturales. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad el se encarga de sustentar la economía de su familia.

Gusman desea adquirir una nueva vaca para poder ampliar su negocio y percibir mas ganancias. Durante los últimos meses ha estado ahorrando dinero para lograr su objetivo y actualmente solo le hacen falta 2000 nuevos soles para conseguir su meta. Por ello ha decido solicitar por primera vez un crédito con Edpyme Alternativa.

Gusman es una persona tranquila y responsable. Durante todo este tiempo el ha vivido de la agricultura y gracias a esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. Las personas que le concen le consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Gusman is a 62 year old father who lives with his wife in the Santa Clara sector of the Pítipo district, an agricultural zone located in the Ferreñafe province, more than 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He’s been working in agriculture, especially livestock, since he was very young, and raises cattle in a corral located near his home.  He sells the milk to a distributor in the zone.  He feeds his cattle with concentrated feed and natural grass and supports his family financially with the income that he generates from this activity.

Gusman wants to buy a new cow so that he can expand his business and generate more income.  He’s been saving money over the past few months, so that he can achieve this goal.  He is only 2,000 PEN ($725) short of achieving his goal, so he has decided to request his first loan through Edpyme Alternativa.

Gusman is a stable and responsible person.  He’s lived off of agriculture all this time and thanks to this, has managed to get his children ahead.  People who know him consider him to be trustworthy.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is from the Barangay of Burgos, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  She is 27 years of age, married and blessed with one child. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a business with Avon, a cosmetic dealer. Engaged in her business for five years already, Annalyn earns approximately PHP 3000 a month.

On December 21, 2008, Annalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. An active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out the rural communities, she has repaid her previous loan of PHP 5000 and is now requesting her fifth loan of PHP 7000 to be used as additional capital for her business.  Annalyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, save for future use, make loan repayments, and pay for her children’s education, insurance and possible business expansion.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To acquire additional capital for her Avon personal products business

loans.name: Agadadash

texts.en: Agadadash T. is a 23 year old man who raises cattle in the small village of Agsu region. He started his business in 2008 with the help of AqroInvest and KIVA. He purchased two cows with the first loan and now he has applied for a new one. Agadadash is married.  Cattle breeding is the only source income for his family. He applied for 1,000 AZN to buy more cattle.

loans.use: Purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Khuon's Group

texts.en:
Seven people  for this village loan group. They are located in Kaoh Krabei village in Kandal province. This village loan, selected Mrs. Khuon S., a 31 year old married woman, as the village bank president. Each member of this village will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Khuon S. earns her living by selling Khmer noodle and congee in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Orm Khom, 36 years old, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from being a farmer, he also works as wedding chef. With their occupations, they still do not earn enough income to support their family condition. So in order to increase their income and improve the family, Mrs. Khuon S. would like to ask for a loan to buy bananas and flowers to sell for her new business. This couple has two children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy bananas and flowers to resell for her new business. .

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. lives in the Masanafu Lugala neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, two of whom are in school the other one is two months old. She also takes care of additional family members (her parents).

Aisha has a business of selling second hand clothes (jeans). She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Aisha sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Aisha has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes jeans.

The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include seasonality and ever increasing prices for second hand clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes herself. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes (jeans).

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un S. is 34 years old, married, and has three children.  The family lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-ankorean temples.  She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. S. is a farmer and raises animals, earning an income of $2.50 per day. One of her children is employed as a construction worker, earning $3.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend $55 on food, $10 on electricity supply, and $23 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en:
This borrower, Riyad, is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has 3 children.

In 2003, Riyad bought a big generator and he started providing his local community with electricity. Every month his customers pay him a fixed fee.  He is well known in his local area and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $1900 loan to build a room for the generator. He is planning to expand his business and increase his revenue.

loans.use: Build a room for the generator

loans.name: Farzana Ghulam Jaffer's Group

texts.en:
Farzana G. J. is married to G. J., who works for a private organization for a low wage. She has given birth to three sons, all of whom are below ten years of age. The family lives in Multan, one of the biggest cities in Pakistan and known for its shrines. Farzana has been living there with her family in the neighborhood of Kher Abad in a two-room brick house for the past ten years. When not working, she gives all of her time to her children and husband. She is very active and performs her daily household work well.

Farzana is a seamstress who receives orders from neighboring clients. She has been in business for over five years. She is an expert in her work and can sew designer and non-designer clothes very easily. She sews clothes with utmost concentration and gives her best to each dress. Her clients are very satisfied with her work and give her regular orders every month. She does this work to share the family’s financial burden with her husband.

Farzana has applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva’s partner Asasah to improve her sewing business. With the loan she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her continue to produce quality work and make more income. Farzana is very hopeful that such an investment will bring good profits to her and that she will be able to provide a better standard of living for her family.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah passbook) is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sreyleav

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyleav S., 26 years old, and her husband, Mr. Samat Son, 29 years old, have been married since 2005 and have a young daughter. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sreyleav sells fried cricket in her village. Her husband is a driver. She hopes to expand her business, so she is asking for a loan of $500.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 48 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Reside en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad caracterizada por la humildad de sus habitantes,  que se ubica más de 50 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Realiza esta actividad en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella cría animales menores y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general. Su negocio la ayuda en el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Desea invertir su capital en la compra de más animales y en los alimentos balanceados para ellos. Con la inversión del préstamo, espera poder aumentar su margen de utilidad. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 48 year old mother.  She lives with her husband and their two children in her own house.  She lives in the Lagunas district, a community that is known for the humility of its inhabitants.  It is located over 50 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She has been raising and selling animals for ten years.  She does this in the back of her house.  She raises small animals.  When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the businessmen in the zone and to the general public.  Her business helps her to support her family.

She wants to use the money to buy more animals and balanced feed for them.  By investing the loan she hopes to be able to increase her profit margin.  Therefore, she believes it is advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 soles.

loans.use: To buy animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Hermenegilda   Augusta

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Hermenegilda ; la socia tiene 50 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas, también cuenta con un local amplio el cual lo alquila para los diferentes compromisos que se realizan como matrimonios, fiestas de 15 años fiestas de promoción entre otros, a la vez la socia trabaja en una joyería por el centro de la ciudad siendo estas actividades que realiza para mantener a su familia que son su motivo de seguir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento para sus animales y para algunos arreglos en su local.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This is Sra. Hermenegilda. She is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Hermenegilda raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She also has a banquet hall that she rents out for various events such as weddings, quinceañeras, graduations, and other occasions. Hermenegilda works at a jewelry store in the center of the city. She engages in all of these business activities so that she can support her family in hopes of moving them forward.

Hermenegilda is requesting a loan to purchase feed for her animals and make a few repairs to her banquet hall. She is happy with this loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Purchase animal feed & make repairs to her banquet hall

loans.name: Gulnar's Group

texts.ru:
Животноводы всей страны бьют тревогу. В последние четыре года цены на корма почти утроились. 

Гульнар Нуржанова, 56, лидер этой группы. Она также стала жертвой этих экономических событий. 12 лет назад на стартовый капитал в 12 000 сомов, она приобрела двух Теленков. Целое десятилетие перепродажа скота двигалась стабильным ходом. Однако последние годы скачок в ценах на сено из- за погодных условий и дефицита воды усложнил ситуацию для животноводов. Гульнар и ее группа очень благодарны Киве за кредит. Он значительно помогает ей и членам ее группы выйти из затруднительного финансового положения. Целью данного кредита Гульнар определила покупку еще одного теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. 


        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
texts.en:
Animal husbandry workers of the entire country have sounded an alarm. In the past four years the prices for fodder have almost tripled.

Gulnar N. is 56 years old, a leader of this group. She also fell victim to these economic events. Twelve years ago her starting capital was 12000 soms when she bought two calves. For the entire decade the resale of the cattle was stable. However in the past years the hike in prices on hay due to the weather conditions and water shortages made the situation for animal husbandry workers difficult.

Gulnar and her group are very grateful to Kiva for the loan. It is significantly helping her and other members of the group to alleviate themselves from the difficult financial situation. Gulnar has defined he purpose of this loan as for purchase of another calf to increase headcount of cattle.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 33-year-old man, married with no children, working as a car painter. He lives in Beirut and works in his shop. His father opened the shop in 1970 and Mhamad has worked there since 1990. He provides good quality work and his clients are mainly friends and neighbors.

This is Mhamad's seventh loan cycle. He reports that the previous loans helped him fulfill the needs of the shop. He is now requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy extra paint, tools and gas for his store. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more tools, gas and paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy local food for her market

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin K., 28, is a resident of Siem Reap province. She is a vendor who sells items such as pork and beef in the busy local market, earning an average of $5 a day. She is married to Mr. Chhorm Krouch, 36, a butcher, and they have three school-aged children. Chin K. would like to request a loan from Kiva to rebuild a new hedge which has broken. She hopes to use the remainder to purchase more meat to sell. This will provide her with additional profit, which she will use to better meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to rebuild a broken hedge and to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.name: Olive
