texts.en: Olive is a mother of 2 children who are ages 1 ½   and 4 years old. They are both not yet in school. She sells foodstuffs, such as sorghum, beans and coffee, and she works with her husband. She has run this business for 5 years and it has enabled her to meet her family needs. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs and hence expand her business. With the profits and with her savings, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina, 33 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She manages a motorcycle transport business together with her husband. They have operated this business for almost two years. Gina earns 3,500 PHP monthly. She's asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase materials such as spare parts needed for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She also plans to purchase some hogs to raise from the income generated from the motorcycle business. She would like to continue taking loans and hopes Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Janeth Maribel

texts.es:
Janeth es una madre de familia de 37 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Chepén - La Libertad. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal el comercio, la agricultura y el turismo.  

Desde hace 5 años Janeth se dedica a la venta diaria de menestra cocida y especias, en el mercado de la ciudad donde vive, tiene su propia clientela quien se siente satisfecha con los productos que ofrece. 

Janeth ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para realizar algunos arreglos en su vivienda y con los ingresos que obtenga con las ventas de sus productos podrá cubrir su crédito y podrá tener más comodidades en su casa para su familia.

Janeth es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y honesta que lo único que quiere es sacar a su familia adelante en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Janeth is a 37-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children. They reside in their own home in the District of Chepén – La Libertad. This area is known for its businesses in the retail, agriculture, and tourism sectors.

Janeth has been selling cooked stew and spices at the city market for five years. She has her own customers who are pleased with the products she offers.

Janeth is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 so that she can make a few repairs to her home. The income that she earns from the sale of her products will cover this loan and allow her to acquire more home furnishings for her family.

Janeth is a responsible, hardworking, and honest woman. The only thing she wants is for her family, especially her children, to move forward.

loans.use: to pay for home repairs.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is married with four children. Her eldest son has a sofa cover making & fitting business. The next to him has a mobile phone shop. The third does a job in a bakery and the youngest one studies in 7th standard. 

Khalida herself is a housewife as well as a businesswoman. Along with her household work, she sells bangles to her community ladies and for babies. Her collection of bangles is famous among her clients. Her income allows her to share the financial burden with her husband. 

Her husband is involved in fruit selling as well as a grocery store business. He sells fruit primarily and secondly, he gives time to his grocery store. Both of his businesses gives him good profits but now he wants to invest money in his grocery store business for its further expansion. 

Therefore, Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for his grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put in his store for selling. 

Khalida is hopeful that her husband’s business will expand further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Degg Ndiggal Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 22juin 2010. Le groupe est  constitué de dix sept femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Awa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de sucre, du thé et de l'huile de palme. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on June 22, 2010. The group is made up of 17 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their primary occupation is small business.

Mrs. Awa, who is raising her hand at right in the photo, is the group's leader. She is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of five. She also cares for two other children who were entrusted to her by their parents.

She occupies herself with the sale of sugar, tea and palm oil. She has a solid background in this line of business, as she has been practicing it for several years.

This loan will allow Mrs. Awa to strengthen her capital and to better grow her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy sugar, tea and palm oil

loans.name: Lieum

texts.en:
Lieum, 44 year old, is a basket seller. Her husband is a car driver, and their income is $10 per day. She has four children; three are studying, and the other one is a security guard with an income of $2 per day. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $20 on electricity, $50 on school fees and $30 on transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy baskets to sell near her village. Her family has been doing this business for a long time and they've been successful, so she wants to extend it to sell more kinds of baskets when she has enough money to do it.

loans.use: To buy baskets to sell near her village.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 30 years old, married, and blessed with a two-year-old child. To earn a living for his family, he has been operating a medical clinic. He has been running the business for three years and has employed two people.  

Peter has managed to grow his business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya. He dreams of opening other business outlets in the future. He needs 70,000 KES to buy medicine.

loans.use: To buy medicine
